Review: I have kind of thought that the MCU movies were falling into this formula after seeing black panther but this movie nailed it! This is what I wanted and was craving, stakes! Actual stakes! Characters "dying" and maybe not all of them will come back because if they did then this movie will mean nothing!

Author: chetanhasallmoney
Review: It is very excessive at points, especially in regard to the fight in Wakanda before Thanos enters, it feels very lifeless and bleak. The stone powers are very inconsistent as Thanos could have easily defeated Iron Man and the other avengers on Titan but still a good fight scene. The worst thing about this movie is that it kills half the population of the world and very important characters and brings them back in the next film for the bank. No consequences and no losses. Why will you kill Loki,the best character in MCU (in my opinion), when you can kill so many idiot superheroes? Stupid choice.

Author: Rayofsun71
Review_Title: Boy do I wish you could rate it higher
Review: This movie deserves all the positive reviews that it's getting. It stays true to what Marvel is and it only makes me more excited for Avengers 4. Nothing wil be the same. So worth the time. Will absolutely have to see it again. 10/10.

Author: danielhastings-43236
Review_Title: Easily Marvel's best movie, contrasting popular opinion.
Review: Look, whether you look at this film as a marvel fan, like me, or like a critic, like me, you can't deny that this movie subverted your expectations. This movie something very interesting which I haven't seen before; making the character who appears to be the villain be the protagonist. From the very start of this film, Thanos had been attempting (and succeeding) in obtaining all six infinity stones. This movie wasn't about the Avengers, or Tony Stark, it was about Thanos, the protagonist whom nobody wanted to see succeed. But as many movies do, the protagonist wins in the end, and we all leave the theater crying and upset about this. This isn't my favorite movie of all time (that title goes to The Dark Knight), but it most certainly is in my top 10. A must-see spectacle that will truely last throughout the ages, Avengers Infinity War will always have a place in my heart, and in other hearts too.

Author: boydmatta
Review_Title: Very entertaining, but unfortunately has some flaws
Review:
Starting with the positives, I thought the film was an overall blast. I was engaged and entertained throughout, and never was I losing my attention. I felt there was clear motivation for the villain, who (unlike most MCU villains), had some personality behind him. The acting and filmography were great, however it's the narrative that for me, restricted this movie to an 8, rather than a 10.
For me, no film should be worthy of a 10, if it includes a disposable CGI army. The first avengers had the Chitauri, the second Ultron bots, and this one, some mad 4-armed aliens. They had no backstory or motive, and only provided action sequences. There was no emotional connection, and I was disappointed that Marvel has allowed this to happen in every single Avengers film to date. 
Furthermore, this film is unable to stand on its own. Having seen most MCU films, I knew who each of the pre-established characters was, their motives, personalities, etc. However, trying to learn who everyone was from the film alone leaves a lot to be desired. I know people will argue that more or less nobody is going to see solely Infinity War, but it just doesn't hold up as a well as other franchises, where later films do not require the rest to stand on their own - e.g. Back to the Future, The Dark Knight trilogy, etc. People who haven't gone to see every Marvel film may be lost, and those who I went with didn't have any investment in some of the characters. 
I would also give the film a lot of credit for balancing the characters as well as they did, but having characters who are very light hearted , mixing with those who were quite dark, and jumping between them felt disorientating. Ultimately this was the curse of the MCU expanding so much, but other films have juggled multiple groups of heroes' quests much better - e.g. The Lord of the Rings trilogy. 
Hulk's disappearance was also poorly done. Though I understood that being beaten by Thanos would have reduced his confidence, it doesn't fit his character in the past. When Thor blasted Hulk in Ragnarok, Hulk simply became angrier that he was losing. Hulk also refused to come back, despite Thanos not actually being there - referring to the last fight - so why didn't he come back then, when he knew he could beat one of Thanos' henchmen. Also, when the Hulk lost to the Hulkbuster, nothing stopped Banner hulking-out again. The film only needed a brief dialogue between Banner and Hulk, so explain why the Hulk was afraid to come out. It's absence irritated me, and undermined the character. 
Finally, Thanos' quest has been overdone in the past, and didn't carry the same weight, due to more logical alternatives being easily plausible within the film. For the former, the (now exhausted) plot of the villain wiping out huge numbers of people, for the benefit of those who survive, is an easy way for scriptwriters to justify their villain's actions. However, Thanos needed something more original. Batman Begins and Watchmen are both relatively recent superhero movies, that had this plot (though in the first, the villain fails, and in the second, the villain succeeds). For me, this narrative became stale after the first Kingsman film did it. Now for the latter, the powers of even only half of the infinity stones, would undermine Thanos' entire plan. The abilities of the reality stone, means that it can transform matter. Therefore, it should be able to transform any 'waste' matter, into food. This would give the universe far more longevity than just killing half of its occupants, and would be better morally. Thanos would be more than capable of this. 
Though the film was great fun, and I would definitely recommend it, Thanos' objective is incorrect and pointless, Hulk is essentially removed from the film with no explanation,it has some pacing and tonal issues, and the CGI monsters was bland. Although many of my complaints will be seen as nitpicks by the average movie-goer

Author: virginiatide
Review_Title: This film needed better character balance and less silliness
Review: No fan of a character or a group of characters is gonna be happy if they feel like their favs are given the short end of the stick, so the IMO appalling reduction of Team Cap/Bucky and even any real dynamic between T'Challa and Bucky - and I mean not a sentence - is gonna go over well. Especially Team Cap hasn't been around since 2016. This film reduced beloved and fascinating characters to glorified cameos. So that's a thing; and for me THAT was awful. Pretty bitter about that.

Author: robinsonaustin-07490
Review: Infinity War. There are many things to say about the film, but for the most part, I liked it. I liked several of the character interactions, some that were actually genuinely surprising. Thanos himself was also a great villain to add onto the current line up of MCU villains. There were some genuinely funny moments in the film, but the ending will leave a massive impact on you. To explain it, let's just say that when my Dad and I left the showing of the movie, practically no one exiting from the showing of the movie discussed it. It is genuinely an emotional roller coaster, with how the ending credits seem to paint the illusion to an obituary, or even a list of casualties. I knew what the end result was going to be because of the source material, but I wasn't prepared. A child sitting behind us was actually crying at the ending of the film as well.

Author: blackwidowis7cool
Review:
Having known exactly what happened at the end of this movie, I was uncertain for a while about watching it because I figured it wouldn't have the same 'wow' effect on me like it did on all the movie-goers that went in not having a clue about what was in store for them.
Thankfully, though, I had forgotten a couple crucial details, so was still awed by the whole thing.
It has a solid and VERY well-written plot that conveys a perfect balance between dark and light i.e. - manages to convey it's heavy and serious plot with the perfect amount of humour, which is enough to keep it from becoming too depressing and not too much that it can be accused of not taking itself too seriously.
The acting is solid - everyone steps up their game and really gets you involved in their stories and the main story.
I listened to this at night, and so as not to disturb the rest of my family, I had the sound down very low, so I couldn't hear the musical score very well, but the little bit I did catch was haunting, beautiful and evoked many emotions, so I'm fully intending to sit down at some point very soon and rewatch it with sound.
The climax is awesome - very tense, emotional, and just shocking. As I mentioned earlier, I had forgotten a couple crucial (VERY crucial) details, so when I watched it, it made me just as shocked and just as horrified at particular scenes as the characters.
And I applaud the cast for their performances during their characters' deaths or their characters' horror at seeing other people without any warning just disintegrate. They really sold it there and, while I can't imagine what they must have felt watching other people die (especially with Tony - everyone with him died), I really cried. It's a very sobering moment.
Infinity War is my current favourite of the MCU movies that I've seen so far and the best of all time, in my humble opinion.
It has one of the greatest plot twists of all time and really delivers on all the years building up to this one horrifying moment.
Can't wait to sit down and watch Endgame!
Can't emphasise this enough - go watch it!!!!

Review: Great film with plenty of action, adventure and did i mention action packed ? . Yes this is a film for the saturday night roster enjoy

Author: SpoodermanDerp
Review: Marvel's Infinity War soars as it gives us what the franchise has promised ever since 2012's The Avengers. Out of all of this film's ambitions, the most impressive feat remains to be on delivering a Thanos that is menacing, intriguing, and astoundingly tragic. This leads to a film that is epic at its core, yet emotional and patient in its execution.

Author: twh-00286
Review:
Was expecting a lot and got more than I expected. 
Really great scenes, expanding the whole universe, bringing in aspects I've never seen before. All that was really cool. 
The disappointing things- the major blunders come in the form of emotion overriding better judgement at clutch times. Just too trite and set-up. Thanos himself seems to be the best developed and even likable character in this movie. At least he can stifle his emotions to do what he feels he must. 
The rest of the characters, with the exception of Dr. Strange, Thor, and Stark, seem confused by their emotions and let them dictate how they act and inevitably the end of the half of life in the universe. Yes, they are "human", but some aspects just seemed too derived and needless. At the end Thanos wins as his resolve is strongest, not because he is the strongest.

Author: toonarly
Review_Title: Awesome movie. Lots of action. Thanos is ultimate badass
Review: I have followed the entire marvel universe from the first captain America movie through the various tv series in chronological order. I even have the entire universe in 1080p in chronological order on a 4 tb portable hard drive. I add the newer movies into the order as they become available. Thanos has always been in the background determined to get the infinity stones. He shows up in guardians 1 for one of them but fails to get it. Here he goes all out and I mean he's all in on his quest here. He's driven beyond measure in this first part of the infinity stone movies. The infinity movies have both been made, just the second one won't be released till 2019 or if marvel decides earlier. I'm hoping for a 2018 Christmas showing before captain marvel shows in 2019. I have seen this one twice in one weekend, first in 3D at IMAX which was well worth it. Actually jumped at a few things flying about. Then again on a high def digital screen. Both were great and highly recommended. Why I gave it a 9 Star rather than a 10 was the joking inference to Jesus which I found very inappropriate and not necessary, a few in the theater grimaced at the comment. Too bad. I'm sure Muslims would have been offended if Mohammad was inferred. Anyway , other than that a fun and enjoyable ride.

Author: Exiled_Universe
Review_Title: ONE OF THE BEST MARVEL MOVIES!!!!!!
Review: Everything about this movie was great and fit in with the whole Marvel Universe perfectly. At no point in the film was anything boring and every second of the movie was heart pounding and very exciting. It is very better than the first two Avenger movies and it is also very different from the first two due to the fact that most of the movie takes place in space and other planets which im fine with, but im used to seeing Avengers movies take place on Earth similarly to the first two but its still amazing nonetheless. One slight problem that i had and keep in mind this is little to not even a small problem; some intense fight scenes and action sequences have too many things going on at once and so many characters on screen at once which is cool, but it can distract you and confuse you but i learned to just go with it, like i said, it can either be good or bad, and i think its a little bit of both. Thanos was great and a great villain for the film and did an excellent job at being and acting like one. Another personal problem was that im watching all the Avengers movies (4 movies) in a row and it gets kinds confusing here since i haven't seen doctor strange or guardians of the galaxy, but i get the whole jyst and at least i know who they are; it might have been a stupid choice, but its too late now anyway. A lot of new character to sink in; and also the ending could have been better, i know theres Endgame and its supposed to be a cliffhanger but for me it wasn't strong enough. Great movie nonetheless!!!

Author: freewillyfan
Review: Avengers Infinity War is an amazing movie that brings all the Avengers and Guardians of the Galaxy into one film. This is a very fast passed film with fantastic action and character interactions. The villain, Thanos, is the best in the MCU. this film is funny yet tragic at the same time. The cast is terrific and the CGI is good for the most part. At times it gets a little poor unfortunately. Having half the heroes die at the end was very shocking and a great way to go into the next film, even though I know they weren't going to stay dead. Overall a fantastic film.

Author: elric300
Review: Absolutely my favorite marvel movie. Wonderful acting, action , comedy & drama all mixed together like never before. Highly recommend to watch in IMAX!!!

Review: For the first time, thanos presented himself to the audience as a whole. In this movie, he showed a very comprehensive personality, and even what he said was correct in a sense. He did bear the pressure and pain that outsiders could not understand. As he put it, he could "retire" after he had completed this mission, not to achieve his own goals and make himself happy, but to help maintain the order of the universe and his healthy development. It is true that there is no absolute right or wrong in the world, but with the participation of human nature, there will be a lot more correct answers.

Author: shayaanashah
Review: (Spoiler Free) What an ending! Great portrayal of Thanos! Not what I was expecting at all, this isn't a masterpiece

Author: fotiskonfotkon-76994
Review:
The hype for Avengers Infinity War was truly real. The expectations were to the roof with this one, but I'm afraid we all did a huge mistake on what to expect. Can a 150 minute movie deliver on the level of these expectations and hype? Well it can't, but this movie does it's best.This film is completely different than any other MCU film, and any other film in general, and you will find that out when you see it for yourself. You must be happy to see your favourite character even for 5 minutes in this movie, that's one of the necessary cons of the mix, and we shouldn't expected more in the first place.The movie lacks basic plot development. That'sFORTUNATELY not a very bad thing in the end of the day. 
In general, the movie delivers what a 150 minute movie with 20+ main cast can deliver. The consequences were unexpected, and shocking, and the Russo brother did their best. I'm sure if you go to see he movie with low expectations you will enjoy it a hell more. 
9.5/10 After rewatching this movie I will change my vote from 8 to 9.5.

Author: alexandresobreira-12-509311
Review:
Good action, good special effects, and a terrible stupid and predictable plot. You know a movie is not good storywise when you keep looking at your watch to know how much time is left before it ends. And that's what I did when watching Infinity War, because the movie was so absolutely predictable that it got tedious. Also, it had not one, but TWO instances of one of the cliches I hate the most, the "save a loved one, let the world die" cliche. And both are announced from miles away. When Vision makes the correct decision of committing suicide by having the mind stone destroyed and everyone is stupidly against it and when Dr. Strange says he will let Tony or Peter die rather than surrender the time stone. Sure, let half the universe die (including many of your loved ones) so you don't have to see THIS ONE PERSON die or kill them. And no, there's no circumstance when this will ever be right. In the case of Dr. Strange, just to make the NEXT movie even more predictable, it's clear that giving up his stone was part of a plan to make the one future where Thanos is defeated come true. That means I already know in broad terms what's going to happen in the next movie, especially with Fury calling in Captain Marvell in the post-credit scene.
Added to that is how terrible the fight scenes were. Not in that they were badly choreographed or executed, but in how stupid they were. I'll just mention two instances, so keep from being repetitive.
1. Dr. Strange or Wong could have beaten Thanos and his minions instantly. Just materialize a teleport opening around their necks and close it. Problem solved. This is as stupid as not using the luck potion or the time-travel amulet in Harry Potter to defeat Voldemort.
2. Why the hell is Thanos wasting time punching people after he got the reality stone? Just do what he did to Drax and Mantis to everyone. Turn all of them at once to confetti or cotton candy. Wish the mind stones off Vision's head and into his hand. And so on and so forth. This, in its turn, is as stupid as Green Lanterns making those constructs of theirs because writers think they look cool, when they should just disintegrate their enemies using their allegedly omnipotent rings of power. Only limited to your willpower and imagination still gives you a lot of leeway to use the best possible option: death rays.
In short, as I expected, Marvel people have ran out of ideas. Now I see clearly why Thor: Ragnarok was a comedy. If they had tried to make a serious dramatic movie, it would ended up being as boring as Infinity War.

Author: battlecrusadersgames
Review_Title: Gobsmacking end to an average film
Review:
So here it is, perhaps the most anticipated superhero movie ever + the 3rd Avengers movie to date. This time Thanos takes over villain duties + i have to be honest, during the 1st 10 mins of this movie i was unsure if he could cut it alongside Ultron, but i was proved wrong, he's as badass as they come. What i wasn't so unsure of in those few minutes is that some of the heroes might not make it, but to save from any spoilers, i won't say who or when.
 The plot for this movie is a simple one, but one that has been used for some great superhero movies and used here for best effect. It revolves around Thanos scouring the universe in an attempt to gather all the infinity stones and that means facing off with some of Marvel's greatest characters including Spiderman, The Hulk, Thor, Captain America, Iron Man and Black Panther.
 The Special Fx in this movie are stunning and the action scenes thrilling, particularly the last climactic battle.
 As for the heroes, Spiderman with his wit, Iron man + Dr Strange, who face off with verbal sparring and Thor, who is always worth watching, are the stand-outs and of course Groot is always a laugh. Surprisingly though, captain America and Black Panther who are so good in their own movies are a bit bland here and lost in the mass of characters this movie has.
 So on the whole there is a lot to enjoy here, but there is some down-sides, mainly in the movie's middle set, where the movie gets a little laggy + perhaps there's too many heroes, especially given that there is no point in the movie where all the characters share the screen at once.
 So is this the movie of the franchise, definitely not, for me, Thor; Dark World and Avengers Assemble have that accolade, and it's not the movie of the year so far either, that goes to Rampage, but it's still great popcorn fayer and has points where your jaw may drop so far it hits the ground....yes Marvel really did just do that.

Author: julianrochlitz
Review: Oh my god. This was such a shock and better than I thought it would be, Thanos unlike Ultron or Loki (RIP sadest death I've ever seen next to Yondu) was a actual threat to the Avengers he was the embodiment of brute strength. Thanos was a very relatable villain he wanted to wipe out half of the Universe to balance it and to make sure what happened to his planet doesn't happen to anymore. Thanos also had a very good connection with Gamora in the movie Thanos seemed like a cold being who loved no one but he loved Gamora and you can see it in his eyes when he talks to her because he's very hurt by the things Gamora says to him. I really did feel for the "mad titan" and Thor omg first Ragnarok now this you have to stop or my head will explode with amazement. Captain America was great again but didn't have as much time to shine as Thor and Iron man did. Iron Man as usual was amazing Robert Downey jr again owns this role like no one else can with there characters he has some really emotional scenes especially the call back to Homecoming with Spider-Man fading away just like he said in Homecoming he feels like that's on him. Doctor Strange also was really great in the movie and I saw what you did there with it was the only way ;) meaning the 1 chance of beating Thanos was to give him the stone and let him "win". I can't wait to see what Captain Marvel will do her movie and what she will do in Avengers 4 which seems like she will have a very big role in it. There are no words to describe how spectacular this film was such an amazing movie.

Author: vrrosario
Review:
Sorry folks, this movie was ridiculous. Not to mention that it was a dishonor to prime superheroes. It was like "let's see how many heroes and mind numbing perpetual non stop action we can cram into the same movie" , not caring about the flow, emotion or even if any of it made sense anymore.
And seriously guys, after everything that went down in Ragnorok, Thor's long awaited proclimation as King of Asgard and the salvation of the Asgardian people, to have it all decimated in the beginning of this film was total crap.
Marvel needs a huge enema for a Disney flush out and bring Marvel back to its glory.
Sorry folks.....In my humble opinion, I give it a thumbs down ... and only 2 stars, just for Disney's ballz for pulling this crappy film off. What a shame...Disney got to you too, Stan Lee. They even got you to cut Thor's hair off in Ragnorok....that just about wraps it up.

Author: favor-ryan
Review: As always I went into this film believing it was going to be one of the best Marvel movies of all time but once again I am disappointed with the outcome. Don't get me wrong as far as what the fans want to see such as good CGI, their favorite heroes all together, descent action sequences, and random comedy; this film is not bad at all, but I was hoping for the MCU's tenth film to be their very best. two hours and thirty minutes is more than enough time to give each hero the spotlight and display their abilities or heroism but it seemed as if Thor and Doctor Strange were the only two with that wow moment I was hoping to see with almost everyone. RDJ has mastered the art of timing when it comes to comedy and jokes and I loved seeing the bond between him and Tom, but aside that this film was just so ehhh. Banner was Hulk literally for three minutes then for the remainder of the film is bruce which is the exact opposite of what the fans were hoping for. Towards the end of the movie during the climax I was expecting some of the best action sequences Ive seen in years and they were so mediocre. I feel like it was such a waste of talent from the actors themselves and for the heroes. Overall the film is a great blockbuster to take the family to for a good time, but I would not see it twice.

Author: john-c-wallace
Review_Title: Rivals "X-Men Last Stand" for worst superhero movie ever.
Review: Let's start with the Zero of the movie; Thanos, AKA, Bane-with-no-brain, AKA, the son of Brutus from the Popeye cartoons. This guy's dream is to kill half of all the sentient beings in the Universe so there are enough resources to go around for everyone left; so he's basically the Joker on stupid pills. First of all, that idea is copied from a more intelligent version of a similar concept from "Watchmen." Second, are we really supposed to believe that Thanos is so dumb that he does not notice when populations of living things are cut back, that they grow back stronger, thicker and more robust? So what is he going to do; wipe out half the universe every 100 years as populations grow back? The stupidity of this concept is staggering. But it's really nothing compared to the banality of the character itself. Thanos is a guy who shows up magically in every scene with the same smug grin on his face then struts around goes; "Ha Ha Ha, I'm too strong for you, weaklings, look at my giant arms and manly rock-like chin." He's like the villain of some 1950's cartoon and he is more one-dimensional than Paper Mario. But it gets better, he is invincible, seems to know everything, and has some way to get around every superhero's powers. He's like a character written by a little kid; completely infallible and totally, unbelievably boring.

Author: briscouver
Review: Late to the party on the Marvel universe. Finally watching them in order, only End Game to go. Really like infinity war and sets up the big one. Love the mix of adventure, humour and action.

Author: chickenjackson
Review_Title: a welcome change in an American film
Review: Yes, it's worth watching on the big screen for the incredible MCU-multi-main-character action showdown sequences, that all these films have built up to, as well as the relentless pacing from it's "medias res" opening. It's also a welcome change because it pulls the rug from under most triumphalistic (Disney) American films in that it's wiling to eliminate characters and leave the audience at a loss to how the narrative will move forward in a world where the ones you're counting on are so utterly defeated. But what's most striking, and terrifying, is how timely the film is (the Russo brothers' helmed Marvel films have said a lot about our socio-political realties) with a villain that views the world as a zero-sum game and so believes it is righteous to cast aside entire populations.

Author: marynystrom
Review: I went into the theatre almost being prepared to be disappointed. Just because it was part 1 and a lot of times the first part of movies aren't the greatest. But wow! This movie blew me away. Is was really great. There were sad moments, but also comedic relief that didn't make it come across like they were fitting to many genre's in one movie. The end of the movie will shock you and make you realize that marvel movies can still surprise you. They really put a twist on things that you won't expect. So if your iffy about seeing it because you were disappointed in Civil War. Don't be. The abundance of characters did not ruin the movie at all. I highly reccomend WATCH THIS MOVIE.

Author: qeter
Review_Title: Should stay closer to the Comic Book story telling
Review: A very good attempt. The Marvel movies of today come closer to the strengths of comic books story telling: complex stories told on many narrative strings summing up to big finals. Digital art of today can provide the means to bring actors in real-live superheros feeling. A lot of this movie is to be liked. But the Marvel team should go back - one more time - to study further the story telling of the comic books. All good drawn stories do not go on with action scenes over pages and pages. That would be to boring and page-wasting for the reader. Action itself is done within very few pictures in comic books. One "wham!" and one "peng!". That's it. Nobody is interested in 10 pages of "wham" and "peng!". The needed action scenes are shortened in comic books (the fantasy of the reader jumps in) and the won comic book frames can be filled with in-between stories of love, hate, relation, politics, kisses, needings and longings of human beings universal told with the over-aggregated means of superheros. So please, reduce the time wasted on action scenes. Stay closer with the tellings of comic books. With each step the Marvel and the DC-teams go closer to the art of the telling in comic books, the better the movies have become. In Infinity War the grandios final would have been still more grandios with a reduction of the battle scenes to an absolute minimum. The first comic-movie that will dare to use an absolute minimum of time for battle scenes will come up with fantastic stories, I am sure.

Author: Rainbowbeany
Review: Avengers: Infinity War is a movie we have never seen before. Having been 10 years in the making Infinity War does not disappoint! There is so much going on in this movie that you will have to see it at least twice! The action is fantastic, the special effects are amazing, & the pacing is perfect. Just when you think "It's been awhile since I've seen...." they bring them right back into the action. Every Marvel film has led to this. While it does end with an amazing cliffhanger, it's going to keep us on the hook desperately waiting for Avengers 4. Acting standouts are Paul Bettany, Elizabeth Olsen, Robert Downy Jr., Tom Holland, Chadwick Boseman, & Josh Brolin. Not that anyone else wasn't good, these were just the people we saw the most. I CAN NOT WAIT till the next one!!!!

Author: amirmustafaa
Review: This movie was funny, exciting, epic, and emotional. Marvel rewards the fans who have been watching every marvel movie for the past decade with an epic superhero movie that will never be duplicated. By far the best aspect of this film is the interactions between the characters, which were brilliantly written and well acted. Is this movie perfect? No. Of course this movie has some trouble combining all the characters together while attempting to move the plot forward, but everything comes together perfectly with the most emotional and gut wrenching ending to any superhero movie I've every seen.

Author: theoriginalantiblonde
Review: I'm not a big comic book fan, or movies made from them, or blockbuster movies in general, but I really enjoyed this. Yes, as others have said, it is too long -- I think they could have taken time from each of the battle scenes which would have cut the overall running time nicely without losing anything really important. Yeah, the CGI stuff is fun, but after a while, I get bored with it all. I watched this via Nexflix, so I ended up watching it in two parts which helped to keep it fresher for me. Previously I had watched both Guardians of the Galaxy and Thor, both of which I really liked. Another reviewer mentioned that the naysayers needed to have watched the earlier individual superhero movies as their story lines were meant to meet here. That does make sense to me. Although, if you were to watch this cold turkey with a relatively open mind, then you should be able to pretty much suss out what is happening without all of the other back grounding. Which I guess quite a number of reviewers here weren't interested in doing. Their loss.

I am however really not a fan of the changes they made to Thanos' origin and motivations. I feel that it was an uneccessary change and I hope that they introduce his true purpose as told for decades of comics.

Author: regonas
Review_Title: Great as a sequel, but can't stand alone
Review:
SPOILER: These is many things what can be said about this movie, and most of them are good, so why not talk about obvious stuff everybody keep forgetting.
1) This movie demands you to see all previous marvel movies since 2008. If you missed at least one of them, then you will enjoy this movies quite less. This movie only spends time on developing only one single character (the bad guy), because all previous characters were developed on previous movies.
2) "Fans" kept demanding quality villains and actual reasons behind their motivation. The last villain these "fans" were satisfied with was Loki back from 2012. So, Marvel just done that - they worked on creating a villain with actual personality, story and motivations. Yet, these same "fans" are now complaining about Marvel doing what they demanded Marvel to do.
3) Marvel is subscribing to left wing (cancer) ideologies of diversity (code for anti-white anti-male bigotry) and progressive stacking of victimhood (the biggest "victim" is always right). For this reason alone you can bet your life on the fact that Marvel will never ever kill off female or black super hero in one of their movies. Even if one of these character "dies", then it will be brought back to life in the next movie.
4) Ending of this movie (it being the first part of two parts) left a opening for the next avenger movie which will follow events directly after this one. However, keeping in mind points 2 and 3 in mind, the next movie most likely will be extremely predictable (lets face, this one was extremely predictable as well).

Author: angelar-852-118697
Review: The perfect #Marvel movie, plus the post credit GOLD to me...

Author: leoocampo
Review_Title: Impressive Climax to the Marvel Cinematic Universe
Review: That a movie like this is possible these days is a real feat in and of itself. Years of films and series content have built a rich cinematic universe spanning multiple independent threads and subplots, each with its own style and feel and tone, and full of rich characters both big and small. The character development alone makes this capstone film a culmination not just of a closely knit and well-maintained continuity, but evolution and deepening of the heros playing their parts. I would have thought something like this would be doomed to failure, being too big, too ambitious, too broad in scope and grand in vision to work. But, they did it.

Author: gabriel-minea
Review: I was simply amazed by this movie and it had nothing to do with my low expectations caused by Age of Ultron or Ragnarok. The action starts in the first minutes and ends just before the credits roll up. Really good plot and even better characters. Like, they have made 3 Thor movies and the coolest Thor you will ever see is in this movie. Thanos is by far the best villain I have seen in any super-hero movie (MCU and DC). Just joking, no one will be better than Nolan's Joker :). But better than any villain MCU developed so far. My only regret is that Infinity War 2 didn't started right away, right there in the cinema. We'll have to wait one more year for that and I have a feeling that will be at least as good as this one. If you spend money in the past for Ant-Man, GOTG2 or any other slightly meaningless Marvel movie and think about skipping this one, trust me, you will regret it.

Author: minge-79873
Review_Title: Marvel and the Russos - They've done it again!
Review:
What can I say? Phenomenal!
The Russo brothers bought a sharp real edge to the MCU with their previous Captain America movies (Winter Soldier and Civil War) and were able to get past the superheroes to the people underneath. They've done the same with mad Titans and intergalactic shenanigans. And like previous instalments, they're not afraid to tear things up in the process!
The opening scenes show how devastating Thanos can be with his bear hands...let alone a full gauntlet. and with shocking deaths from the onset it really is a gritty rollercoaster ride. I was gripped from start to finish and the clever balancing of all the different arcs and events happening concurrently made the immense run-time of the movie fly by. 
From human heroes, to wizards, Thunder Gods and Galactic Guardians, everybody gets their time to shine and their part to play. It is testament to the actors who know their characters and the Russos for delivering, but you really do sense that everybody has some weight in this battle.
Seeing Thor back to best after the too light-hearted Ragnarok (in my opinion) was refreshing. and Doctor Strange take a very central role alongside Iron Man is great. Thanos really steals the show though. All of the heroes have had their stories told - this is his. and as it's slowly revealed throughout the movie you can't help but hope he succeeds.
Captain America wasn't as forefront as i expected but with part 2 to follow next year there is time for his swan song. I also thought Tony and Peter may have reacted more to being flung through space to an alien world. Apart from that and the absence of Hawkeye and Ant-Man, i cannot fault this movie.
It felt like a Marvel comic on the screen. The humorous quips amid fast-paced high-stakes battles. The looming and very real threat. The not-knowing who you'll see and when. This movie didn't just please a 10 year MCU fan, it wowed a lifelong Marvel fan.

Author: films-22537
Review_Title: This movie is a kid emptying his toy box on the floor
Review: Once you get past how cool it is to see all these characters on screen together, this movie is very lacking. The characters have no consistency, the deaths are hollow and are just there for shock value since we all know they won't say dead, the power levels of the characters and the stones fluctuate to fit what the plot needs. This is a very flawed film, but with that said I still think it's the best marvel film by far. Review: Thor's story was good, the rest was the usual crappy stereotypes. Too much CGI, 3rd rate acting by most characters. Mindless entertainment, lots of eye candy, forgettable movie.

Author: sorenmike
Review_Title: Best movie I had ever seen
Review: There is honestly nothing to complain about with this movie. The entire Avengers series has led up to this moment. Now, i know there's a second part coming soon, but as far as the first part is concerned, it started off great following the events of Civil War and Ragnarok, the characters are great as ever, the action was awesome, and the comedy was spot on, I couldn't stop laughing throughout the entire movie. There is no reason any person shouldn't watch this. Great movie for all.

Author: bloodworia
Review_Title: The Star Wars movie we never got.
Review:
So i've been expecting nothing surprising from this movie. Age of Ultron was average, Civil War and Black Panther were horrible and Thor was creativly a little different but still marvel level.
But IW really surprised me, i never thought they could make it interesting that everyone fights the same all mighty guy. But lets say they found a clever way that makes perfect sense. The movie itself feels like nice adventure with a lot of different settings and fights. Every character recieves enough time to feel relevant and plot appropiate. The humour is alright and sometimes even funny, never thought my grumpy self could say that. I absolutely despised the comedy in Guardians 2 and especially TLJ. Also Thanos is not a dumb villian Ultron was, he is actually interestingand has motives that one can understand, if to even relate. Thats always what makes good villians shine.

Author: hesterroozeboom
Review_Title: What great movie.. Except it wasn't
Review: The movie was only half as good as they made me think it would be. They did a great job on the story, but they did leave a few plotholes. I was really suprised by Thanos' character. He wasn't just a big scary purple alien. He is actually very complex and cool. He felt more like a human being (alien being..) then some of the hero's.

Author: jchen-07237
Review: I watched the film Endgame, just the day before today, and it was amazing, so I gave it a brief but powerful review. Then, I realized I had forgotten to thank the film that led to Endgame, the one that broke my heart and warmed it at the same time. This film made me laugh, made me sit on the edge of my seat, made me cry, and made me infuriated for some people, making me want to throw a punch. This film makes you feel all the emotions: heartbreak, happiness, humor, and even fear. This will leave you wailing and complaining, needing more to satisfy you. Endgame is certainly more emotional and powerful than this one, with the topping 9.2 ratings, while this one is conveniently sitting at 8.5. This film and Endgame both made me confident, standing up to cruelty in my school, and letting me embrace how far Marvel has come.

Author: jchen-07237
Review: Infinity Wars was a breathtaking film. It knocked the wind out of me, on the edge of my seat, wondering what would happen next. I needed to know. It was very exciting and intriguing to watch them. Almost everyone started breaking into sobs while the ending happened, now, I'm not going to tell what happened, because I hate when someone spoils a film for me, so I won't do that for other people. It was intriguing, and packed full of action. It was amazing to see all the Marvel Avengers group together and reunite. Some things were completely unexpected, which made it so worth it to watch. If you haven't, watch Infinity Wars.

Author: kate-812-940559
Review:

The story is pushed onwards with obvious effort, scenes pile up with an obvious primary intention to impress and move, gone is the joy, fun and ease of the first Avengers. It looked a little like Marvel was trying to give birth to a DC movie and the labour was hard indeed.

Review: It's by far one of the best movies I've seen. And the best done by Marvel Studios. Authencity and respect to the original comic books are evident and gives the movie more power. Author: redcanofevil
Review_Title: Bold move for a MCU movie
Review:
A culmination of 18 movies,10 years and a ton of characters from the comics all lead to this. A spectacular visual marvel with a fast storytelling and good ol' comic book action. Thanos most definitely is the main protagonist of this movie and has been done justice in the hands of the Russos. A satisfying screen time for most and doses of unexpected events that would shock even the most veteran comic fans/movie goers. The boldest MCU movie by far and a proper comic book movie.
Infinity war is not for the casual movie goers,its a love letter to all those who stayed for the last 10 years.

Author: bandblawrw
Review_Title: Marvel knocked it out of the park
Review:
I definitely am pleased with how this film developed. I loved the first Avengers movie and was okay with Age of Ultron but this was a home run. Now that the majority of the characters have origin movies, it is like watching a group of friends work together. The dialogue was rapid fire and on point. I am a huge devil's advocate type of person so I see Thanos, the villain, almost as a tortured hero, sacrificing all for what he deems to be the greater good. I know that a loto of people were mad at how it ended but come on people, we knew going in there was to be a part 2 so that had to leave off somewhere. 
I highly recommend this film. It can be a date movie, solo viewing or group outing. Well worth the money and I am ready for the next installment.

Review: Way too much i.e. endless fighting, CGI expressions take far longer to develop than human, barely any semblance of a plot, whether Save the Cat! or Hero's Journey it's weak and disorganized. Author: carlo_simone18

The tone was mostly consistent, with the serious moments thankfully not being undermined too much by humour, but the humour that was there worked pretty well.

Author: rebeccalucy
Review: Beautiful and very unique event, from beginning to end. Definitely requires knowledge of the marvel universe to even have a grasp of what is going on.

Author: FandomFanatic21
Review_Title: An entire universe, once and for all...
Review: Avengers: Infinity War, the breathtaking action packed world phenomenon. Avengers: Infinity War follows the Avengers after the accords as they face a new threat: Thanos, the space invader who is on a quest to collect all the infinity stones so he may rule all with unlimited power. The movie literally will have you on the edge of your seat. The director(s) did a great job of juggling all the characters and creating great collaborations between the beloved heroes. This film is one great team up that will have you in awe and in tears. If there's one thing I advise for viewers who plan on watching the film is: be prepared for one BIG cliffhanger. When I went to watch the film the audience was struck with a hint of anger and a touch of excitement in the end. The film does have twists, suspense, awesome fighting scenes, and great laughs that will have you begging for more and wishing the second part to the film would come sooner than next year. The time is coming for the avengers to end and almost time for an emotional goodbye. I highly recommend the film even if you haven't gotten around to the previous films in the series. Watch it and love it!

Author: viktorianazhmutdinova
Review: Infinity War is the quintessential Marvel Cinematic Universe, its ninth symphony. This is a completely new, previously unknown level. And where the best movie from Marvel has to be the best villain - and that's Thanos. And even for a character like Thanos, the concept of "the best villain" sounds ... not quite right: he pursues a specific goal. What he does is impossible to accept, but understandable. The music from Alan Silvestri both delights and literally makes you shudder. The film turned out to be very balanced, and this is with such a huge number of characters - even those who were given very little time received their bright moment of fame. Bravo, Kevin! Bravo, Russo brothers!

Author: viktorianazhmutdinova
Review: I watched it yesterday, but I still can't stop and realize what I saw! An amazing movie in every way! Large-scale, global, amazing! I sincerely marvel at the wonderful ability of the screenwriters to shuffle sparkling jokes, over which the whole audience laughed merrily, with heartbreaking moments when tears come to the eyes. I do not want to repeat for the hundredth time the enthusiastic epithets, of which a great many have been said and written, they have already managed to set the teeth on edge. The Avengers got me! One of the best, spectacular, epic, vibrant films that I have seen at the moment! Pros: The whole movie from beginning to end. Disadvantages - I did not see them. The biggest impression is the last minutes. The jaw dropped and still does not want to return to its rightful place. Amazing. Gorgeous. Amazing. We've already booked a trip to the Avengers movies next weekend. Number two ... Most likely, the matter will not be limited to two campaigns ..

Author: kamphorst-11493
Review: Very predictable. Main heroes get no time to shine. Subplots are cliche. Despite some very good actors and, at times acting, all depth to the acting was stolen by the writing. Perhaps that was why the music was do prominent. So that despite my boredom I would know what to feel.

Author: odaleg
Review:
The best: Close virtually unbeatable for the ten years of the MCU, drink of the best of each Marvel saga. The way to bring all the protagonists together is sublime. The BSO and the CGI are the best that has been in the MCU to date. Unite with such elegance and naturalness the themes that are given in each of the films and none of them is out of place at any time. As for the CGI, what to say, one of Marvel's strengths since this universe began and once again does not disappoint. The brothers Russo direct and most importantly, they mount the film and that's where the difference between this film and a movie of the genre is noticed.
The worst: The script has more holes than a "Gruyere cheese" they teach a lot and they count little, they leave all the answers for the announced Avengers 4. The times of the film are quite badly taken and the subplot of Thanos and Gamora are left over in the movie .

Author: ryanbartlett-870-746486
Review:
The culmination of a decade worth of planning and preparation that will pay off very well. Continuing in the line of blockbuster movies, Marvel is about to bank in another billion, probably two, and maybe even three with Infinity War. The movie pits the world's great heroes against the universes greatest villain. And it doesn't disappoint.
 There have been many series that have culminated into a crappy finale, mainly looking at you Hobbit: Battle of Five Armies. Avengers didn't fall into the money grab hole and instead continued on their self-titled, and self-filled track to a hit. A key reason is it was able to balance probably the largest, most-expensive, and most famous cast in film history. The support-characters who fight for screen time in this film, are primetime actors who would be the star in any other movie. 
 The next thing was the villain and henchmen. They made the evil people evil. At points in the film, I was excited to see Thanos henchmen take on the avengers. Not to see the avengers do damage, but to see just how powerful and skilled these followers are. And on top of this, Thanos was portrayed in a such a way to where, we all understood where he was coming from. He wasn't turned into a DC villain where he is just some evil bad guy we've never heard of coming to destroy the world. Instead, Thanos was a villain that is "evil" to the core, in the earthly human sense, but at the same time he is a man of morals and passions that are leading him down his path. He even takes chances and risks and sacrifices to get there. It shows how mass murder isn't easy, even when he has all of the power in the universe. 
 At the end of the movie, which really is just a Part one of two. We are left with really their most important goal, and that is anticipation for the movie next year. With a couple of movies separating us from the next sequel, anticipation is building even more. This movie won't be featured in the Oscars, but it will definitely be the movie of the year, and probably the most memorable of the decade. Purely due to the amount of work that has gone into this MCU over the past decade and the success that they have had.

Author: baumbach-86824
Review_Title: High rating comes from fans, not because it's a good movie
Review: I would want those movies to be good. And seeing a 8,0 and higher usually means your in for a great, Christopher Nolan Niveau movie. That isn't true for Marvel movies though.

Author: regula1

Review: This is it, this is what everything has been building to since Iron Man first graced the screen in 2008. Thanos has come for the Infinity Stones, and it looks like not even the Avengers can stand in his way.

Author: anagalilea
Review: I lived the loki scenes, just that really. It is rich in characters, subplots and dynamics, much better than other avengers, but Loki is the best. Too bad what happens to him, in such silly way.

Author: Here_2_Review
Review: This movie has its Disney tone to it, but is very scary at the same time and it the darkest Avengers to date and the best one so far. Brolin is very scary as Thanos and the rest of the cast is fantastic! Very heartwarming and heartbreaking film

Author: john-demetriou-jd
Review: This was a good movie. Marvel and Disney did a good one here. The comeback from boringly predictable flicks with forced jokes of phase 3 (I am looking at you Ragnarok) is good. It still had more jokes that I would like in a movie that is about destroying half the universe but then again you cannot have a Disney movie without jokes. Every character is sometimes comedic relief. As a standard Marvel/Disney movie. But it's not too overdone.

Author: mkanatlar
Review_Title: Expectations fullfilled and a new era began.
Review: This movie is one of the best in a decade. Marvel started something magical and hyped it up to this point and did not disapoint. I read some reviews about the holes in the plot and et cetera and all i wanted to say was wtf are you talking about. These people probably didn't even watch a single marvel movie let alone a mcu movie. Let me tell you this: this movie has a plot as long as 18 movies. It's all scattered around the mcu movies. Seein the thing we have been expecting for a decade was the reward. Infinity War is great as a standalone movie but it's rewarding and more sensible if you watch other mcu movies. It's funny, action packed, emotional and heroic. It makes sometimes makes you cry out of laughing and sometimes out of sadness. I suggest you watch other mcu movies before seeing this movie and you will hype like a dog who has seen his owner ;).

Author: pegasus-67050
Review:
This movie really has it all on a grandiose scale!
Emotion, struggle, humour and phenomenal team work shines in all the right places. In one such way this film is outstanding is in the character development. Mainly the relationships between: Thor & Loki, Thanos, Gamora & Nebula, Tony & Peter

Author: pegasus-67050
Review: Action-packed, emotional with some laughs along the way of course! Thanos is the most powerful villain EVER! The team-ups are great and so is the banter of course! There's only one thing I was devastated about was...

Author: btkb
Review_Title: MIND-BLOWING!!! Best Avenger Movie I have ever Saw
Review: I was sad at the end seeing some of the Avengers, or Marvel characters, disappear in ashes.

Author: llamaslothinc
Review: The attempts to pull on one's heart strings when they had already announced movies for half the characters in this thing post "End Game" is insulting to the intelligence of viewers. I have no idea how the end can make people emotional who literally know exactly what will happen by the end of the next one (unless you're a child, of course). Thanos is also one of the worst and most thoughtless villains ever constructed, incapable of understanding how both population grows exponentially and how resource depletion works. Despite having all the power, he also doesn't have half the brain necessary to realize offing all the Avengers would be the smartest move, or maybe, ya know, like creating more resources and planets, since he has legitimately godlike power by the end of it. This film is at best mindless entertainment with tons of CGI and quality acting, but don't be fooled, it's just as formulaic and predictable as a freaking Hallmark film. All Marvel is at this point.

Author: anthonyobrien-92790
Review:
Its a really heartbreaking great movie

Author: DreamScapeSev7n
Review: I saw this movie and thought it was alright. Very much an action blockbuster with some moments which are quite emotional for hardcore MCU fans. I found Doctor Strange's character to annoy me a lot. Instead of destroying to time stone (which would have prevented Thanos from winning) he keeps it until Tony (who he hasn't liked all movie) is about to be killed by Thanos and then he gives up the stone. Essentially, he thought Tony's life, which he was willing to sacrifice, was more valuable then every person in the universe. Okay, that totally makes sense.

Author: TheNameBrand
Review: Absolutely incredible and kept me on the edge of my seat the entire time. There's a few minor things about it that one could pick a fight about, but that can be easily over-sighted by how much of a fun time you're having watching it unfold. Also to note, is we have finally strayed from the Marvel Movie formula, and it feels amazing. Brush up on your Marvel films, and then watch this bad boy with some popcorn to be entertained.

Author: matthewjloller
Review: A true epic event film. A non-stop thrill ride of superhero action with a great twist at the end. Also the first superhero movie I know of where the actual protagonist is the villain, and Josh Brolin's Thanos shines as he carries this movie to near perfection. The thrills hit hard and emotional moments hit harder. A GREAT movie.

Author: nikhil_mi2
Review_Title: Hell of a way to rob money out of yur pockets
Review:
First things First. This is a good movie. Enjoyable and sort of entertaining to a point.
They really marketed it well with the secret leaks to the ending, killing off many characters etc. etc. They surely had me fooled and apparently almost 90% of the world's population(Who have not even realized it yet). 
The first 20 mins of this movie are seriously good and they build up nicely to an middle and an end that falls flatly on the ground. Thanos is the most important character in the movie(as the trailers and the marketing team has made apparent). He alternates between being strong and being weak, being a badass and then a softie entirely for the convenience of the plot. There are no other characters that are given that much importance, seriously. Everyone makes an appearance though, and have their comic one liners but all for nothing.Captain America is virtually absent from the movie (except during his entrance scene). Black Panther is also an observer, so is Winter Soldier and Hulk, Yes u heard it right, Hulk is not there in the movie. Iron Man, Dr. Strange, Spider-Man , Thor and Guardians have a better amount of screen time. Then comes the ending, which I am confident was a late patch up thing and not well thought of.

Author: joseph_ali99

Author: nadeeshantennage
Review_Title: Arguably, the most epic Marvel comic movie ever made.
Review:
The greatest asset of this action packed superhero saga is that not only it can stun you with many hair raising action and epic battle sequences but with the emotional grip that tones this fantastic film very well throughout the running time..
Even, with the highly unlikable villain 'Thanos' the directors have managed to create emotionally tender moments giving quite a bit of a wider scope to how the villain is portrayed in this epic Marvel gem.
Each an every major marvel Superhero gets to pay his/her contribution in fighting against the almighty evil 'Thanos' with convincing and rich performances majorly because of the wonderful screenplay adapted by C. Markus and Stephen McFeely.
The major sub plot turnouts and plot twist building up to the climax have been crafted so masterfully to create maximum impact on keeping the strong momentum in the flow of the plot.
I must also admit that since the fantabulous and iconic Dark Knight trilogy by Christopher Nolan this is the next superhero movie in which I felt emotionally gripped with its storytelling and with amazing visual effects which in itself is a marvel to look at.
Do not miss this epic saga by Russo brothers and regret it.

The film cannot stand on its own and it was not meant to. Someone described this film like the season finale of a TV show. The characters and plot of this film have been set up over the course of many other movies. If you come into this film not knowing that, it will seem like a mess to you. Author: sagniknath
Review_Title: Easily has one of the most fleshed out villains in superhero movie history that is aided by convincing CGI and a great performance by Josh Brolin
Review: Thanos as a character was the showstopper for me throughout the entire movie. I have never had any interest in such supervillains featured before in movies and cartoons because they seemed to be too powerful and without any flaws. Also, on the represention side, they looked too CGI-ey to the point that they were merely characters from an overly done cutscene in a generic video game. However, Thanos became very appealing to me throughout the progression of the story in Avengers 3 and I became heavily invested in his character arc. He is definitely among the most fleshed out in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, almost to the point where I was rooting for his cause, having a strong emotional connect with him, rather than siding with the good guys. This was a very non classical comic book villain with a lot of moral relativism .

Author: dp-17275
Review: 'Avengers: Infinity War' is the culmination of most of the heroes of the Marvel cinematic universe, and it's a very good movie. Thanos is a terrifying villain which you dread seeing because you know once you see him, something bad is going to happen and there will be major consequences. Groups are split up and sent on different missions but are all for the same goal. The characters we know and love aren't really developed anymore considering they've already been developed before, but the most development comes in Thanos who for a CG character who is trying to murder half the universe, is a sympathetic character who thinks he's right. The acting is brilliant, standout being Josh Brolin as Thanos who makes the character feel real. The visual effects are mind-blowing as everything feels so real, it should feel goofy and ridiculous but it isn't. The music is decent but nothing mind-blowing the Avengers theme is a nice touch to hear often. The movie sometimes struggles in terms of cutting back and forth between many characters. It is a nitpick as it basically juggles all the characters perfectly. Expectations are subverted, all your awful theories are wrong as Marvel is very creative and utilizes it's advantage in having many movies before this one. It was worth the 10 year wait.

Author: rustydalek-37911
Review_Title: Not Perfect, But Has Actual Stakes
Review: After spending so much time and effort building to it, Thanos finally sets out to collect the Infinity Stones, and the result is pretty decent overall. Despite a few glaring character omissions, we get a pretty good cast together for this one, and there are a few twists which were interesting to see. Also, the film has real stakes, which is a breath of fresh air. Unfortunately, this plays out as the first half of a two-part adventure, and the 2nd part is a disappointment in almost every way, which casts a poor light on this installment. Additionally, some of the character's decisions are baffling to the point of stupidity, such as Star Lord ruining the plan to stop Thanos on Titan. Finally, a lot of the better characters were killed in the end, which has major consequences for Endgame. All in all, it's not a bad film, but loses a lot of it's value when we see how things actually end up playing out.

Author: gogarrett
Review_Title: What a triumph for Marvel! It just keeps getting better :D
Review:
I never give 10 stars but I can't stop thinking about this movie days after seeing it. All the story lines are brilliantly intertwined for all the varied superheroes and past movies. We were left devastated, but hopeful at the end of this one. 
I had to run out and rent Thor: Ragnorok the next day to help make sense of a few things. Glad I saw most of the others because it makes this film all the richer. I just need to see the Dr. Strange movie to get a totally complete picture, then you can be sure I will be watching Infinity War again! 
This movie pulls on just about every emotion and leaves us craving more story, more answers. Who will return and who will not. This is what it's all about. We are getting attached to every character, love them teaming together in fun, battle and in tragic times. They are each fantastic in their own way. I can't wait until May to see Part 2, and all the Marvel movies that are to come. Final note: Iron Spider MUST LIVE!

Author: fandom_cultures
Review:
Before I begin, there will be spoilers so you have been warned. Avengers: Infinity War directed by the Russo Brothers who also directed Captain America: The Winter Soldier and Captain America: Civil War is in my opinion not only the best Marvel movie ever but quite possibly one of the best superhero movies that I have ever seen. It has everything you can possibly want from a superhero film: high stakes, great action scenes, great acting, splendid dialogue, awesome special effects, and funny humor. The cast was great in this film but the star was 100% Josh Brolin as Thanos. He is hands down the best MCU villain and I know a lot of people have said that but I honestly believe this.
 First I want to talk about the overall scope of the film. This movie takes you to many places including Wakanda, Titan which is Thanos' home planet, New York, and other realms including Nidavellir. There are so many things that happen in the film with so many characters and I am impressed at how well the Russo Brothers manages to balance it. As Thanos quite put it, "Balanced as all things should be." 
 Next, the characters. I was a little disappointed when certain characters didn't get to meet other characters and I am hoping that they get to meet in the next movie. However, the best performance in this film is Josh Brolin as Thanos himself. He is one of the best movie villains I have ever seen. He had a good motivation though how he carried it out was flawed and he was not evil for the sake of being the villain. He wanted to help the world but in his own twisted way. The other characters were great in this film. I loved Thor's interaction with the Guardians of The Galaxy. Thor might also be one of the best parts of the movie and he really developed as a character. All of the other characters had a chance to shine. Tom Holland as usual was great as Spider-Man but I will get to his performance later. 
 The special effects were great. The different environments looked so awesome and even though some of it was CGI it still looked great. The Wakanda fight scene was one of the best uses of CGI. It didn't look too cheesy and it was grounded. Avengers: Infinity War has one of the best fight scenes which was the battle on Titan. I loved the Wakanda battle but the Titan fight scene just blew me away. 
 As soon as I came home from watching the movie I went to Spotify and added the whole entire soundtrack to my playlist. I loved seeing Alan Silvestri return to score the film. The score from the first Avengers film is one of my favorite superhero movie scores. This one is slightly darker and gives a feeling of dread to the film as well as melancholy. I also love that he only uses the Avengers theme at appropriate times such as when Captain America appears out of the shadows or when Thor enters Wakanda (Which is one of the most epic entrances I've ever seen!!). The score "Even For You" is really emotional and I nearly cried listening to it. 
 Finally, the death scenes. It is hard to choose which death made me the most sad. Oh who am I kidding? Obviously Spider-Man made me the most emotional but Groot and Loki were also sad. I kind of knew Gamora was going to die so that wasn't as sad but it still hurt me. 
 Overall, the film was a masterpiece and told a great story and balanced so many characters in one movie. It also gave us a sympathetic villain and great fight scenes as well as great character arcs.

Author: tandrasmiklos
Review_Title: The best Marvel movie after Deadpool
Review: I consider Deadpool the best Marvel movie because it ironically exposes us to the fact that we enjoy watching fictional characters jump around, say stupid heroic lines and save people. It gives us the phylosophical questions: "Why can't we enjoy our current reality?" or "Is our reality/story more real than Deadpool's?" I think it is pretty obvious, we use these stories to create a non-religious (for most people lol, shoutout to geeks:) mythology. Altough nowadays Marvel movies have come closer to not taking things seriously, there's still some overly serious attitude involved in "saving" the world. Of course, the best part about this one is that it's underlying question is serious, and the dialog always tries to joke, just like in the comics, just like Deadpool. And the meaning behind this movie's story? It's probably the dilemma of the Christ and the anti-Christ. Thanos's motivation for destroying half the living population in the universe is purely economical: he wants the living to prosper, he deems a universe wide Holocaust necessary. All this, after gaining the highest power known in the universe, which means theoretically he could have found other solutions to his dilemma, but for some reason he seems to be set on being a lunatic. And here comes our dilemma: why is he so sure that killing people is the only solution? Which is never explained. On the hero side, they don't really get why Thanos is doing what he is doing either, and they don't really get to participate in a philosophical debate about the topic. The action is relentless, and the visuals are decent, so it works as the blockbuster they promoted it to be. I gave it 7/10 because the most important character's motivations (Thanos) remained only briefly explored. The cheesy lines remained low, but that's because they kept romantic lines to the minimum, otherwise it would have been really bad (why can't anyone write a normal romantic dialogue? adults should have adult dialogues, not be like Vision, who is an AI and rambles like a teenager). I particularly liked the ending, despite the fact that we know this is not the true ending to the story.

That aside though, to be fair, I've always hated crossovers for a long time, and Avengers was no exception (I haven't watched the other two movies). But when I saw this movie, it gave me a newfound respect and love for marvel movies. It's probably the best superhero movie I've ever seen (aside from The Dark Knight).

Author: type-a1pha
Review_Title: Too busy for its own good.
Review:
It is an Avenger superhero movie and it develops as it is to be expected. It's chaotic, relentless in its progression and there's just so much happening that's quite hard to take seriously half of it. Every scene has a new character, a new development, something unreasonable happening. There's just too much to be done for a single movie and as a consequence most of it is mediocre in its execution.
On the other hand, it's entertaining in its action and combat scenes. Effects are great and the soundtrack fitting. The saving grace is the ending, maybe the only unexpected bit of the entire movie.

Author: mrsscroodge
Review:
The standard for every crossover movie
Though this is not my favorite MCU movie I think "Infinity War" is the best product the studio produced both because of the really high scope and because of the execution itself. I think the movie is so great because it contains almost everything you could ask (action, humor, heartfelt moments, great CGI, fantastic score, ...) in a balanced way. Furthermore even if the culmination of the MCU happened in "Endgame" it was here that every piece of the Marvel Universe was brought together for the first time. I remember to have an astronomical hype at the time and the fact that the movie resulted to be even better than what my hype was making envisioning me is something that I highly count. But the best part of this movie is its villain, Thanos. I loved him (and still do) and he absolutely stole the show and sets up Endgame perfectly. Clearly "Infinity War" has its flaws and I am not here to say it is perfect like a 10/10 rating would usually mean, but for what it represented at the time and the way it was delivered I think we couldn't have asked for more.

Author: soyil-87649

Author: CinematicGarbage
Review_Title: The most EPIC MCU movie SO FAR!
Review:
Avengers: Infinity War is the 19th movie and also one of the most popular movie of the MCU. It was directed by the Russo Brothers (Anthony and Joe). It was the movie that celebrated 10 years of the MCU and it turned out to be really successful.
After Civil War, the group of heroes were separated. Thanos (John Brolin) came to Earth to collect 6 powerful Infinity Stones and his goal was to wipe half of the universe. The Avengers teamed up to fight Thanos and bring peace to the universe.
Avengers: Infinity War is a really good idea to celebrate 10 years of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, full of entertainment and a lot of fun actually. The film was really dark with Thanos successfully accomplished his goal and wiped half of the universe, including some of our beloved heroes like Dr. Strange, Black Panther, Spider-Man, Star-Lord, Vision,... The music score was also dark from the beginning when Thanos and his children terrorized Asgard and killed Heimdall and Loki, I could see the dark theme which was really suitable. The end was really epic and tragic as well. I loved the CGI and the battle was really awesome even though they didn't win.
The movie was one of the most tragic, epic and darkest superhero movies I've ever seen...until Avengers: Endgame.
It was not a waste of time to make this as a celebration of 10 years. I rate it a 8.7/10

Author: humble77
Review: Wonderful from beginning to end. Can't wait for the next installment.

Author: polunabluun
Review: An uneven and ambiguous film that has both undeniable advantages and obvious disadvantages inherent in all Marvel crossovers. The advantages of the film include the colorful villain Thanos with finally clearly prescribed motivation, a lot of locations and special effects, the drama of individual scenes and the meeting of almost all the characters from the Marvel cinematic universe. Cons: a long, sometimes sagging plot with a bunch of logical holes, a very uneven distribution of characters, with well-defined individual characters (Thor) and completely lost in the film (Doctor Strange, Bucky), weak interaction between the characters, humor at the level of Petrosian's sketches and inarticulate musical arrangement. Overall, out of 19 Marvel films, he is somewhere in the middle. You can watch in IMAX, but don't expect too much from the prologue to Avengers 4.

Author: Mohican15
Review_Title: A Complete Blast For MARVEL Fans!
Review: Even though it's not perfect, I must say that AVENGERS: INFINITY WAR totally delivers all you want from a MARVEL movie. It gives you: the characters you love, the villain you've been waiting for and, of course the action sequences you've been craving like a fist-shaped bar of MARVEL-brand chocolate! We ALL should know by now that Joel and Anthony Russo+ MARVEL MCU= greatness and INFINITY WAR proves that fact yet again! Overall it's a pretty cool and fun ride, but you certainly have to prepare yourself for typical superhero silliness. However, the silly superhero stuff is told in a mature, non-patronising way and it wasn't like the rest of the of the frankly "daft" superhero films of the past year. Yes, I'm talking about you, THOR: RAGNAROK, SPIDER-MAN: HOMECOMING, BLACK PANTHER and GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY VOL 2. Though INFINITY WAR is certainly NOT realistic at all, it grips and has a serious tone that keeps you watching. The script is dynamic but also very funny in some parts and we get a good look at MOST of the characters. The plot is simple and nothing THAT new or fresh but it still grips and provides real closure on the already rather over-bloated MARVEL cinematic universe. There were a couple of elements I wasn't QUITE sure on but more about them later. Firstly, the good things: the plot, the characters and action.

Author: hujp-49614
Review: Whilst I really did quite enjoy this on a big screen, the more I watch it subsequently makes me realise that is all just way to cluttered. With the exception of poor cutie "Pietro" who got squished in "Age of Ultron" (2015), the world and its Marvellian wife gets in on this act. That, for me, was part of the problem with this film. It's a series of episodic escapades featuring different branches of the family - From "Loki" through "Guardians of The Galaxy" (was it just me, or did Chris Pratt took a little out of shape, here?); "Spiderman"; "Black Panther"; "Dr. Strange" and finally, our "Tony Stark" led original Avengers. That compendium style of mini-adventures sees each trying to thwart the evil "Thanos" (Josh Brolin) who is in search of six infinity stones that will make him all powerful. What ensues are are a series of end-to-end combat scenes with astonishing pyrotechnics and visual effects. The story I found less engaging. There is precious little humour - even the normally charismatic Pratt has little to work with, and the usually reliable Chris Hermsworth's "Thor' character just features all to sparingly for me. It's a sort of cinematic jigsaw puzzle that has an ending that just screams "more to come" at you, and after a whopping great 2½ hours I really could have been doing with something with fewer characters and less constituent moving parts. All of that said, though, it's still a great piece of cinema entertainment but has definitely faded with time.

Author: lucasacosta
Review: Marvel / Disney nunca hará una película que pueda considerarse una obra maestra, esta fue la oportunidad, The Avengers también lo fue, y hay un par más que son claramente excepcionales (The Winter Soldier y Guardians of the Galaxy), pero a este ritmo, nunca lo harán. En este momento están en una zona de confort que aparentemente no planean dejar, con películas ni maravillosas ni pobres, sino un punto medio de Blockbusters que se ciernen entre lo bueno y lo entretenido, y lo predecible y lo poco original. Infinity War es solo eso, tiene momentos muy altos de brillantez absoluta, pero también otros llenos de mediocridad y creados exclusivamente para satisfacer a un público impresionable y conformista. Los momentos en que sacan a relucir las ventajas de pertenecer al mismo universo se desintegran cuanto más lo piensas, cuando te das cuenta de que habrá 5, 10, 15 películas más en el futuro que modificarán o ignorarán los eventos que sucedieron en el pasado. Películas, que no respetan las obras ni el público que las veneran y, por lo tanto, reducen el impacto de escenas supuestamente emotivas o que es muy probable que tengan mucho menos peso en el futuro. Básicamente, todos lo sabemos, pero no es raro ignorar y dar mayor potencial a algo como Infinity War, que no es una basura total, pero ni siquiera es lo mejor que Marvel ha hecho en su universo, ni mucho menos lo que el género de superhéroes tiene que entregar. Siendo justo, una calificación de 6 o 7 es lo correcto, quizás menos, pero más, no puedo asignarlo a algo que está vacío.
