Author: chasemykleby
Review_Title: Avengers Infinity War is a lot, but in a good way
Review:
Infinity War Review (10/10)
Avengers Infinity War is a lot, but in a good way. Marking the passing of a decade since the conception of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, Avengers: Infinity War acknowledges that Marvel's audience has grown up. There's a seemingly hopeless amount of characters packed into this story, but the Russo brothers make the bold decision to establish big bad Thanos as the primary protagonist, and the film is all the better for it.
The film is very fast paced in the beginning but then it smoothes it's self out and slows. The insane amount of action and characters means that not everybody gets enough screen time, but most make an impact on the story, in some form or another. Some of the new relationships and conflicts work extraordinarily well - Doctor Strange and Tony Stark make for pitch-perfect rivals, and Star Lord's gut-wrenching jealousy toward the sculpted, hyper-masculine Thor is hilarious.
Every single member of the team tries their utmost to prevent the apocalypse, and occasionally, even come infuriatingly close to overpowering Thanos. But it's never quite enough, and one important distinction between Thanos and the Avengers is repeatedly highlighted - our heroes are emotional creatures, unwilling to sacrifice their friends for the greater good, while Thanos is stone cold.
The final act, including the post-credits sting, brings a chill, a darkness and a hush that represent something new in this universe. Infinity War is the first half of the final installment in the series, and it concludes with a premonition of finality. Its intimations of grief and terror feel shrewdly attuned to what is happening in the actual, unmarvelous world.
Ultimately, Infinity War is a great film and one for the ages. This movie goes right into the top 5 of MCU movies and it just might be in the top 5 of all comic book movies. I recommend seeing this movie on the biggest possible screen, to experience it in it's full glory.

Author: holikdad-75845
Review_Title: Really, they thought this was the best way to do this?
Review:
So obviously based on my title I didn't like this film. There are so many holes that it would be impossible to even count them.
I'm so tired of CGI bad guys, I know we have the makeup skills to actually have "real" bad guys that don't look so fake. Seeing this cartoon the whole movie just really separated me from the "reality" that the movie makers were trying to present.
Randomly killing half the people in the universe? This was the best you could think of? What about in a few years when the remaining half over populate again? Is that going to be your job from now on? Mr. Genocide? "Yes, every 100 years I wipe out half of the population." Who wrote this? A 10 year old?
How about sterilizing 75 to 80% of the universe?
Also what about the Thanos character say's "I care about all life in the universe?" You do? Why? Your planet has already been destroyed so why do you give a crud about everyone else? Bad guy with a heart?
Also, if you're going to make this a two part film don't hide it. There was no reason to hide the fact that this one movie is not the end. I know the directors and writers think they're cute "Tee Hee" but you're not fooling anyone.

Author: baileyshaw99
Review_Title: "Avengers: Infinity War" - An Epic and Emotionally Charged Marvel Spectacle
Review: "Avengers: Infinity War," released in 2018, is a monumental superhero film that defies expectations and delivers an unparalleled cinematic experience. Directed by Anthony and Joe Russo, the film brings together a vast ensemble of beloved Marvel characters, culminating in an action-packed and emotionally charged battle against the formidable villain, Thanos (Josh Brolin). With its grand scale, stellar performances, and a masterfully crafted narrative, "Avengers: Infinity War" is a true spectacle that leaves audiences on the edge of their seats from start to finish.

Author: asrao316
Review: I dont know whether we have kids here or the PR agencies who have given this movie a 10/10, but this movie is certainly not a perfect 10, actually far from it. I dont want to complain about the plot, but right from the beginning the movie seems all over the place. We understand Thanos is after the infinity stones but the screenplay fails to deliver this story in a 'Marvel' way we are accustomed to enjoy. I really enjoyed Josh Brolin as the mighty 'Thanos" - He is just perfect in this role and delivers a stellar performance. If you are an Avengers fan, definately see this movie but dont expect a grand finale, because this is definately not.

Author: Sdpind
Review:
Yes, history repeats itself. The black panther phenomenon is back, now renamed as infinity war. An avengers' film didn't need all that false hype to reach 600 million, I supposed. The boldest superhero movie ever that could kill off any of its heroes just for the sake of making a masterpiece? Well, we are not so lucky, superheroes are for children because they don't die. They return, as multi million dollar potential still remains. So what's the point of fooling with incorrect ideas posted smartly to make one think otherwise. The secret lies with kids. No matter how mature or philosophical they pretend to be, a belief still remains that these works need grown up kids or real ones to break records. It's this idea that this film strengthens, putting Christopher Nolan's hard work to dust.
 And yet all this hype has found takers. In the world of today, humans too can be programmed (skynet beware). It happens so that mass hysteria gives way to a prolonged hypnosis that hinders the truth from coming out. There were times when bad films finally got what they deserved. But now it seems humans have gradually transformed into bots. A majority view is now a bot's view, programmed to perfection. 
 The movie industry is now devoid of its stories, superheroes don't die, but stories do. What's left is a mishmash of all the same. Now about the movie: weak plot, weak execution, with bits of unwanted comedy and no change. The future will be more of the same.

Author: ToThePointPR
Review_Title: A Comic Booky Romp with a Ton of Characters
Review: The is one of the best movies in the MCU line up, based purely on a storytelling and action. The villain(s) are great and the visuals are astounding. However on a personal level I lost a lot of enjoyment based solely on who was more of a main character than who. A lot of the characters I find annoying or boring had more time to do things in this movie than those I enjoy. Also Ebony Maw was dispatched too quickly. Movie loses its appeal the more time passes.

Author: cattycattyahh-55875
Review: This movie was so epic and got my heart pumping throughout the movie. This movie is about the villain, Thanos, trying to snap half of the population off of the face of the planet. It tells a great story with great acting and actors. As always, Robert Downy Jr. was great and so was Tom Holland. The movie seemed to build up on Tony Stark's and Tom Holland's relationship. Overall, wonderful movie with great acting!

Author: abhinavkesamsetty
Review_Title: A MUST-WATCH FOR ALL MARVEL FANS
Review: 'Avengers : Infinity War' proves to be the best example of a cinematic culmination. The apex of 10-year storytelling delivers all we expected. It's a rare experience and has to been seen in 3D. Featuring 30 characters in just 2.5 hours sounds a bit complex and intricate, but I would say that the Russo Brothers have nailed the film. Watching all our favourite characters of the MCU in one film is just perfect and undoubtedly the most satisying part of the film. This film sets a new standard for the MCU. The team-up of Doctor Strange and Iron Man is hilarious and puts a huge smile on my face. But the most exciting team-up is that of Thor and the Guardians of the Galaxy. The biggest strength of the film lies in the Russo Brothers' ability to combine different storylines and franchises and form a riveting culmination. Josh Brolin's performance as Thanos manages to live up to what we expected. The plot twists involved in this film are unpredictable. You'd never see them coming. The characterization absolutely hits the mark and is well-planned and satisfying. The CGI and the action sequences stand out. The climax is jaw-dropping and epic and leaves you excited for the future events. Overall, 'Avengers: Infinity War' has achieved a significant position in the MCU and manages to live up to the hype.

Author: xongames
Review_Title: This Movie is One Wild Ride
Review: Where do i start with this? Well, if you have not seen this already, youv'e been warned. First off, the costume design is amazing! Just look how shiny Spider-Man's suit is. And the amount of shock in this movie, its ridiculous. The theories were right about Red Skull being teleported into another planet. And the battle in Wakanda, wow. The Avengers then fail to stop Thanos from gathering all of the Infinity stones. Then comes the most heartbreaking scene, where half of all existance is ripped in two. I was in total shock when half of the Avengers fate lead to doom. The feeling that the heroes genuinely failed leaves a hole in your heart. The only problem with the movie is screen time. Not all Avengers had that much screen time, like Black Widow or Black panther. But otherwise, this movie is a masterpeice.

Author: Shanghai_Samurai
Review: I watched Infinity War for the third time, and the first at home on my television. The impact was no less than in the theater. It is a sprawling epic, made contextually satisfying if you have seen the lead-up Marvel films going into it. The characters are familiar yet evolved. Tom Holland as the teenage Spider-Man is especially refreshing as both new hero and fanboy. But most attention goes to Josh Brolin's motion-captured Thanos, a villain who is formidable, but engaging; evil but charismatic. No punches are pulled in the finale of this installment, leaving most exhausted and introspective. It affects more than a comic book adaptation should. My personal wish is that this was the end - no more sequels - as what a story it would be.

Author: rodwhitt
Review_Title: Wow ALL that just happened, and somehow I'm only slightly overwhelmed
Review:
Infinity War is a jam packed movie with tons of action and story balanced for a nonstop Marvel experience like never seen before. Infinity War managed to cram a solid story, countless characters meshing together, and fun action all in one film that should have been 4 hours long to fit everything in. Seeing the Guardians finally interact with Avengers characters is one of the most satisfying elements of Infinity War. 
My only flaw WOULD BE that soooo much is jammed into this film. However, the Russo brothers managed to pull it off as effectively as anyone could. The Jam packed film worked and didn't feel like "too much" as much as it would if anyone else had Done a film like this. Loved it, go see this!

Review_Title: Good but not the original comic books
Review: If they had followed the original comic books to the letter. They would have a much better series overall. And the Fantastic Four movies would not be so terrible! The original comic book was so cosmic and far out it was a trip to read. While the movie is okay, it just does not have the spirit of the original comic books. Something was lost somewhere. That being said, it is a good movie with plenty of action, some humor, and dazzling looks. Bringing all the various Comic book heroes of the Marvel Universe together is a spectacular way. But I lament, it was always done so much better in the books, Writers need to sit down and re-read the 70's and 80's comics from Marvel. They would have so much a better picture.

Author: lmathc
Review_Title: A Visceral But Messy Thrill Ride
Review: Avengers Infinity War is a 140-minute tornado that comes in and goes out punching with the intent to kill. It requires several viewings just to comprehend all the material this film contains. Its strengths are in its ludicrously intense levels of action and mayhem, as well as a great performance from Josh Brolin, who finally brings to life the most well-developed MCU villain to date. Weaknesses? Some pretty hard-to-ignore plot holes and an ending that fails to evoke the emotion in the way it so enthusiastically tries to. Final Remarks? Avengers: Infinity War is for anyone looking for an explosive, edge-of-your-seat adventure, but those seeking a richer and deeper emotional resonance will gravitate towards Endgame.

Author: jelaniwilliams305
Review: I'm really mixed to positive on this one. It's hard to explain my feelings about the movie without spoiling it, so I'll say this: the things that this movie does well, it does it REALLY well. Thanos was great as villain (his motives, not so much), the action scenes were good, I liked most of the character interactions, there were some emotional scenes that were done well, and a few things will transpire that you won't see coming, which was very exciting. After Thor's last atrocious solo outing (Ragnarok), I didn't really care much for his character but this time around, the Russo's brought the thunder (pun intended); he was my favorite of all the Avengers in this film (even though there were some still some residual Ragnarok traits, I'm willing to forgive them). The things that it does bad, it does REALLY bad. A lot of the humor was contrived; some of those emotional/dramatic scenes were ruined by poorly timed jokes, something that Ragnarok and GotGv2 suffered from immensely. Towards the middle of the film, the scenes seemed to kind of jump all over the place but that's just a small nitpick on my part. Certain characters were handled in a way that really bothered me, but I can't divulge on that point without spoilers. Lastly, the ending just fell flat for me; I understand what they were trying to do with the ending and it DID work to some degree, but for everything that happened in the movie and for it to end the way it did...it just didn't sit well with me. Overall, I thought the movie was good...the Russo Brothers are excellent directors (Winter Soldier is still, by far, my favorite MCU film) and I'm ready to see what they have in store for Avengers 4!!! 3.5/5 Stars

Author: cjase22007
Review: Avengers Infinity Wars is an excellent movie. Very well done in every way. I saw this in the theaters, and the one complaint I have is that it was hard to watch. In the opening scene, we see the ever powerful Thanos trying to get the Space Stone, while the Hulk, Thor and Loki try to stop him. They can't and so he retrieves the stone and begins his quest for the rest of the Infinity Stones. What follows it seems, is the Avengers pulling out all of the stops, trying to defeat Thanos and fighting a losing battle. Very cool, but hard to watch. Not sure, if I'll see it again. If by chance, you're one of the few people who haven't seen it, I won't give away the ending. The good news is that Captain Marvel has joined the Avengers. I'll have to see Endgame!

Author: morrisonliz
Review: I saw the movie on Friday. Needed a couple days to digest. I have read most of the reviews to see what people really thought of it. I will start with this, those who scored it low are mainly not fans of Marvel. They have no vested interest in any of the characters. It's too much for them because it's a slew of faceless characters. They are looking for something that isn't there...Drama, speak to world issues (Black Panther), Women's equality (Wonder Woman, The Last Jedi). This movie isn't that. It was written for the fans who have watched and waited. These are characters that have lived for years in comic books. Sorry if you don't like them. We understand our characters. We understand the history and the whats, whys and hows of their storylines here. It means something to us. We are invested. If you read their reviews you will see they complain about something they don't understand that is clear to the rest of us.

Author: jabeddigs
Review:
After watching every movie in the franchise (some more than once) in the last two weeks, I thought I was ready for this. 
I wasn't. 
I went to the Thursday night showing as I do with all of these movies, and it was packed.
People were clapping as different characters made their appearances, gasped at the same times, laughed at the same the same moments; it was a great experience.
I was blown away with this movie. It was everything I wanted it to be, and more. 
Lots of theories are going to be happening following the ending...and even more after the final credits. 
I thought about the movie all day today, and bought a ticket for tomorrow...just to see if I missed anything!
Go see this movie!
Can't wait to see how Captain Marvel and now Ant Man and The Wasp fit in now...that it appears they need some help.

Author: nickrbarretta
Review: Avengers Infinity War was the greatest MCU movie of all time. From beginning to end, I had a grin on my face. The beginning scene with Thor, Loki and Thanos was a great scene with true emotion and feel, but what I didn't like was that Loki has all of these powers that he could've used against Thanos, but he decided to stab him. This just doesn't make sense. I liked the scene with Dr Strange, Tony, Bruce and Wong was very great and their battle was better. Thor with the guardians was a great scene, Spider-Man with Iron Man was great, and all of the other Avengers in Wakanda was all great. When Thanos sacrifices Gamora to get the Soul Stone, you could see that he was genuinely upset and didn't want to, but he had to. And then the battle on Titan didn't have a single thing wrong with it, and you could see the genuine anger in Star Lord when he realizes what happened to Gamora. And then the end scene once Thanos snapped, it had so much emotion and was so unexpected that loud uproar in the theater made it even better. This was a great movie and I cannot wait for Avengers 4

Author: jakebunker
Review_Title: An impossible task that manages to work wonderfully
Review: I don't think many people realize just how genius of a movie this is. And a lot of people already know how genius of a movie it is. This movie and Endgame are going to be remembered for a very long time. I will be telling this story to my children. It is very unlikely that we will have such a grandiose movie after so great of a run in the MCU that works this well. The amount of preparation and work required for this is work is tremendous. On top of the 15 or so MCU movies before this dropped, it may just be the best MCU film so far at that point in time. (2018) You have 20 or so superheroes to give characterization towards while wrapping them into this giant blockbuster. And they couldn't have done it any better. The villain Thanos is one of the best MCU characters I've seen put on screen, not quite Tony Stark level but still amazing. The end of this movie is the perfect cliffhanger, and I remember just wondering where the story could possibly go from here. To do this much work and make it the best MCU property at the time is really a feat that I can't imagine being replicated, at least for a good while. Perhaps it's not everyone's cup of tea because there is so much action involved but it sure is mine. Bravo, guys!

Author: amandadun
Review_Title: Packed with action, humor, and high emotional stakes
Review:
A cinematic crossover event unprecedented in its action, humor and melodrama, "Avengers: Infinity War" is an ambitious addition to the MCU in the same way "Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back" (1980) or "Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 1" (2010) were for their own series.
The film somehow manages to coherently smash together a multitude of heroes and produce compelling, non-stop entertainment with high emotional stakes. There are minor frustrations with some characters needing more screen time, but "Avengers: Infinity War" accomplishes its goals as the first entry in an epic two-part installment. 9/10 or A-

Author: skyfighter-76309
Review_Title: The Godfather Of Superhero Movies and The Most Epic Climax since Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back
Review:
About a month ago I watched Avengers: Infinity War. I've been a fan of Marvel before the Cinematic Universe begin in 2008. After many Installments from Marvel, Infinity War lives up to the real hype compared to it's predecessors. We follow the point of view of multiple major Marvel Characters, The movie has a great line of characters and actors portraying their roles at their best. Thanos is one of the most complex villains in the entire marvel cinematic universe, Josh Brolin delivers the Mad Titan Thanos from the comics perfectly. 
 
The Story has a very different style to it, as we focus on our characters we realize that our greatest heroes have thought this would be a victory like the other battles they fought but for the first time in The Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers we're defeated and suffered from one of the most traumatic losses compared to any Superhero film that shows a character defeated by his antagonist. The movie will be having a Part II.

Author: taitavrit
Review: This is my favorite movie ever. From the action, to combining the superheroes, to the story. This movie is amazing from beginning to end. I just would like to put this out there, only 2 people in the movie are really dead. That's Loki and Heimdall. Gamora, Vision, and everybody who turned to dust are alive. They are trapped inside the soul stone. All in all, this is the greatest movie ever made.

Author: leegato

Author: Monkeywizard055
Review: Avengers: Infinity War is one of the most visually stunning movies ever put to screen, that includes the outstanding cinematography, brilliantly choreographed action sequences, a beautifully written script (improved by the incredible performances) and plot. It changes what we expect from a marvel movie, pretty much all of the marvel movies had the same structure until infinity war, for once the heroes are loosing, and don't walk into the sunset triumphant in the end. Since The Avengers in 2012, Thanos has always been an excuse to have a post-credit scene, but Josh Brolin steals the show with his performance as the mad titan, this doesn't feel like an avengers movie, it feels like a Thanos movie... and thats a good thing. And then the final scene happens, the movie could of ended with Captain America in Wakanda but no, the movie ends with Thanos, the very last scene has no talking its just a completely visual treat, theres no evil laugh from Thanos at the end, just a smile; and when the screen goes black everyone is left in amazement at the fact for the first time.. the heroes lost... and the villain won, Josh Brolin makes his character feel more sinister than ever before, mix that with lovable characters, great humour and breath-taking action, and you have yourself one of the finest pieces of cinema ever put to screen.

Author: BoshArrow
Review_Title: Finally, the wait is over!!! Epic movie!
Review: I have just watched "Avengers: Infinity War" and I feel inspired - the wait is over! Amazing characters, epic action scenes, you will laugh, but you will also cry. It was great to see my favourite Guardians of the Galaxy together with the Avengers - "I am Groot" followed by "I am Steve Rogers". Author: gus76
Review_Title: Good fun but ultimately one big Deus ex machina
Review:
This is a wonderful event film which makes perfect cinema entertainment, however on reflection, and now my own hype for it has dissipated, there are quite a few questions and potential plot hole that actually bother me
SPOILERS AHEAD!
The film jumps straight into the end of Thor Ragnarok and Asgaurdian ship being destroyed with nearly all the Asgaurdians being killed. But what happened to Korg? They seemed to build him up in Ragnarok and he became an instant fan favourite, so for him to just be killed off screen seems a bit disrespectful to the character and the fans.
Also, why would the Hulk only show up right at the end? What was he doing? I understand it was so Loki could use the line 'we have a hulk', that Tony Stark used on him in Avengers, but there is no way the Hulk would have sat out the initial attack.
Speaking of the hulk, why, after getting a beating from Thanos, does he refuse to 'come out' for the rest of the film? This is not who THE HULK is! 
Remember when the Hulk one punched that Jitari battle worm thing? 
Marvel clearly does not. 
He has been getting weaker each film and this time decides to sit it out despite the fate of the universe being at stake.
Also during this opening scene, the ship is badly damaged and clearly exposed to space. Ebony Maw, one of the Black Order, is here, unaffected by this, just like everyone else. But later in the film, being sucked out of his spaceship kills him and you see him freeze in space. Why? Earlier he was unaffected. There has to be consistency here.

Author: iamiraclelingcoran
Review: Avengers Infinity War isn't perfect, but it sure is one hell of a ride! This is a spoiler free review. I'll start off with elements that did not work for me (or at least, I thought, could've been better). There are a few VFX shots (such as fully-CGI characters, noticeable green screens, etc.) in the film that looked quite unpolished, but mostly very small aspects. But then again, the scope of the film is so huge that it seems impossible to fully render every element on every frame. Another element that felt quite lacking, for me, was the character development (especially for newcomers such as the Children of Thanos, and some heroes). No spoilers, but the purpose of the Black Order in the film is ultimately to serve as a physical threat for the heroes. Most of our beloved heroes have very little screen-time in this installment, both for the best and worse. However, there are some characters who get to shine more in this one.

Author: qiucindy
Review:
Marvel never fails at creating action-packed films. I was never bored throughout the movie. I am a sucker for good superhero action, so I found this very enjoyable. However, this is only nice if you don't over think it. Once you start analyzing the film and each individual character, things get confusing. 
You can see for yourself, but as a fan of many Marvel superheroes, I was kind of disappointed at how some of them were portrayed (you'll see what I mean). I feel like Marvel made this film plot only regarding the end goal, hence they manipulated and portrayed many characters oddly (and incorrectly) just to reach that end goal. 
This whole film felt like the set up for the sequel. The film had an overly simple plot and seemed set up just to give background for the upcoming sequel. 
MY RECOMMENDATION is to wait until the sequel is out, and then watch the two movies successively. I think that would be the most satisfying.
Nonetheless, I enjoyed the action. Viewing this film without overanalysing it would leave you pretty satisfied.

Author: dalyons-09311
Review_Title: Masterclass in Pacing With a Few Missteps
Review: Avengers: Infinity War has some of the best pacing I have ever seen. The movie seemingly perfectly balances all of its characters between the different storylines and brings them together at the appropriate times. It doesn't feel like any one character gets too much of the spotlight, and very few characters feel like they didn't get their due. Despite how much I love Endgame, I have to admit this is something Infinity War does way better. The movie is also nonstop action. If they were going for epic climax, they absolutely nailed it. This movie brings together all of the characters for a massive battle perfectly. I also love the dark, unconventional ending. I appreciate bold choices when done right, and this absolutely was. Thanos was such a good villain and was very sympathetic. He really felt like he deserved to win. If that were the end of the story, it would get a perfect 10 and be the best MCU movie. Unfortunately, three things hold it back. First, I don't think the action choreography is as strong. The Titan fight is great, but the Wakanda fight is basically just two armies charging at each other. I still remember how great it was in the first Avengers when there was a tracking shot that moved from character to character and how everything was perfectly coordinated. Age of Ultron even had a scene like that. Infinity War just felt like, well, a war. The action wasn't as fun as it could be. But the more glaring problem is that the movie doesn't make sense. Them having Doctor Strange say they only win one scenario was such a bad writing decision. No scenario where Thor goes for the head? Or where Star Lord doesn't interrupt the trance? I can count half a dozen ways in this movie they could've won. I'm okay with them losing, but don't pretend like they couldn't have won. To say that this was the best case scenario was ridiculous. What would've made more sense is if, after Star Lord screwed everything up, Doctor Strange says something along the lines of "we missed it, but I have a backup plan." I can suspend my disbelief a lot in a fantasy movie, but I can't pretend I'm stupid enough to think that this was the only scenario in which they beat Thanos. Finally, I hate that Star Lord screwed up so badly. Thor not going for the head is fine. He made a mistake, but I can forgive mistakes. What Star Lord did was basically sabotage. Someone should've shot him in the head. As a viewer, that's not an enjoyable thing to watch, especially for such a beloved character. It would've been so much more satisfying if the heroes were at their best, and Thanos STILL won. The other way around, it's so much more satisfying when a hero wins against a great villain than against a stupid villain. In the same way, it's more satisfying if Thanos beats great heroes than dumb heroes.

Author: jddv
Review_Title: Phew! They didn't stuff it up, but...
Review:
Okay, so I kinda have two initial reactions here.
The first is that with all the hype, sheer number of characters, cross-over story lines and preceding history I was worried that the Russo brothers would miss the mark and at the very least deliver a shonky mess. In my opinion they didn't and as a result, as a fan of comics, the MCU and movies in general, I came out of the cinema feeling that I had seen a well balanced, by-the-fans-for-the-fans, culmination of work that satisfied me on most levels.

Author: mathiasnee
Review_Title: DO NOT WATCH! Because any movie after this one will never be good enough
Review:
After watching Infinity War last night my heart still hasn't dropped to under 100 bpm. The movie is breathtakingly beautiful, and will make you feel almost every emotion possible. The Russo brothers did an amazing job balancing the enormous cast, and made a movie which scale has never been scene before! Review_Title: Solid 9.25-9.5. If you're a Marvel fan, you will NOT be disappointed
Review: Going into this movie, I was a little worried it would be underwhelming. This movie delivered! it was action-packed from start to finish. A couple of things that bothered me a tiny bit were the cgi with the black order and the slightly underdeveloped relationship between Thanos and Gamora. Concerning the relationship between Thanos and Gamora, it's hard to cultivate a strong relationship in a movie that has so many other plots to accomplish (so it's easy to understand/forgive).

Author: bfml-03018
Review_Title: Marvel never gets tired of surprising
Review:
An event builded for 10 years with no worries of developing deeply most part of it's characters (a merit) an.d sometimes (mainly during wakanda war) lacks balanced tone and for that, becomes some few times a cgi mess. But, even with the advantage of not developing, every character has personality and we fear for their lifes. The action scenes are balanced and well done except wakanda battle and when it embraces tension is awesome and well done. The cgi is good for the most part, thanos cgi is amazing.
Thanos is the best part, the movie is about him, he's the protagonist. It shows his rise in snapping and "killing" half of the universe and his emotional fall. Gamora gets a lot more of deep (something that really lacked in GOTG 1 and 2) to.
A great accomplishment for marvel, russos and for the superheroes story in cinema.

Review_Title: The only reason it is rated so high is for the ending.

More things happen. Oh yeah, spider man can survive in space without oxygen. Bunch of guys fight purple dude instead of going to the other side of the galaxy and hiding. Some stuff happens. Purple guy is sad. Random generic battle at the end with an extremely random army of space dogs that lasts way to long because the earth guys are incompetent. Some more dudes fight purple guy and should have no chance at killing him but somehow don't die instantly. Ending is pretty cool. Kansas would be proud. Also Tyrion Lannister just shows up for no reason.

Author: steven-brown487
Review_Title: Quite possibly, the best movie ever made.
Review:
I cannot emphasise how good this movie is. It's ridiculously brilliant. The plotting, pace, script, acting, FX. The screen time given to each, of what must be the biggest ensemble of A List stars ever, is nothing short of miraculous.
The film is above and beyond the usual superhero fare, the villain, Thanos, is expertly envisioned, played and brought to life by Josh Brolin and is quite possibly the best movie villain ever.
As you can imagine, I am biased. I obviously love the genre but that's irrelevant. Before this movie came along, the 1933 version of King Kong was my favourite movie. It may still be when the Marvel Cinematic Universe runs its course but this movie, at the moment, is at No 1.
How on earth can Avengers: Endgame top it?

Author: dr-tarek-fattah

Author: pouge162
Review: The Russo Bros. Inc. have done a three for three! What a nearly perfect movie they have delivered. Unfortunately for those of us who have been reading comics for 40+ years, we have to deal with those without the knowledge of how epic a movie this is. What a superb job they did in melding this large group into a movie that is in most parts, seamless. Like Age of Ultron, the more I watch this movie, the better it gets. It is brutal in the death of Loki, it is humorous in Stark, Starlord and Spidey's quips. It is heart wrenching in Gamora's sacrifice. It is devestating in Thanos' victory. Action packed and a thrill ride of a movie with substance. With my opinion worth a grain of salt, near perfection. Sit back, pop some popcorn and enjoy. Personally, Winter Soldier is still my favorite, but only by an inch and narrowing with each watch.

Author: artswan-77642
Review_Title: Great fun but plot doesn't track.
Review: The movie was a lot of fun and more than up to Marvel's high standards, but the plot line doesn't track. If the infinity stones are so powerful and so dangerous, and in the hands of Thanos can give him the power to wipe out half the universe, then why not just gather them up and take them to the mega-sized black hole at the center of our galaxy and launch them into the gravity well? Once they are sucked in past the event horizon, NOTHING, not even Thanos can get them back. And if there is any blow-back from the infinity stones as they are being destroyed, compared to the size and power of a giant black hole that sucks in star systems, planets, and other black holes for a daily snack, they would be nothing. Anything as dangerous as these stones, no one should be able to have.

Author: artswan-77642
Review: The movie is great and Marvel keeps kicking out fun shows. However, the logic of this scenario doesn't track. If these infinity stones are so powerful and bad, and if gathered together by Thanos they pose a threat to half the universe, then why weren't they gathered up, taken to the super-massive black hole at the center of our galaxy, launched into the gravity well and destroyed? No matter how powerful the blow-back from the stones, compared to a black hole that swallows star systems, planets, and other black holes for a snack everyday, they would be nothing. Once beyond the event horizon, NOTHING, not even Thanos could get them back.

Avergers: Infinity War is a culmination of Marvel Superheroes from the MCU, and this is by far, my favourite. The Russo brothers did a fantastic job of holding the audience's attention till the end credits and manged to provide a cliffhanger there too. It HAS lived up to the hype.

Author: emiliecunning-21094
Review: After watching this movie now for a second time, I have to conclude that it is definitely the best Marvel movie yet! It certainly was tricky for the directors and writers to include so many different characters from the MCU in the movie, yet they managed to do so brilliantly, cutting to different character plots at clever points to tell the story. What really makes the movie so superior is that Josh Brolin's Thanos is a deep, complex villain who you can't say is inherently evil because he realises there are finite resources within this universe although his method of genocide is clearly not the right way to go about things! But Thanos is definitely the greatest Marvel villain to date, especially given that unlike many other Marvel villains, we have seen him before in the Guardians movies and post-credits for both previous Avengers films. The performances by everyone in this movie are exceptional, everyone is undoubtedly at the top of their game here - in particular, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr, whose characters have now evolved to such an extent that their desperation and desire for vengeance (especially in Thor's case) is truly apparent in the execution of their roles. Zoe Saldana's Gamora is also wonderful in this movie, I definitely like the character a lot more than before due to her heartfelt speech to Thanos before he trades her for the soul stone: "All my life I dreamed of a day, a moment, when you got what you deserved. And I was always so disappointed. But now, you kill and torture and you call it mercy. The universe has judged you. You asked it for a prize and it told you no. You failed. And do you wanna know why? Because you love nothing. No one." AMAZING WRITING! Not to mention, the special effects, oh my word, they are out of this world! (Literally!) If this isn't nominated for Visual effects come Oscar Time, there will be riots! The whole thing is just spectacular. It is certainly heartbreaking at the end to see all these characters being turned to dust, especially ones who are the more recent Avengers, but it certainly raises the stakes to have the movie end on such a gripping, apocalyptic note! Of course, many people believe these characters will be revived - come on, are you really going to kill off Black Panther? - somehow in Avengers 4, especially as there is already GOTG 3 in the works as well as Spiderman 2 & Black Panther 2. This probably means some of the OG Avengers are gonna hit the bucket, but we've had a good run with them and it's time for some new faces. Fingers crossed Bucky becomes the new cap (Seb Stan still has 3 movies left in his contract!) Will cry all over again I'm sure next April but I just cannot wait to go see it!!! Thank God Captain Marvel arrives next March - this girl gonna kick some purple ass in Avengers 4 no doubt! If you haven't seen this movie yet, WHAT ARE YOU DOING? GOOOO!!!

Author: j-lennerth
Review: Ok, so Stark, Strange, and Spiderman are aboard the ship after sending Thanos' henchman out into space-Alien/Aliens style. Then Dr.Strange comments that there's no way to turn the ship around to get back to earth. Did he forget he can wave a circular motion in the air and make a bridge back to earth or anywhere else in the universe? Iron Man could've set charges aboard the space ship- nuking it 1 min after they portaled back to earth and vaporized the entire ship and any data on board of where it's been. Thanos has no clue where the other stones are and Peter & Tony would be back on Earth to give near full might, minus Thor, back to the Avengers squad. How about Dr. Strange creating a portal above Thanos head, glove arm, or chest, and the other portal sending it into any sun other than ours in the universe? Cover blatant plot holes screenwriters...although this movie is geared towards the nondiscerning teen audience. So there's that..... or Strange could go back in time right after Loki was defeated on Earth and told Stark/Avengers. Heck, he could've went back before the attack and stopped Loki before he set into motion the invasion and told the others. He could've went back to after Thor came to earth and told him of all the events...and to tell Oden about Hela, etc & to stop Thanos before he attacked Gamora's world & ended it before it began. In addition, Gamora knows the stakes but folds and tells Thanos Voimir( spelling?) as to the Soul Stone's location. Caving under any circumstances is inexcusable but here it's atrocious. No reasonable character would do that. I'd tell Thanos some other planet and lead him on a series of goose chases until I (Gamora) could kill myself- since he has no time stone. Cut your tongue out and fingers off. Stab your eyes out, then jam a sharp knife like object into your ear. This is why scifi sucks for adults...particularly new Star Wars movies are really stupid. Like it takes a real genius( sarcasm) to concieve using anything at the speed of light to destroy things. You could've shot an escape pod at the speed of light at the Death Star and the Death Star would've been vaporized by the energy. Either have a universe where characters can conceive of these things from first sec of movie 1 or have them never think of it. How about how Last Jedi has bombs drop in space fall down towards the enemy ship....it's space. Things don't fall down from free will.

Author: JennaDW
Review_Title: Absolutely worth your time and your money
Review: Infinity War is everything it claims to be and more. The creators of the Marvel franchise have done it again with this new film. The perfect blend of action, drama, comedy, and romance. A culmination of almost every film genre out there. A perfect climax to all the Marvel films thus far. Its safe to say that anyone who has seen this movie will definitely be tuning in for the next one.

Author: Ishaan_Bhatnagar
Review_Title: Go > Watch > Enjoy > Applaud = Infinity War
Review:
MCU introduced this movie as the dream project and YES!! this movie is bent on target. BINGO..!! If you have been a Marvel student since IRONMAN until Black Panther you are gonna love this movie. It is really remarkable how the Avengers and their Space allies are brought together as one team against THANOS. 
The script looks a bit loose but the dialogues will thrill you for sure. The screenplay, background score and the visual effects are fascinating.
Regarding the characters, you are going to love the appearance of your favorite superhero but THOR and CAPTAIN AMERICA steals all the charisma, specially the intro scenes of Captain America. Chris Evans looks are eye-catching and he is looking stunning. Thor again emerges as the most powerful Avenger. Tony Starks aka Ironman aka Robert Downey Jr. has been cool as ever with his new suit and Dr. Strange, Gamora, Vision, Starlord, Black Widow,SPIDERMAN, Wanda Maxinoff and so many others looks justifying with their roles.
I will recommend viewers to visit the cinemas near you, watch the movie and enjoy the funride. But... but.. hold your nerves a bit tight as we are gonna loose some heros.. The heros you might love and admire..... Thank You!!

Author: lraimundo
Review:
Infinity War is one of the best Marvel movies (and of the Superhero genre in general), but is not perfect. 
The way the Russo brothers entangled all the stories of this past ten years is pretty good, and seeing all the near 30 characters of the MCU in one movie is a really cool fan service, but let's be realistic: the movie is a complete fan service. The weight of the movie is carried by 2 groups of heroes, leaving the rest of the cast there without doing something else that doesn't add much to the plot. One would expect to see all the characters together in the same scene, but some of these never met in the whole movie and didn't even do or say something remarkable. 
That's the BIG flaw of this movie, but there are so many good stuff here, like the villain, Thanos, the best character in the whole movie. His motives and actions are very well justified and portrayed by Josh Brolin. He is a strong character with a strong personality, and he steals the movie. 
The visuals are also very good, with a minor issues in some characters, who look like videogame PNJ. The music is so intense and is an emotional homage to the original Avengers soundtrack. 
Anyway, Infinity War is an enjoyable movie for superhero fans, and will be arguable considered as the "best superhero movie ever" by some easy-to-please fans and critics, but that's just a tag far from the reality.

Author: VVMini
Review_Title: Wildly entertaining and surprisingly bold and unconventional (MAJOR SPOILERS AHEAD)
Review: Avengers: Infinity War is popcorn spectacle of the highest order, bringing action scene after action scene with barely any respite. It sounds almost exhausting, but because of the large variety of both characters and locations, it never gets stale. Almost all the Avengers gets their moment to shine, and all add to the plot in an organic and interesting manner, though team Captain America seemed to draw the short stick because they were easily the least impactful group. There are some really cool new combinations of superheroes (like Thor and Rocket, and Starlord and Iron Man) that actually feel earned after 10 years of build up. It reminded me a lot of Game of Thrones, that after scattering the main characters they're finally all being brought back together in interesting combinations that you did not think you needed but now can't imagine not existing.

Review: Overall Avengers: Infinity War is a descent 3 act film. First and foremost the opening scene is one of the best I've seen in any film in the MCU, it really establishes the power disparity between Thanos and our heroes. To start with some of the things I liked about the film I think most of the comedy beats hit well, the performances are there, exhilarating fight scenes and Thanos being the central character was a good move by the filmmakers.

Author: public-946-439721
Review: Overall, I love this movie. The fights are comic book accurate. I loved seeing Rhodey and the non-Accords team give Ross the finger. But the battle in Wakanda frustrates the h_ll out of me. Yes, Wakanda is a pre-eminent technological power.. But apparently no one there has studied military tactics and strategy. I understand that they might eschew "colonizer" ideas. But there's no preparation for a "conventional" assault? No air support? No artillery? No landmines? No mortars? No snipers?? No grenades? NOTHING that could bleed a larger enemy from a distance? Nothing that gives a smaller force any advantage? You have a force field that eliminates 20 - 50 percent of the enemy crossing it. Forcing a siege wears down the enemy and allows time to remove Vision's stone, evacuate civilians, and call for reinforcements. Did Cap, Bucky, Sam, Rhodey or ANYONE with military expertise have any input on this?

Author: marcusq22
Review: A delightfully nerdy mash-up that is a kitchen sink of genres. It had all the major players in the MCU to date, but they were still able to balance things out and avoid it feeling too busy / crowded. Incorporated themes that cut across time, space, death, and reality. The story kept me on the edge of my seat right up until the end. Not since 'Wrath of Khan' has a movie left me with a feeling of "Holy crap, what are they going to do next!" Must-see.

Review_Title: A break from normal superhero movies on so many levels
Review:
To truly appreciate this movie, you need to look at it from Thanos' perspective. As messed up as his methods are, when you look at Earth from his perspective with how the fate of his planet was, you can see his point. 
Look at it from his perspective as the good guy and our chosen heroes as the bad guys and it plays out as a great action film with an awesome amount of humour and action with it. 
That is what made this film brilliant.
It also makes me wish that Thor and Rocket had met years ago.

Author: fadoo14
Review:
This movie is a big surprise and I didn't see that coming! First, the movie has all the good elements of a great epic movie. The Russo brothers obviously influenced by movies like star wars and lord of the rings, they managed to successfully run parallel adventures and storylines similar to these classics. Second, this is probably one of the best ever characterisation of a villain in a Superhero movie (even better than the joker in the Dark Knight). Thanos is the main character in this movie and the screenwriters did a great job developing a very complex villain charater. Thanons is super complex, fully of emotions and actually has a purpose in what he is doing and you don't find that often in villain characters.
Lastly, the action scenes were great especially the one with Captain America enterance! I don't even like Cap cause of his uber self-righteous character however his first appearance in the movie made me jump out of my seat like a 10 years old boy!

Review_Title: To quote Thanos: "This will put a smile on you face"
Review: The End is Near... Or is it? The long awaited Superhero event of all time is finally here! The full might of the Marvel Cinematic Universe comes full Circle as the superheroes of the Avengers and the Guardians of the Galaxy team up to take on their greatest enemy ever. The Mad Titan Thanos! But does this film live up to its decade long hype? Read on to find out...

Author: Movie-Dart16
Review_Title: Another Amazing Blast of the 3rd Phase, Marvel did it again!
Review: Infinity War was a spectacle of a film, I really don't know what to say as a big Marvel/DC fanboy, The film does kind of open a little clunky so I thought that was a little flaw. But to all this wait, it was worth it. The action sequences were non stop and the film didn't let me breathe from start to finish which I felt exhilarated as of seeing everyone reunite together for 10 years and that's what this film gave me. It does a solid job on it's performances with a big cast and it's so amazing to see them on screen again. The humor was hilarious and I love the way Marvel makes their jokes so memorable and it did deliver that. Thanos was a masterpiece as the villain or is he a villian? His CGI was great but by the last act it's quite noticeable, Either way, he was so great in this film, his motivation is so great it felt intimidating every time he appeared on screen and is a touching character at times and I love the way the Russo Bros really gave him a backstory that expresses the character more. The Black Order was ehhhhh idk but Ebony Maw was the one I felt more a character in him and was cool. CGI was overused alot with a big budget and it was great. The ending was a bit contreversal and shocking and will leave audiences heartbroken in which I thought was a very well executed scene that you feel tension once it happens. Overall, Avengers infinity War was a masterpiece of a film, if you go into this film with an empty brain with no idea about how it leads to this then this is not a film you'll be surprised if don't watch the previous MCU movies, the action sequences were so enjoyable, the humor was hilarious I only thought a very few didn't land and is a pretty unexpected and emotional film that hits you hard and I am totally speechless about this film 10/10

Review:
The Russo brothers made it RIGHT! all 3 act's of this movie made me want to see more.

 I saw some tears in kids eyes. If you're disappointed In this movie, then i think you have problems that a GREAT MOVIE can't fix! 
 Remember people it's a fantastic story of fantasy and action and IT'S PART 1 OF 2...
 I hope you enjoy the show!

Author: fandom_cultures
Review: Where do I even begin? Avengers Infinity War is one of the best if not THE BEST Marvel movie that I have ever seen. Everything in this movie was excellent from the acting and action to the special effects and music. Josh Brolin nailed his performance as Thanos and gives one of the best supervillain portrayals.

Author: PapaDobie
Review_Title: Why Do We Go to the Movies?
Review: I don't know about you, but more often than not, I watch movies or TV shows to escape for a while. I grew up as a keen movie fan and this has continued into adulthood. I've enjoyed all the Marvel Universe movies to date, some more than others. Winter Soldier was a highlight, Civil War was great, but when I heard they were going to bring it all together, I must admit I thought it was going to be a bit messy - still enjoyable - but messy. I am happy to report that I was wrong. THIS is what I want from a night at the cinema! Bags of action, snappy dialogue, incredible special effects and most importantly, surprisingly ...heart. Every hero gets their moment and not in a rushed or crammed in manner. The set pieces are astonishing, the laughs fast and plentiful. Brolin is the best villain in The MCU to date, managing to be both hateful and sympathetic, sometimes in the same scene! As the fella once said, "I may not know art but I know what I like", well this will never win an Oscar for Best Picture, but I would rather watch this than La La Land or Moonshine any day of the week. I can't wait to see where they take this next. Bravo Marvel, bravo.

Author: mscravings
Review: Marvel did not disappoint at all.. and even exceeded my expectations. I was a bit worried before that it might get messy to fit all those heroes in one movie.. but the story and screenplay overall was brilliant. How the story went was bold .. and ignited more interest and anticipation on what's next for MCU. After getting out of the cinema, I wanted to scream how great it was and talk about it .. but it's too great of a movie to spoil it for someone else :). Oh please.. don't even think about skipping this movie!

Review_Title: The Empire Strikes Back of the MCU
Review: I went into this film like I had Age of Ultron. Thinking that this will top the original Avengers. Unlike Age of Ultron, which i walked away thinking "it was good but not better than the original", this film exceeded all expectation. The Russo Brothers delivered a beautiful tragic story that will leave you not believing what you've seen. MCU writers have given us one of the most feared and hated villains of all time. This film was not a slapped together at a drop of a hat and attempt to make money. This is a ten year work of art. This was a well planned movie that began from Fury walking out of the shadows in Starks Living room in Iron Man and came to a close with Fury turning to Ash. The best acted MCU movie by far that is lead by Downey Jr., Saldana, Hemsworth, and Brolin.

Review_Title: An Honest Review from a Non-Marvel Fan

If you are a hardcore Marvel fan, and you for some reason did not see it opening weekend, you should still see it despite it's not being the best of Marvel. It is not an objectively terrible movie, it just isn't really as strong as some other Marvel productions. But you certainly will like it being a fan of Marvel, but probably not if you aren't into the style/genre.

Author: Maguir3
Review_Title: An ending fit for movie history
Review: Infinity War embodied everything that the MCU was aiming to do with the iconic Marvel Characters we all know and love. With epic fights, awesome characters played by an incredible cast, coupled with an incredible soundtrack, this movie creates the spectacle we all wanted. With that said, the ending is what I want to bring attention to. After Thanos snaps his fingers and wipes the universe of half of all the living things it holds, he retreats to a remote world to live out the rest of his days in peace. In his mind, he completed the mission he set out to complete; restore balance to the universe. We see him take a seat and quietly admire the sunset in the beautiful planet his little hut is on. A masterpiece of directing from the Russo Brothers. This is backed by an incredible final piece of music composed by Alan Silvestri that completes the scene in such a perfect way, it's hard not to feel emotion. It's not often we see a villain win in the end, but here we did. The way it was presented to us was so perfect, it will be hard to beat as best movie endings go.

Author: bssonicspeed
Review_Title: This puts a smile on my face.
Review:
This movie is epic, it's an experience, but it just didn't get a lot out of me. First of all, you have got to admire what the Russo brothers were going for with this, the directing of this film is flawless. The writing and the acting in this movie is just fantastic, in my opinion the best portrayal of this movie, is Robert Downy Jr. as Tony Stark/ Iron Man, he had the best part of the character development in this movie. But in a close second comes Josh Brolin as Thanos, and thanos is the definition of what a movie villain should be, he was menacing, his motivation is excellent, you don't know what he was going to do next, thanos just puts me on the edge of my seat, and the something that he actually has where a lot of other movie villains don't, is having an actual good purpose for what he is trying to achieve, I don't see that in most movie villains nowadays. The comedy is great in this movie, if it's a marvel movie, you are definitely going to laugh a whole lot. The cinematography is great, I could see what's happening throughout the entire movie. I liked the action, but there were times where the action didn't get a lot out of me, and those times felt like the action was bland, thankfully, it's not that many. There were certain aspects of the movie that bothered me, and one of them was hulk. He barely showed up in this movie, and I wanted a lot of hulk scenes in this film, and that really upsetted me off. There were very few characters in this movie that just felt like they had no purpose of being in this movie.
Conclusion: Avengers Infinity War is definitely an experience, but it didn't get a whole lot out of me and certain aspects of the movie just didn't feel right in my opinion. But, the movie has a lot of charm, and is definitely a fun time watching.

Author: chickensquash-21305
Review_Title: Very good and solid movie, with some noteworthy flaws
Review: So it's finnally here, and was really worth the wait. So let's dive into it. All the acting was pretty solid and good but was never weak. The main reason I gave this movie a 7 instead of a 6 is because of how well it handeled it's sub plots so well. I looked at how little each character actually got on screen. It really didn't feel like that in movie. That put aside let's talk about the plot overall. The plot was pretty good and I felt it was well paced. There really felt like there was a reason to worry for these characters and I felt true suspense. Thanos motivations are pretty good until you think about it to much. It really tears the movie down when you do, so it was a bit forgiving to let it slide and keep this a 7/10 instead of a 6/10. Overall it was a really good time and I really enjoyed myself watching it. I suggest it to any McU fan and anyone looking for good natured action and suspense.

Author: sloveniandragon
Review:
This movie has problems , i will list them:
1.There is plot hole, we do not see Thanos how he destructed Zandar ,how he got the Power Stone , we also do not see Thanos how he battled in the beginning with Hemidall and Thor people.
2.Vison powers are not shown, you see Vision beaten up several times and stabbed like he is an ordinary guy and not an superhero , they had to show Vision powers, what we get from Vison is only that he shots a laser beam to one of the members of Black Order and what a surprise The Black Order beats his guts.
3.Groot powers are not also shown , i mean why you present a character when you dont present his special abillites.
4.Thanos uses the powers of four stones , come on Thanos with all that power how did you let without using the Mind and Spirit stone power ,this is ridicilous.
5.What we liked was to see Hulk battle ,but we only see him beaten up by Thanos and the green guy is afraid to show up himself.
6.There is not enough action at all , ok there are some awesome scenes between Doctor Strange, Ebony Maw and Thanos but we needed more ,we needed all the avenger battle against Thanos and not separated.
7.Iron Man suit is greatly advanced but with all those advances it makes it ridiculous and unbelievable, his suit was more original in Iron Man 1 and Avengers 1.
Overall is a good movie with monotonous action scenes , a good comedy and some good unexpected emotional scenes.

Author: milthop44
Review_Title: Not the best Avengers movie but still okay
Review:
I loved the first two Avengers, I thought they were amazing. I feel like this one suffered inspiration. The jokes were more irritating than funny, there were too many Super Heroes at different locations and the dialogues were poor.
The only people I was into, were Thanos (amazing) and Gamora. It's difficult to be invested in that movie because right from the beginning, you're already in the middle of some actions, and it never stops, feeling like you may have missed something.
There isn't a real plot, more of a philosophical approach that sustains the film, but a pretty good one.
Thanos was frankly genuinely amazing. The dialogues between him and Gamora were the more interesting. The battles seemed too inconsistent, too many effects, too little story. The ending on the other hand was fantastic. It saved the film. I was expecting the usual ending (good thing Thor didn't go for the head lol), and was very surprised. 
Hope to see more of Gamora and Thanos on the next episode.

Author: jacksoneverettjl
Review: If you're super into the Marvel universe, you'll love this movie. It's a great culmination of the last 10 years, and it felt more dynamic than others. I think it was fantastic that it made me care about Thanos and understand him, which I find difficult for other animated characters. The visuals were spectacular and in a few instances the shots looked absolutely beautiful. Most of the performances were pretty good, and I think the disparities in their performances had to come from being fed pretty awful lines of dialogue. The score was just as you'd expect, and there was nothing new about it. My main issue is with the writing. As I stated earlier, the dialogue was not good at all. Thanos seemed to be really easy to defeat considering the powers that he showed us that he had. He didn't seem to test the rules of his powers, or even use them at all. They clearly didn't have a "refresh timer" or something because of later scenes, so why would he not use them less sparingly? Most of it was predictable based on earlier scenes, and some of it felt like filler (but not much). The action was difficult to get into. It was at such a large scale that it was just more difficult for me to care about. I'd have to praise them for the ending, which made it much more enjoyable for me, but it didn't manage to push a 7 (It's a pretty high 6 though). I like how actions had consequences in this film, which is a relief from some of the other films (more than just Marvel) that I've seen recently. In the end, I'd like to give it a 7, but there were some aspects that were a little bit held back. Still, great as a Marvel movie, just pretty decent as a regular movie.

Author: rohan-mahey
Review: This film has finally come. It took 10 years but it was worth it. Ever since The Avengers fans have been teased with post credits scenes and films leading up to this film. I was impressed on to how they made this film. It's helmed by the Russo brothers who directed the last two captain America films which have been brilliant. The plot follows Thanos as he travels the galaxy looking for the infinity stones and the avengers and guardians of the galaxy have to stop him. They divide into three teams One is on earth and the two are set up in space. This movie isn't film. It's an event and what I mean by an event is that this film is a massive pop culture event that fans of the marvel cinematic universe will enjoy. But if your not then this movie isn't really for you as A. You probably won't know who most of the characters are and B. You will need to sit through 18 movies to understand the characters. The best thing about this movie is the plot and the vfx. The vfx in this film are probably the best this year thanos looks brilliant. But I don't know whether some of the other cgi will hold up like iron mans new armour or mark ruffalo in the hulkbuster. The vfx are better than the black panther ones and they only came out two months apart. So that tells you something. It shows that every penny that went into the vfx was worth it. The movie has one of the best entrances by Thor which was absolutely the best thing. This movie is hardly focused on the heroes it's in fact mostly focused on thanos as he goes through the galaxy searching for the stones. He is the best character in this film josh brolin gives an oscar worthy performance. Also thanos wins by collecting the stones and wiping half the universe. It was so unexpected aswell cause the movie give some you hope thinking they can win. But they don't.

Author: leletodini
Review: I was very disappointed from this movie, especially about the end..... how can you make an end like this? Seriously? What the point to make this movie of half of the people are gone? I hope the next part of this will be better otherwise i would think it's totally a waste of money!!!! The action in the avengers is always great but the rest of it is full of holes... where is valkyrie? and why most of the avengers are not powerful enough as you showed in the other movies??? Where is the power of thor? Too many questions that makes me feel disappointed about it.

Author: noah52697
Review: ...It's really hard to talk about this movie without giving everything or something HUGE away. What I can tell you is the bare basics of what you will be witnessing. And that is as follows: Everything you've seen, everything you know, is wrong. Your expectations are wrong. You are not prepared for what this movie has to throw at you. YOU'RE NOT. I surely wasn't; I found myself realizing my mouth was gaped open multiple times. Avengers: Infinity War is the cultivation of everything Marvel has built and it executed it almost flawlessly. There are only two flaws that can be found here. One, the pacing is a bit wonky at parts, as scenes cut away and tones can be shifted. Two, some characters don't get the spotlight that you might want them to. But these flaws are easily forgiven. As this movie delivers on EVERYTHING. The action is exceptional. The emotion is POWERFUL. The music by Silvestri hits you in the gut with every note. The story is at odds, taking turns in ways that you will never see coming, not even with clairvoyance. Now, I can't say much, but what I will say, is that Josh Brolin has given us, quite possibly, one of the greatest villains in cinematic history. He is scary, compassionate, charismatic, but most of all, empathetic. The Russo Brothers also directed their asses off and made their best work yet. That's all I can really say. You need to go into this movie blind like I did, because by the end you won't know what's coming next, you'll be speechless. So until the next Avengers movie arrives, I'll watch it, then watch it again, because it's the only movie we got for a while.

Author: g-bilkhu
Review: The reason why it's only 9/10 is because so many of my favourite marvel characters died. But other than it was beautifully presented hats off to Russo Brothers and Marvel they did an amazing job

Author: ravvardembjr
Review: Infinity War is one of the most unpredictable movies of the marvel cinematic universe (even when it has some predictable things) The movie is entertaining and funny, is an 149 minutes long, but it doesn't feel like it. The performances of all the actors is really good, but I had to highlight the performance of Josh Brolin as the villain, Thanos. The character is terrifying and you can feel that something could go terrible wrong when he´s on screen, he is the character that, to me, is the most interesting in the movie, and thetas really good, because a movie like this without a great villain could not be a good movie, and Brolin brings something additional to the character with his performance, even when the character is made by CGI, the performance is still very powerful, is like Andy Serkis as Caesar in the new Planet of the Apes movies. The visual effects are, of course amazing and makes what the best visual effects do, make you believe that what is on screen is real. Now, I have to speak about the negative points of the movie. First, it is a lot, the story tat they´re telling here could have been not a bit of a mess (like it is the movie) if they were telling it as a 10 episode series or something like that, but a movie can´t do that, so the result that we have on screen is a lot, and sometimes you can forget what some characters were doing at the beginning of the movie because they appear in minute 10 and the appear again on minute 40. Of course, everything that´s going on is important, but that problem makes you feel a little disconnected with some characters. Speaking about the characters, there were some that were really useless in the movie, and they were only there because they were introduced before. Stay for the scene after the credits, it is amazing, not like the one in Spiderman homecoming. In the end, infinity war will please fans and it will make them even more anxious for the next avengers movie. Watch out at the end, maybe you'll cry.

Author: Eshan_2110
Review: Boy oh boy, what great fun this film is. To think it all began ten years ago with Iron Man, and to now witness the scale and ambition is truly something special. It felt historic. Credit where credit is due, director, Anthony and Joe Russo blend all these characters in so well and seeing how they interact is as hilarious and special as always. Having spent time with them for so long now, we find ourselves attached and that's why it works and we root for them. I'd argue Thanos is the MCU's best villain yet, a character whose god complex and interesting ideology separates him from traditional notions of the villains in the MCU. Oh, and there's also the fact that he can actually compete with the heroes, with many of them feeling inferior to Thanos and his army. There is more depth to him that I first imaged, and the CGI and performance by Brolin is great. It's a treat to see the whole audience laughing, clapping, gasping-something not all films do these days. It's a testament to the creative team behind this universe, (Kevin Feige etc.) because they have simply been so consistently ambitious. If there is one thing, the humour in the film did surprise me, and with that said it does take away from the emotional scenes. It is a Marvel film however, and to think that its staple blend of humour and action wouldn't be as prominent is perhaps an oversight. When you actually think what this film has done, combing the ten years worth of stories, and putting together characters who haven't yet met, all in the space of two and a half hours, it is an achievement worth celebrating and enjoying.

Author: juribeldman
Review_Title: A Good Film That Nevertheless Has Some Problems.
Review:
Avengers:Infinity War is a film that has a problem. A huge problem. Namely, how to encompass 10 years of screen history and 23 characters into one film so, that the end result would not take over three hours to complete, and not only be satisfying, but also good? It is hard, so the writers and the directors should be honored for having made a film as good as they did. There is also a great moral dilemma at the center, namely that of whether it is right to kill some in order that the many could have a better life? In that case, the films is really amazing, and also a great example of entertainment cinema. 
 But. The films is not that good, and I have never been a huge fan of these Marvel movies-Star Wars and Harry Potter are blockbuster franchises that I like much more. And sometimes the writing is a bit out of hand, and having more than twenty main characters obviously translates to the fact than not all are very well developed. Herein, also lies a great problem. Avengers: Infinity War is a great film, make no mistake, with the best superhero film ending since The Dark Knight, but in order to really know these characters(except for Thanos, who is surprisingly fleshed out and could contend to the title of Main Character in this film) you have to watch their solo films-something that sadly is necessary for a franchise like this.But, otherwise from that, this here really is a great film.

Author: b2280545
Review_Title: It all comes down to this
Review: Avengers Infinity War, the film Marvel fans have all been waiting for since the first Avengers film came out in 2012, has finally arrived and it is safe to say it has lived up to the hype from the last few years. The Avengers, Earth's mightiest heroes, have returned this time teaming up with the Guardians of the Galaxy, Dr. Strange, Spider-Man, Black Panther and overall the largest ensemble of superhero characters the world has ever seen on film to defeat the deadly Thanos. The film is large in everything, scale, cast, visual effects, action, just about all one expects to see and as it progresses, it doesn't shy away from reminding audience viewers how large it is. The film's time length was necessary to establish it's story and it's characters correctly. That said not every one is a fan of films that pass 2 hours for issues concerning the story dragging on too much and too many characters to explore with not many receiving proper care. The Lord of the Rings trilogy is the best example of films that reach the 3 hour length of time that is necessary to explore all plot lines. That trilogy worked out for many audience viewers though many that try and replicate this formula rarely succeed to accomplish what Lord of the Rings did. Avengers Infinity War is 2 hours and 40 minutes long and for the most part it succeeded in what it set out to do while many may say differently, especially those who aren't the biggest fans of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Disney has never been more the extravagantly triumphant corporation that it is today with all the brands and licenses they have the rights too and because Infinity War has turned a grand profit, earning an estimated $640.9 million at the worldwide box office it's opening weekend, the latter proves itself true.

Author: lynn_melanie
Review_Title: If I could give it 11 stars, I would
Review: This one was for the true fans. I can relate to those who have no real vested interest in these characters. It's a long, confusing, space war movie with cool special effects. But to the true fans who knew almost exactly what to expect, or knew what or whom they were seeing; this film is a modern masterpiece. The magnum opus of the MCU. What other superhero movie in a universe known to be free of consequence could invoke such a broad dynamic of emotion? I am a grown man, jaded to most things in this world, and I shed more tears for this film than any other. I also loved the humor. There were times when I couldn't help but belt out a hearty HA much to my embarrassment. But at times I could hear a symphony of noses sniffling behind me. This one may be hard for young children, but that doesn't mean they shouldn't see it. I saw it standard, but now I know that I need to see this in IMAX before the opportunity is lost forever. If I could give it 11 stars, I would. Don't wear makeup to this one.

Author: austinharbaugh
Review_Title: Jaw-Dropping spectacle, this generations Empire Strikes Back
Review:
Being an avid Marvel fan I, like many others, have been along on this ride for 10 years. This movie bring to light THE main villain of the Marvel universe, Thanos, who Josh Brolin portrays to the T. Thanos is a villain that throughout the film you begin to understand more and more. They created a relatable villain for all of our favorite super heroes to fight against. With this star studded cast it is easy to think that everyone could get screen time. Though some heroes get more than others, they still all get their fair share of time. The sheer scope of the movie is beyond comprehension but they somehow made it work fluently. 
You will laugh, you will be mad, and you will cry all at once. Never have I ever walked out of a Marvel movie without words to comprehend what I just saw. 
Go see this movie in the biggest theater you can.

Author: harrybraff
Review_Title: Works well as an ensemble piece
Review:
The Avengers : Infinity War is not going to win Best Picture, but hey as an excuse to sit in a comfortable seat in an air conditioned theater and munch popcorn, it does the trick! 
This film is way too difficult to talk about without spoilers. So much stuff here. I will keep everything to a general nature.
This is a ensemble of Marvel characters, both good and bad. Amazing to see the multi-protagonist story structure done this deftly. George Lucas is a master at it, and well, it appears that the director here attempted to emulate him....it is a workable effort. The first act is re-introducing us to characters we all know (with a great entry by Captain America). The second act does the best it can, slipping into formulaic action and one-liners. But there is reprieve! The third act delivers a multi-layered, thought-out ending coupled with an awesome post credits easter egg scene that leads into the next film. So please folks, catch that last scene. *Just as a helpful FYI - as soon as the credits roll, there is enough time to visit the lavatory and return to view the final scene...about 5 minutes, I'd say.
It is a long film, be mindful of that. There is much violence also, parents be advised. 
My overall impression that this film succeeds at connecting the dots (albeit we all can see what it was without the dots being connected). It is rather predictable. Some scenes, either overtly or subtly, are telegraphed to us. I am not sure if this was deliberate or desperate. You be the judge.

Review_Title: I enjoyed it but a bit overrated
