Author: NgaiTranAnh
Review: The Russo brothers have done it again. They have successfully brought together a massive roster of characters created by different writers into one jaw-dropping,action packed and exciting film. Infinity War is the near-perfect reflection of everything Marvel has done in the last 10 years.

Author: jpickens189
Review: The biggest compliment I can give this movie is that there is a genuine sense of threat and an amazing stinger line. However, I consider this a fundamentally broken movie. This is the first movie of the Marvel universe where I genuinely could not engage with the heroes because of how fundamentally awful their decision making was. The film decided instead to grant all of its respect to Thanos, who despite the gravitas of his performance presents a philosophical perspective that is absolutely moronic. Despite this, neither this film or the sequel provide a strong argument against it, leaving it in a place where it feels like a respectable opinion. Look at other reviews and you will see how sympathetic people are to the cult of Thanos. That aside, the decision to have Dr. Strange give an excuse through the mechanism of destiny for the events of the movie to be "the only way" (paraphrasing) to defeat Thanos is the kind of ridiculously lazy plotting I expect of any movie with Dr. Strange. Also, the critical failure of character from the Avengers in Infinity War is their unwillingness to compromise their inflexible values in order to achieve something fundamentally more important. This would be okay if the second movie didn't give them a way out of this problem and undo all of the consequences of the mistake. This renders this movie philosophically pointless, if not philosophically harmful. What we are left with is a gripping but ultimately hollow attempt to cash in on audience investment in a franchise to sell a ridiculous spectacle, and convince people that it means something.

Author: tyler-catanzarite
Review_Title: Best marvel movie that isnt winter soldier
Review: This movie is probably my 2nd favorite marvel movie, it is just so perfect. For a 2 and a half hour long movie you dont feel it, unlike endgame, and unlike most part 1s of a 2 part finale, this one is the better part. In this film, the main character is Thanos, this is by far one of the best characters and villains in any superhero movie, I would only argue that the joker from dark knight is better and I doubt anything would top that. This film is just the right tone, dark, no sense of hope and quite bleak, it truly feels like they cant win the battle. The film sets up this tone perfectly by showing the asgardian ship from thor ragnarock completely destroyed and dead. Hulk tries to fight Thanos and gets beaten showing that even he cant beat him. Thanos snaps lokis neck and that sets up the tone for the rest of the movie, the fact that marvel of all people killed off a main character in like 5 minutes. Already you can tell this film will be different and it is. It's a superhero film in which the heros lose, and lose a lot. Even though I knew they would somehow be brought back to life I still felt the pain the heros felt. The film makes you think they can win especially with thor coming down with the Stormbreaker, but even than thanos still snaps half of the universe away. Those deaths were pretty meaningless but the true deaths of Loki, Vision and Gamora were really rough to watch, especially vision with it being clear he wont come back. Overall, with my biased towards every spiderman movie put aside, this is the second best marvel film and easily the best avengers movie.

Author: atysighi
Review_Title: This is where all roads led!!
Review:
Although I was checking the score on a few sites, I have not yet read any reviews or comments on Avengers: IW, so this opinion is based solely on my experience earlier today. This movie is up there with the best fantasy epics of my adolescence, or with some of the greatest comic book/superhero movies of more recent years. It's huge. It's epic. It's amazing. It's a damn well orchestrated symphony. It's Beethoven's 9th. For me, it doesn't get any better. But...unfortunately, not everyone will think that, or have the same experience. Why? Because it can't be considered a standalone movie and it can't be enjoyed as one. It is the top of the pyramid but you can't just land on it, you have to climb the whole pyramid first. It's a cinematic orgasm, but you have to go through the sex to get to it. It requires previous MCU knowledge, without it is just like watching the Superbowl with no understanding of the game. Many scenes, dialogues, lines, actions and choices of certain characters...won't work without it and will have less to no emotional impact on the viewer. So yes, for Marvel vets is the (first half of a) Champions League Final of all Marvel movies, for others is just an explosive game with perhaps to many players on the field. In Spidey's words: Sorry, I can't remember all your names..."
 Well I can, and I will never forget any of them...

Author: Star20-74950
Review: This movie is so inconsistent its crazy. There is the issue of Thanos, Vision and Wanda being way underpowered until the end when Wanda is super overpowered. Pretty much every other character is way too overpowered. I think Thor is the only one with appropriate power level. Also Thanos's plan makes no sense. Why wouldn't he make more resources. He wanted to save the universe and that way he would have been a savior instead of a mass murderer. Also the half of the existing population will repopulate so this doesn't make sense as is. The ending didn't work for me. It was too obvious when they killed off all of their newest and very successful franchises that there would likely be time travel later which opens too many plot holes. Also some of the characters become morons for some reason which leads to more inconsistencies. The dumbest one was Starlord who early on was willing to kill Gamora to keep Thanos from getting her but then punched Thanos out leading to everyones death. Same with Vision. First Tony and Bruce didn't realize there was a better way to wire the infinity stone in his head. Then throughout the movie they Steve keeps saying that they don't trade lives but they are literally trading the lives of the Wakanda soldiers for Vision, a robot, in hopes they can remove the stone. Thanos's motivation was interesting and well developed but everything else was borne from really lazy writing.

Author: jacksonsonlymom
Review:
**Light Spoilers, sorry. 
There's a lot going on in this movie. We have heroes in pretty much any place you would think of: on spaceships, desolate planets, cloaked villages, dying stars, alternate universes/realities, just everywhere. Everyone we've seen thus far in the MCU, besides one or two, have appearances and missions to complete. It felt like a non-stop train on a mission to get to the next city, but it's being blown up, and there are people trying to rob it, and there are couples in different cars showing affection, but there's a brain surgeon on board that has the cure for cancer, and a family arguing over a patriarch's death, and another woman learning the truth of her adoption, and all these people trying to stop the train from being blown up, all while riding on the train, going 200 mph. I laughed, I cried, I said "Oh Hell No!" At least twice, and I know I gasped and held my breath for a majority of it. I enjoyed every second of the ride. Also, Whovians, watch for the reference, be prepared to have some feels, and don't say I didn't warn ya.

Author: t_hill90
Review_Title: If does for you what you wanted
Review:
See this as soon as possible if you care enough to read reviews. This movies impact is in your unpreparedness!!! 
The Interstellar of comic book movies. 
It moves fast. It tackles enormous plot points, throws all the heroes into the storyline with thrust yet with finesse and comedic touch. 5 story lines converge and collapse into 4, then 3, then 2, boiling over into an intense, sometimes shuttering series of climaxes. This is then reduced down to a concentrated chapter of events that will leave the outside viewers and fans alike giddy and shaken. 
Sit back and enjoy the new canvas the directors and writers splatter, like bright paint, both nostalgia and Fresh life with our characters.

Author: zoezoe11999
Review_Title: My heart feels like it has been wrenched out in the best possibly ways.
Review:
Edit: I managed to not watch trailers or learn anything about this movie until the night I watched the film, and that made it 10000X better, though it makes me come off naive because I was not aware this was only part one of two when writing this.
I think this movie is incredibly well done, especially if if their goal is to leave me begging for more and really hit me where it would hurt. I want to start by complimenting the composer, they seamlessly intertwined their pieces into the film and it was breathtaking. The whole movie kept me on my toes and went beyond anything I could have ever imagined. At many moments I could also feel the tears start to well up, though none of those feelings compared to the complete anguish that came over me watching Peter Parker begins to disintegrate. As he scrambles to grasp onto Tony, begging that he does not want to go, though eventually disappears (proceeding as well as preceding many Avengers being whisk away in mere minutes in the film) my heart broke.
This film brought together more characters from the franchise than ever before, and although I do wish Paul Rudd and Clint Barnes would have joined in, I was thoroughly impressed by their ability to bring together so many actors.
When the credits began to roll I was quite enraged, but I give serious kudos to the creators for really going out on a limb and not following the traditional idea of keeping most of all of the main heroines alive. I was left stunned in my seat, unsure whether I could recover from the devastation I had just watched unfold. I felt the emotions of the characters and I laughed quite a bit as well. On another note, I wish I could throw myself into my studies with as much passion as I have put into this review.

Author: jackcrask
Review: This is the first review I've ever written, and I think this is the perfect movie to take that spot. This is one of the best movies I've seen in a very long time and my favorite MCU film to date. I'm a particularly big fan of how they took the character arc of Thor, I thought it was very well done. The humor felt natural to the characters, and not shoehorned in as I felt some of the jokes were in Ragnarok (also an enjoyable film, though). There were some moments of humor that didn't quite land with me, but that's okay. I also very much liked how the handled Thanos and the movie, to me, is more of a Thanos film than an Avengers film. Josh Brolin does an excellent job. There is one particularly emotional scene and I almost began to sympathize with him. Those who have seen the film will know what I'm referring to. There are many surprises and things you won't see coming. I went in only having seen one or two of the trailers, and I'm glad I did. See it as soon as you can and avoid spoilers as much as possible. It is, to me, a truly excellent film. 10/10 would recommend and 10/10 would watch again.

Author: ethantripp
Review:
Costing over $300 million to make, Marvel was setting up for the biggest cinematic experience they have ever created. They had a combined budget of over $1 billion making it one of the most expensive films ever made. As a Marvel fan, these numbers make it very exciting when preparing to watch their film, but with this particular film, $1 billion wasn't quite enough.
The Avengers, including Iron Man (Robert Downey Jr.), Thor (Chris Hemsworth), Hulk (Mark Ruffalo), Captain America (Chris Evans), Black Widow (Scarlett Johansson), Doctor Strange (Benedict Cumberbatch), Spiderman (Tom Holland), Black Panther (Chadwick Boseman), and many more heroes from the Marvel Universe, unite to take down their most powerful enemy yet Thanos (Josh Brolin). Thanos is attempting to collect all six of the infinity stones in his plan to inflict his will on reality. The fate of existence itself has become uncertain as everything the Avengers have ever fought for leads to this battle.
Marvel diehard or just an interested fan, everyone has a favorite superhero. When they first started the "Avengers" series there was an abundance of controversy surrounding the idea that pouring all those heroes into one movie would not be successful. Disregarding the hate, Marvel went straight for its intended film and created "The Avengers" in 2012. Grossing over $1.5 billion in earnings you could say they were right. With the pool of well loved heroes fighting side by side avengers decided to run with it, leading us to where we are now, The Avengers: Infinity War. The first problem with this film is it was clearly a shot to wring out as much cash as they could from the fan base they have created. With success of Ryan Coogler's "The Black Panther" and many other upcoming heroes the avengers turned into an overloaded group of heroes from all over the universe. People come to see the movies to see their favorite superhero in battle but with 500 other characters running around it draws the weight and storyline away from those specific character. It seems as if they just piled all the characters into one movie to please everyone for early box office sales.
The fact that everyone has their favorite hero, brings light to a problem with the storyline. In the film, Thanos has a goal of eliminating half of the population of the universe. Successfully obtaining the final infinity stone, with the snap of a finger, he eliminates half the population. In doing so he wipes out some pretty prominent heroes including Tom Holland's "Spiderman" Although Marvel did not fail to make Spiderman's final goodbye dramatic, it is still controversial. With the amazing success of the film "Spiderman: Homecoming" previously released, Tom Holland and the new Spiderman was gaining some steam. As a huge spiderman fan myself, it was extremely tough to see him go as it was for the millions of other fans. It is understandable to kill off a hero for dramatic purposes but why multiple characters that people come to view the movies for in the first place. Leaving Spiderman and other heroes out of the next movie could cause more people to be less exhilarated about the film.
Another problem Marvel seemed to have in their film was their weakness in capitalizing on climactic scenes. One scene that sticks out in particular and received plenty of backlash from the masses, was the battle on Titan. This battle was closest the Avengers came to defeating Thanos by taking the gauntlet and all six infinity stones off his hand. Iron man, Spiderman, Doctor Strange, and a variety of others finally knock Thanos out cold and attempt to pull the glove off his massive hand. Star Lord, a more comedic character, enters and brings his emotions to the table eventually slapping Thanos in the face and waking him up. The heroes were literally a fingernail away from saving the entire universe and succeeding in defeating Thanos. The whole entire movie led to that one intense scene and its disrupted by a more comedic character slapping Thanos in the face. Although the colors and CGI editing done on the planet Titan was impeccable, they failed to create the intended dramatic and tension filled scene of the team failing.
Although the box office numbers say otherwise, Marvel didn't provide the film millions of their fans were looking for. The Avengers isn't what it once was and seems to be a way to make money off their ever growing fan base. With their billion dollar budgets you should expect amazing scenery and technology from the movie. They lack the production of the big dramatic scenes we long for and in doing so killed off heroes people come to see in the first place.

Author: steccolandia
Review:
I had a look at like 200 reviews, and they are all rated either 9,10 or 1,2. This only shows that people hardly describe a movie objectively. Still, I believe that the main score of 8.8 is way too much, because after all, this is a superhero movie, which means easy plot, villain against the good guy/s, and good vs evil. 
Having this said, this movie was average, not bad but not brilliant. Its target is mostly teenagers or 20yo people, and gives them what they want. There is a lot of action, the story is shallow, but the writers managed to show so many characters in a balanced way. Besides being a movie almost entirely make with CGI which seems to be unavoidable these days ( and that brings away most of the acting) the ending is the part that leaves your mouth bitter. Thanos is an interesting villain, he has a purpose, that in some ways makes sense, he doesn't just kill everyone because he wants to, but in the end it is clear that soon another Marvel movie will come out and it will rewrite entirely this one, because they simply can't kill half of the superheroes. This is a classic of every superhero movie ever: the bad guy needs some artifact to become immortal/god/open a gate to another dimension, the heroes have the chance to defeat him before that but fails, and so the villain becomes God but gets defeated anyway. In this movie is the same. When I exited the cinema I was more annoyed by the fact that another movie will change everything happened in this one than the fact that the bad guy actually wins, and this made me feel that I watched a movie for nothing. I could accept this ending as it is.
People need to keep in mind that the good guys don't always win.
Anyway, as a superhero movie is ok but there are better ones, like V for Vendetta or Wonder woman, but there are others that are much worse, like Green Lantern or Black Panther. 
Another thing I should mention is that in order to watch this movie you are supposed to watch almost all the other Marvel movies, or you won't understand many scenes. This can be a good way to connect different movies, but now there are like 18 so it's too much.
I can't say much on the acting, it was ok but the CGI has the main role, and fans don't really care about it.
So to sum up this is an average superhero movie, with a great villain but a silly plot, that relies on random deaths of its characters to cause suspance, which is cheap. I only went to the cinema because I have free tickets, it is only worth the money if you're fan of the series or of special effects.

Author: budgeriguy
Review_Title: The Most Ambitious and Successful Cinematic Crossover of All Time
Review: 10 Years, 18 Films. Marvel has set a staple for the super hero genre and Avengers: Infinity War is no exception. Avengers: Infinity War, follows Thanos (Josh Brolin) and his quest to assemble the infinity gantlet to destroy half of a life throughout the universe as a fractured team of avengers, race to stop him. The characters are superb, the dynamic that each character brings to the table is fascinating and enjoyable, Marvel has taken a universe that they have been expanding on for the past 10 years and throws it on it's head. First time viewing this movie, I was on the edge of my seat and the second viewing was just as enjoyable being able to take in all the little details of the film. Well done to the Russo Brothers, the Actors and the Crew for making a cinematic event that lived up to my expectations. I highly recommend Avengers: Infinity War for any comic book fan, and super hero fan.

Author: andreaf-78503
Review: This movie is incredible!!!! It has the perfect balance of comedy, action, drama, and romance. First, the romance. The movie doesn't just include romance that characters have for each other, such as Wanda and Vision and Quill and Gamora. But also how the two teams care for each other. How Tony wants to keep Peter safe, or the friendship(or something more) between Steve and Bucky. How Thor mourns for Loki or how Gamora was willing to give up the location of the Soul Stone to save Nebula. They all have a connection to each other. An unbreakable connection. Next, the comedy. This movie was packed full of it. It wasn't too much, but not too little either. Most of it comes from the Guardians of course. How Quill envies Thor or how Drax for some reason is invisible. There's also comedy between Stark and Strange here and there. It's enough to keep us through the drama. Which brings me to the drama part. There's A LOT of drama in this movie. Lots of parts that make you want to crawl into a hole and cry for hours. Mostly, the deaths. There were multiple deaths, such as Wanda, Vision, Bucky, Gamora, Drax, Mantis, Quill, Loki(though I don't believe it), Groot, Strange, and of course, one of the most heartbreaking, Peter Parker. I cried a lot, even though we think they're not dead for good. They basically just disappeared for now. And now, the action. There were lots of action scenes. Why wouldn't there be, this is an action movie. The scene where Cap, Nat, and Sam came back or the Wakanda fight. This movie was the perfect balance of everything we love and the things we would prefer not to experience. All in all, this movie was spectacular. I give 10 stars to the Russo brothers. Good job. Hope the second part is just as good. Maybe even better. Guess we'll have to wait 'till May 3rd 2019 to find out.

Author: archiesmith
Review_Title: Marvel reaches heights of infinty, and beyond
Review:
The definition of Marvel is "to be affected with wonder and astonishment, as at something surprising or extraordinary". Disregarding puns aside, 'Avengers: Infinity War' is the perfect encapsulation of its brand's namesake, as feelings of sheer 'wonder and astonishment' is what I experienced while watching the film. 
Somehow the Russo Brothers have managed to create a huge cinematic event that lives up to all the hype. This is one of the best MCU films yet, and this isn't just because of its size and spectacle. It still uses elements of the Marvel formula, so to speak, which have worked so well before, being bombastic action sequences and humorous character interactions, and unsurprisingly dials them up to 11. But then, these elements are applied and seamlessly blended with a tone which isn't exactly dark, but definitely desperate, which brings about a larger sense of danger and consequence that has never been done in one of these films before. 
While there isn't much of a plot outside of trying to stop Thanos from assembling the Infinity Gauntlet, it's the character interactions I mentioned before that Marvel usually does so well that keeps the audience captivated. And somehow, the Russos, along with screenwriters Christopher Marcus and Stephen McFeely, pull it off so well. This film has a gargantuan cast, and it manages to combine the differing tones from the various franchises without feeling cluttered. The duo of Robert Downey Jr and Benedict Cumberbatch as Iron Man and Doctor Strange makes complete sense, as their wit, sarcasm and goatees create great potential for friction and disagreement. An enthusiastic and awe-ridden Spider-Man also tags along with them, and Tom Holland makes it seem he's constantly amazed to witness the events taking place just like the audience. The campy cosmic styles of Thor and the Guardians of the Galaxy mesh together exceptionally and undoubtedly deliver the best uses of comedy. And the majority of the cast from 'Civil War', along with a few other additions engage in an awesome climactic battle in the 'Black Panther' setting of Wakanda. Naturally, not a lot of these characters understandably go through much development, which was a miracle in itself to see in Civil War, but a few do. This being Hulk, Vision, Scarlet Witch, Gamora, and especially Chris Hemsworth as Thor, who has further transformed his once disengaging character until 'Ragnarok', to probably the best Avenger, who has the most legitimate reasons to be engaged in this conflict. 
But the best character is the big bad himself, Thanos. Josh Brolin delivers an incredible performance of this character, who has been built up and hyped for so many years now, and he completely subverted my expectations. He is not the loud-spoken, egotistic, emotionless monster that had been previously portrayed in his cameos, who seemed to lack any form of motivation outside of a thirst for universal conquest. Instead, he is now a soft-spoken, sardonic, charismatic but fearsome individual, who has surprisingly altruistic motives for collecting the Infinity Stones and using them for universal genocide, that actually makes reasonable sense. And because of this, he is faced with certain challenges that he has to go through in order to achieve his goals, which demonstrates the raw determination of this character that makes him all the more compelling to watch. Some of my personal favourite scenes were just dialogue between him and one other character, which effectively utilises Brolin's acting skills to show Thanos' more emotional and sensitive side, which I found more interesting, that overall creates what is probably the best comic-book villain since Chris Nolan's 'Dark Knight' Trilogy. 
The structural features on display are mainly on-point. Trent Opaloch returns as the cinematographer from the Russos' previous 'Captain America' films, but this time suitably cuts down on the shaky-cam techniques which work well with the grounded tone of those films. Instead, there is a naturally more vibrant and poppy colour palette unlike his previous dull and graded cinematography. And every shot which encompassed this is just simply gigantic, which fits greatly with the enormous stakes of the film. Alan Silvestri makes a welcome return as the composer, and while there aren't any memorable tracks outside of the recurring motifs from the first 'Avengers', the score as a whole is noticeably emotive and synchs up well with the majority of the scenes, which creates more of an aural impact than the forgettable background noise in 'Age of Ultron'. The visual effects are very impressive, especially the motion capture used for Thanos, as it effectively picks a lot of subtle facial expressions Brolin uses to perform, that make him seem all the more realistic. And while I'd say the CGI does not reach the levels of visual splendour shown in 'Guardians Vol. 2', for the most part, they successfully merge with the live action, and work as a major improvement over the PS2 graphics in 'Black Panther'. 
Despite my gushing, there are certain issues on display. I felt like the script allowed for characters to make choices and actions which were either extremely convenient or inconvenient so that the story could proceed accordingly without having to grind to a sudden, albeit logical halt. And being the nineteenth instalment in this cinematic universe, there are going to be obvious continuity errors, as I found some events in previous films, especially 'Ragnarok', did not lead into this as well as they could have. And I already mentioned the size of the ensemble cast, unfortunately, means a few characters are dismissed from having actual development, especially the other villains, Thanos' Black Order, who don't contribute much except interesting designs and opponents for the Avengers. But this is only Part 1, so I believe the few heroes who felt left behind outside of fighting will get more time to develop properly in Part 2. 
Thus, 'Avengers: Infinity War' epitomises how to culminate a cinematic universe with now a decade of history, which is not showing any signs of franchise fatigue. And yet somehow, it also manages to be a shocking, thrilling, grandiose event, where it becomes the prime example of pure popcorn cinema. This is why these films appeal to the masses, and so they should.

Author: vlaado7
Review:
I am a big Marvel fan and this movie is just so fascinating for me. I am amazed how CGI has progressed for all these years. I'll try to write this review with as little spoilers as I can so let's go.
What I particularly was the beginning of the movie. The beginning of "Infinity War" is so dark and the start is so shocking and just unbelievable for me to process everything so fast. The scenes are so unpredictable and it left me open-mouthed for the rest of the movie. The dark blue color prevails over every single scene and the actors did their job so perfectly.
Later in the movie, the colors start changing, from blue to red, to rainbow-ish and dark ones again. The scenes start changing quickly as the fight scenes start appearing and it is just not explainable how I felt while watching. The background music is just perfect. Alan Silvestri may be one of the best composers and I am so proud of what he did on the movie.
The ending just left me speechless as it may have left you, those are some heavy scenes for viewers and the whole cinema was basically sniffing and some were even crying. To conclude, the movie has a great number of funny scenes and I would definitely recommend it for every single movie lover.

Author: julenpadilla
Review: There's almost no way of reviewing this movie without containing spoilers. Infinity War was everything the fans asked for, and sometimes even more. So many surprising elements and REALLY emotional scenes. The movie begins brutally by killing off Loki in just seconds. It tells you right away what kind of film this will be, and boy does it get darker throughout the way. Yes, there were MANY jokes and while some didn't land, at least Marvel finally managed to even out the jokes with the serious and emotional scenes (unlike Thor ragnarok and GOTG vol. 2). This time there wasn't some silly cringe reference or dance off when stuff was going down. Although the movie did feel a little choppy towards the first quarter, it immediately crafted itself together beautifully halfway throughout the final act. It just kept getting better and better, while getting more intense too. Whenever Thanos popped up all your attention was drawn to him. It was like Darth Vader, everyone in the room (not just in the film) acknowledged his presence and feared him. Josh Brolin by far stole the show as Thanos. His facial expressions and menace actually for once made up for a real threatening villain. Just when you thought stuff couldn't get any worse, it did. And it just kept going on and on until the whole audience got teary. Watching Thanos fight Tony gave me goosebumps, as I expected this to be the end of Tony. Everyone slowly fading away did make you lose hope. By far the most emotional scene for me was when Peter was crying on Tony while he knew what was about to happen. This movie didn't hold back at all. It was just menacing and everything hit you in the face so quickly. All the avengers showed got their moments of epicness, ESPECIALLY Thor. The end does leave many questions on everyone's minds as well as theories. But that's what makes it so good. My biggest fear with this film (apart from the potential cringe comedy) would be feeling done after IW. But nope, this just makes me want see Avengers 4 like right now. I want to see what happens next.

Author: grantwolner
Review: Wow. I don't usually do movie reviews but this has got to be one of the greatest movies I have ever seen in my entire life. I have never been through so many emotions in a short span of time. Everything about this movie is Phenomenal.The soundtrack, the visual effects, the acting, the menacing characteristics of Thanos, EVERYTHING. I entered the movie with high hopes, and was not disappointed. I laughed, I cried, and I was drawn in by the action scenes. This movie entailed everything that a good movie possesses. I will be seeing it again. Do not waste your time, and GO TO THIS MOVIE. I didn't know it was possible, but now I am even more in love with the MCU.

Author: romen-94982
Review_Title: Entertaining if you're in the mood
Review: Sometimes you just want to hang in the couch and watch something and not think too much. Just be entertained and relax. Well, this movie isn't that relaxing. Lots of action, fighting, fast dialogue, many characters and change of locations. A dwarf, a racoon, a black panther, a spiderman, a robot, aliens and hulks. And all have some kind of supernatural power. Great kids stuff. Quality of acting or character development are not really main aims here. Effects, animations and stunts are really good. So, turn your mind off, grab some popcorn and enjoy. An hour after viewing you'll have forgotten you've seen it.

Author: cookd-90583
Review: This movie shouldn't even be physically possible. 18 movies before it, having to make sure everyone acts accordingly, make sure everyone gets screen time, and that's even before we get into the story. The movie is a masterpiece made over 10 years. No character feels out of place or over-used. I will admit there is one character in particular that could've been used more, but because of how much was going on it makes sense why he wasn't. Characters act like they should, and their chemistry is amazing. The three separate groups all work masterfully together. This movie honest to god had me on the edge of my seat the whole time, which is hard to do with me, especially for two and a half hours. I almost cried numerous times and legit couldn't walk when I left the theater. I had to hold onto my girlfriend so I wouldn't faint. It was that good. And I haven't even gotten to Thanos, aka the best mcu villain. His motivation is so much better then the comics, and he makes every scene feel like it could be the end for a character. You never know what will happen. Overall, this is my favorite mcu movie, and definitely in my top 10 favorite movies of all time.

Author: jmherman-66219
Review_Title: Gripping, I couldn't take my eyes of the screen
Review: This movie is teetering between PG-13 and R for how absolutely disturbing it can be (for PG-13 that is), but thats not bad. Its gripping in fact, for a super hero movie, it's just what it needs. Thanos is possibly THE best super villian to ever grace a superhero film, he isn't just someone doing it for fame, glory, wealth, or because he just loves to wreak havoc. He has a clear goal, and some of the things he does over the course of the film hurts him, and that shows how much dedication he has to doing what he thinks is right, you sometimes feel for both the villian and the hero, as it SHOULD be.

Author: dariodesu
Review_Title: 10 years of waiting, payed off, BIG TIME!
Review:
Where to start...
this is funny, action-packed, hold-your-breath epic blockbuster movie, and i can't wait to see it a few more times, cause it's so hard to process everything that happens in it.
Russos did it again, i like that they dialed down the shaky cam to a minimum.
the special effects are for sure the best i've ever seen in any movie, and that tells a lot for a movie that relies so much on them.
Thanos...oh man... Josh Brolin NAILED IT! he's the best comic book villain to date, period!
if i had to nitpick this movie, the only thing it would be is run-time (and it's the longest marvel movie to date), and that's just cause i wanted to see more of it, but don't worry everything that's important is there, every major character gets it's deserved screen time, some more than others, but don't forget that there's a sequel coming in a year, and it's gonna a be a longer wait than the previous 10

And that is why this movie is "to be continued" in audiences' sense of sadness in the sadness (in a sense of expected even without any spoiler" ) and asking or putting audiences into the position to think of the measures that they can do to solve the situation with production. This movie is dragging audience into the bottom of the mud where this world or areas have been sticking into. Marvel movies Ironman Spider-Man Avengers etc including Avengers Infiniti War are brilliant because Marvel movies always bring audience into the real problems the earth is facin up with in its very unique way that no other film can do but marvel movies

Author: sallyturner-54668
Review:
I'm afraid I'm not going to be able to supply a balanced, insightful critique of this film because I'm still struggling to make any sense of it. For it's torturous length I witnessed hundreds of explosions, hundreds of humans / supposed superheroes being tossed huge distances and then getting up again to fight another day, an adolescent spider kid who refused to take advice from his elders and betters and other nonsense.
But the major thing for me was the NOISE. Relentlessly loud 'dramatic ' music, relentlessly loud banging and crashing, relentlessly loud dialogue... oh no.. wait... my bad. Relentlessly whispered dialogue that I couldn't make head or tail of, even while directing my lipreading skills.Sorry Avengers production team but if you want people to enjoy a film, make sure the punters can hear whats being said. Thanks .

Author: dasant3
Review: A must see spoiler free. It's a remarkable achievement that so many characters are given something to do and with enough direction and "film" to make us care about it. The Russo brothers top their Civil War efforts, barely, but do indeed manage to bring us a clear story arc that doesn't waste time on unnecessary issues. I will rank this below their efforts in Winter Soldier, again barely. There was more espionage intrigue in that movie that was more satisfying to this viewer. But, in the current culture where superhero movie fatigue is a very real concern, and hype regarding superhero movies tends toward inflation of its true merit for entertainment, this monument should stand as a tight culmination of just about EVERY point raised and debated from the first Thor to last year's Thor. Which I find fitting and I'll refrain from saying more.

Author: arogalsky79
Review:
Avengers: Infinity War is one of those rare movies that has an extremely unhappy ending, yet stuns and amazes you all throughout. As Marvel has moved forward with their cinematic universe, and Disney digging their massive claws deeper into the scripts to fill their quota, I was slightly nervous what would become of the Avengers movies, especially after seeing the atrocity that was Thor: Ragnorok. After that debacle I wasn't sure I wanted to continue watching any of the rest of the movies in the MCU. Thankfully Infinity War left me feeling satisfied, even with the cliffhanger ending. The Russo brothers are excellent at their job, and were the perfect choice to bring all the superheroes introduced thus far and make it action packed, dramatic, with just enough humor to keep it from going overkill. 
The other thing I liked what they did with the movie, is leave a lot of questions unanswered. With the ending of Thanos actually achieving getting all the stones and killing half the world's population, some will probably argue that's a little dissatisfactory (which who can blame them? Half the world basically vaporizes on the spot and 3/4 of the Avengers die as well, while the bad guy wins. That's not exactly the ending everyone expects). But because we know this is only the first half of the act, it leaves fans to come up with their own ideas and theories to what the second act will bring, and try to come up with their own answers to the questions left open. Something to keep us occupied until Avengers 4 is released no doubt.
Like someone else has said, I believe those who we saw physically die, with their bodies actually laying dead, I'm presuming they are for sure dead. But I don't believe the ones who were vaporized are truly "dead", whether they're just in another world that the living can't reach, or there's a way to reverse what Thanos did, I don't think we've said goodbye to all of them just yet, particularly Spider-Man and Black Panther, whom we've only barely been introduced to. 
All in all, great movie, keeps you guessing, and here's to guessing what the outcome will be come next year!

Review: While I absolutely loved Infinity War...and I do mean love, there are scenes in this movie that I have wanted to see my entire life and I was not disappointed. But with that being said I was expecting this to be the greatest movie in the MCU because it was the culmination of the 18 movies up to this point. (I still would put Civil War, Winter Soldier, Guardians, and the original Avengers ahead of it). While 9/10 was the score I give it I feel like 9.5/10 is more appropriate. There was one thing that bothered me in the latter half of movie. This is clearly was a part 1 of 2. That is where my only problem lies. This is what I Imagine will be a better version of what I think Deathly Hallows Part I was to the Harry Potter series... but to the MCU. Author: campbellsullivan
Review:
Wow, Marvel knocked it out of the park with this one. 
This is a totally different movie from anything Marvel has ever done before. First, I'll start out with the tone. This movie is dark. Marvel is sometimes criticized for being to light and happy, and I thought this was the opposite of that. Infinity War gives you a sense of hopelessness, sadness, and anger. It honestly felt like my soul was crushed, and everytime I think about the movie the feeling stays the same. Just because the movie made me feel these things, it was still great. I think that is one of the reasons you know a movie is good is that it gets you to feel these emotions about fictional characters. If you're scared about it being too dark, don't worry, there is some balanced humor throughout the movie, which for the most part I was fine with.

Author: peam-17547
Review:
Avengers: Infinity War is definitely a very dark movie with lots of superheroes dying. You will walk out of the cinema crying and you will go to sleep with your brain still recalling those little screen shots of the movie. You will NOT be walking out of your bedroom when you finish watching, this movie deserves to be watched in the theatres. 
The theme reminds me of "Logan", where everyone you grew up with for over 10 years have grown old and many of them are dying off. This movie will remind you that soon, the old avengers will die of and be replaced with new superheroes you wouldn't want to watch because the connection won't be the same as the old guys.
This movie is recommended for people over the age of 10, younglings will not be able to understand the darkness of this movie. Recommended for people who have watched ALL of the MCU's movies like, Iron Man, Captain America, Thor, GOTG, and Avengers.
This movie is NOT for people who did not watch all of the MCU's movies. You will not have the connection that everyone else has and you just won't understand the pain that we're going through, watching most of our favourite superheroes dying off.

Author: grabeeleverett
Review_Title: One of the BEST super hero movies ever made. period.
Review: When watching super hero movies I have one problem: there is often no stakes. Example, when watching Black Panther there was a period of time when I was just waiting for T'challa to come back to life, and of course, he did. This movie totally flips the script. From the beginning to the end I was scared of my favorite, often young, characters dying. Annnnddd guess what...it was a bloodbath. PEOPLE DIED. And it was NOT the people you would expect. In the end, we were left with a a familiar, but mixed group of people. I CANNOT WAIT for what is coming next. Now I just have to wait a year...I don't know if I can make it.

Review_Title: The culmination and greatest tragedy of MCU hitherto.
Review:
I literally cannot stand up or barely move after the end credit, not only because the excitement and stunning I had, but also this movie breaks our heart so badly. When I looked around, most people remained seated with dilapidated faces. I never felt like this after watching movies. The feeling of despair tormenting my heart. Although it is easy to anticipate probably in the next avengers, Time Stone's gonna solve this fading-way-in-the-dust massacre of super heroes, which was definitely shocking and heartbreaking for MCU funs. 
 Avengers Infinity War was the great mixture of humor and tragedy. It has a rhythm and I felt like I'm on the roller coaster, as GOG team finally encounters Avengers, Drax and Star-Load bring good taste of jokes and banters exquisitely. A lot of beloved characters die in this movie and that scene is hard to watch, but after those poignant scene, those joke scene follows to alleviate our sorrow.
 In my interpretation, it was the only way to defeat Thanos to give up Time Stone so that Tony Stark can live and this is the vision Dr. Strange saw. 
 Anyways this movie has just created a new history, which you can't miss! Anyone who hasn't seen movie yet, just go to the theater.

Author: venomfan3412
Review_Title: Holy Hell, That Was a Gut Punch of a Movie
Review:
Infinity War has had so much hype surrounding it, that I was worried that it would be consumed by its own hype, and having a stereotypical ending. But boy oh boy was I wrong, Infinity War was a fantastic film that absolutely pulled NO punches or kicks. There were drastic consequences, and we'd thought we only saw the last of the deaths once Vision bit the dust, but NOPE! Thanos got all the stones, snapped his fingers, and half the universe died, along with half of the Avengers. It was an extremely sad and shocking moment, yes, but the moment that takes the cake was when Peter Parker / Spider-Man died. I was sobbing like a baby in the theater, as he's always been my favorite, and I never thought for a moment we'd see him die. But he did, and even though we all know it's not a permanent death, it sure as hell is being treated as such.
The ending, for all the heartache, was brilliant. Thanos going to watch the sunset he talked about, while smiling, was amazing. And the fact that we got no big overdone title sequence, just somber plain text over sad music, with the title crumbling away at the end. Regardless if it's seen as one of the best, this film will go down in history. And I absolutely loved it.

Author: clairemurray-76862
Review: Infinity War is a movie that knocks it out of the ballpark. It's comedic and heartfelt, action and adventure, and it sets up Thanos as a really interesting villain, one who actually loves and cares. In his attempts to get the Soul Stone, when Thanos is required to sacrifice someone he loves, he cries and mourns after he sacrifices Gamora. Most villains are thought of to be cruel and heartless, but Thanos truly believes that what he is doing is right, and he can sway the audience to his side. Was really disappointed to see Rocket as the only Guardian alive at the end of the movie, but I don't think it is really 'the end' for the Avengers turned to ashes. Doctor Strange told Tony that out of all the outcomes, there was one that would involve them winning against Thanos. Before Strange dies, he tells Tony that, "It had to be done" hinting that Dr Stange knew this was going to happen and it was why he gave the stone over to save Tony's life, so he could set them on the path of winning. Definitely hyped up for the next one, though fingers crossed it won't be so dark.

Author: peter_aaron_marsh
Review: This is a very standard marvel movie. If you are not heavily invested in the characters, it will be very boring. It drags quite a bit. Many things conveniently happen solely because they advance the plot. Certain characters like Thanos and Dr.Strange have inconsistent rules concerning their powers. In some scenes Thanos can instantly disable attackers, in others he struggles for no reason other than they wanted to fit in another fight scene and some more banter or cameos. Iron man's suit is really cheesy as he can materialize different weapons out of nothing because of "nanobots". Again, the humor is only funny if you like the characters. Otherwise you'll roll your eyes at two bland characters bantering back and forth to no real consequence. To be fair, I did like that they didn't pull any punches with the ending but they will probably bring all those characters back to life anyway so it doesn't really matter. I did like the look of some of thanos' henchmen as well. But like most marvel movies, it is the same predictable, boring, cgi film that doesn't have much depth. And i'm not a DC fanboy either, those movies suck too.

Author: lschouder-04582
Review: Everyone left the theater with their jaws on the floor. By the end of the film the entire audience was dead silent and in awe of what we'd all just watched and been through. This movie pulls no punches and delivers hit after breathtaking hit. What's really amazing about this movie is at no point does the viewer feel numb to the onslaught. It's a perfectly balanced movie and does not disappoint at any moment. Now of course the premise of the sequel is made pretty obvious but that's completely forgivable. If I do have one beef it's that Ant-Man and Hawkeye were supposed to be in the film but were only mentioned by name and never seen. Paul Rudd even did press for the movie but he wasn't actually in it. The scale of this film is incredible. It feels epic but still has great character development as well. One of my favorite aspects was seeing Dr. Strange do more actual magic instead of just portals and mystic shields. The ending is absolutely devastating but so perfect. Wear your brown pants to this movie; you'll need them.

Author: jakobwerling
Review_Title: "Avengers: Infinity War" is a Truly Amazing Edition to the Marvel Canon with Great Characters
Review: It has all been leading up to this moment... And when the moment appeared, it did not disappoint- at all. The latest edition in the Marvel canon, Avengers: Infinity War really had to do a lot to please fans because so much was riding on the hope that the movie would be successful. For starters, it would be the film that celebrated the MCU's 10th birthday (the MCU's first film, Iron Man, came out in 2008). It would also probably be the biggest crossover film ever. Bringing together every character that the MCU has ever had (except Hawkeye and Ant-Man for some reason). And it would also be the goodbye film to some of the MCU's veteran actors. It could've also easily flopped like last year's Justice League (I saw that too, it wasn't very good) by getting caught up within all of its character backstories. But it didn't. In fact, it was an amazing movie. Not as good as Black Panther, but almost. For starters, the story is very good. It's opening scene is great and pretty surprising. It doesn't waste any time introducing the main villain and getting caught up in all of the backstories. The story also isn't afraid to kill off certain characters and the ending is just an excellent cliffhanger. The story is near-perfect! Also, the characters are excellent! They are realistic and oh so badass. Not to mention very well-created and fleshed-out. And you will probably find yourself rooting for your favorite hero in the end. There is also some well-placed humor to help lighten the mode (such as "Oh, were using our made-up names now. Okay then, my name is Spider-Man). One villain also gets roasted so badly. The performances are also great: Every actor seems to be performing to the max. The only bad part about this movie is that maybe the ending is a little too cliffhanger and that both Ant-Man and Hawkeye are left out. Other than that, everything is great. The character development is great, the action sequences are great, the mood is great, the twists are great, the moral is great, and the special effects are obviously great. Above all, this movie is another win for the MCU, a perfect way to celebrate the 10 year birthday for the franchise, and a total masterpiece that lives up to the hype! And surprises us still.

Author: robbedebruyn-85017
Review_Title: Bigger and different than any other movie
Review:
Infinity War is the nineteenth movie in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, so it makes sense people expect nothing else than the same characters fighting and joking. However, this movie is so much more than that. This isn't just a typical Marvel movie. This movie brings together 23 superheroes and concludes 18 previous installments to lead to the ultimate climax: a battle with the greatest and strongest villain of all time, Thanos (who raises in my opinion to the same height as iconic villains like Darth Vader or Voldemort). Thanos is more than a villain: he is a titan with the sole purpose of making the world a better place, only in the complete wrong way. Josh Brolin delivers an astonishing performance of this character and puts more to him than just a baddy, and makes him to someone who actually cares. 
As for the superheroes, Joe and Anthony Russo perfectly managed to give every single one of them a moment to shine. Special credits go to Robert Downey Jr, Benedict Cumberbatch, Zoe Saldana, Elizabeth Olsen, Chris Hemsworth and Paul Bettany.
The movie gives us not only a ton of humor, but also some memorable though heartbreaking scenes which puts a different tone to the film than all the others. 
There is a strong build up with some spectacular action sequences (where the heroes are divided into smaller groups so that every person has his time to shine), and the film ultimately leads to an epic and amazing climax with an unexpected ending. Well done Marvel.

Author: www-Ehlers
Review:
This is an epic movie when it comes to CGI. Storywise it's just another superhero movie. There are so many plots going on at the same time, so many different main characters and simply false actions taking place that the movie struggles to stay on the road. 
Thors powers are back to square one (so why was there a movie called Ragnarok), Thanos sometimes can be hold in place by one avenger even with 4 stones already captured and seriously what was with the ending? Multiple characters that died, already have sequels in the making! So why even try this lame plot twist? Now everyone already knows what's going to happen next. 
Overall the movie certainly was satisfying to watch but it's highly overrated! This is not the holy grail of superhero movies. After the original Avengers this was actually even more disappointing than AoU. At times it felt like watching 3 movies at once. So sometimes less is actually more, which is what they should've done here.

Review:
What else can you say?

Author: alphadevilll
Review:
*Spoilers ONLY for the worst parts of the movie*
To start with you will be utterly confused,if you have not watched some of the previous movies, you wouldnt understand most of what is going on. So it is downright inaccessible to anybody who hasnt experienced most marvel films before (or at the least i recommend the knowledge of ironman, thor : dark world, avengers, avengers infinity war)
I went into endgame not expecting too much, because i knew that even if you threw all the characters into a blender ,you would still end up with a good enough movie . Thats all i ever wanted but i left the theater on a more confused note.
There were some amazing scenes but they were too few and scattered to make that much impact.
Any movie needs a good story but when you are talking about 25 + superheroes, trying to get everybody into the story is a bit too much considering the amount of screen time an average movie has. So everybody accepted it that its a great thing when we knew that the endgame was going to be 3 hours. But turns out the movie focuses so much on the actual time travel stuff. The story just dumbs down and becomes too slow. The tension element that the avengers have to get the stones back to save a universe is constantly dumbed down by throwing scenes like cap seeing his love,ironman meeting his father (and jarvis), thor meeting his mother.. comeon is this endgame or avengers : thanksgiving ? Even scenes which could have been impactful like cap vs cap are just over too quickly and nobody will remember them on the following day.
The only one necessary for the story out of these, is of ironmans and it still could have been shorter. The movie just loses its thriller element and feels like ''oh well they are just going to stroll through and collect some stones. nothing much.''
Thor is just lost as a character in this movie after they spend so many movies building him up as a character and finally gave him the love he deserved in infinity war. It feels like such a waste.
Not just Thor, Hulk doesnt get any action scenes in this movie considering they turned him into professor hulk.
And so didnt Groot. Groot has 3-4 secs of screentime
Some of the biggest and fan favorite heroes left in the dust. In infinity war, thor just slices through the kamehameha of a six infinity stone powered lvl 100 thanos and wrecks him, now equipped with both mjolnir and stormbreaker , he still cannot do anything to a normal lvl 1 thanos
I mean since ragnarok hulk has been in a fight with himself. In infinity war he just fights in ironmans hulk buster armor.I thought they were saving his big world breaker mode or something for endgame but turn out even after hearing natasha is dead, he doesnt get angry. Just tosses a table and is done. Makes no sense especially considering they gave LOADS of screen time to characters like nebula, gamora and hawk eye over whom most of us would have preferred to see the original avengers like hulk and thor smashing some aliens. And just to remind you people, the action scenes in this movie,the crux where you get to see your favorite heroes fight together in action is justtttttttttttttttttt 28 mins ... from 2:02:00 to 2:30:00 , arrival of Thanos's ship to thanos's death and that too is stretching it. yes i clocked it. The other 2 and a half hour movie is just time travel bullshit and thor crying, hawkeye ( i swear to god that guy had more screentime than captain america) and natasha ranting, going spy in the 1970s and just goofing around till the director says ,get out.
Its still a good movie, because even if they randomly showed all the characters saying bunch of stuff to each other that didnt make sense, i would still say it a good movie because thats is what a fan wants .. just to see his favorite superheroes together. There are some good jokes, few awesome fight moments.
There is so much that can be edited out and so many other heroes that needed more love and action but in conclusion, endgame is still a worthy watch for any fan.

Author: bthoven66
Review:
First thing to be said, you'll leave the theater with a feeling of disappointment. How on Earth can the Avengers lose the Infinity War? Because that's exactly what happens at the end. That ultimate villain named Thanos sit and looks at the horizon thinking "well, it's done, I finally made it" while half of the Universe (and half of our heroes) lie dead. Not possible. That's not superheroes movies are meant to be.
Once that feeling washes off, you'll realize you just watched a great superheroes movie. It has all the action you expected for, amazing visual effects, a great soundtrack, and probably the best performances of every actor involved in a Marvel movie. The plot is not trivial but dense and deep, there's an incredible amount of characters but they work perfectly fine together, and you get really attached with some of them. Even with the villain: I heard more than a few persons saying about Thanos' motivations "well, maybe he has a point on that...".
I talked about performances. Josh Brolin is superb. Despite playing a CGI character, he manages to turn it into an acting masterclass. Three of the superheroines shines high too: Zoe Saldana (the best in my opinion), Elizabeth Olsen and Scarlett Johansson. Chris Hemsworth plays the best Thor I've seen. Of course the Sherlocks Duo, Robert Downey Jr. and Benedict Cumberbatch, are both magnificent. Chris Pratt, Don Cheadle, Tom Hiddleston, Dave Bautista, all of them are very well too. Bradley Cooper makes a better Rocket on every movie.
Dislikes? A few. I still don't get the idea about Groot. I'd be a little frustrated if were Vin Diesel and all I can do is say "I am Groot" a few times per movie. And I really don't undestand why Marvel has turned The Hulk into a comic relief. We saw Bill Bixby in the '70s series, we saw Eric Bana and Edward Norton in the first Marvel movies, and we saw Mark Ruffalo in the first two Avengers movies, all playing a complex character, struggling with his inside beast despite being superior scientists, and I still don't believe that those pitiful jokes are coming from Bruce Banner. At least, if he makes a joke, I'd like to laugh.
Anyway, it's really a good movie, undoubtly the best one from Marvel since "Captain America: Civil War". It's not unlikely that I go to the cinema to watch it again. I really enjoyed it. And if you saw it and you're still in pain because all of that dead superheroes, remember the last phrase on the screen: "Thanos will return". Someone has to be there to stop him, that's for sure.

Author: amyroarvalley
Review:
The way that they had all of the characters interact and come together was interesting and I liked that part.
However, Thanos was the worst part of this movie. He and all his minions looked extremely fake and out of place because it was so obvious that they were CGI when standing next to the real people.
And Thanos just does not look intimidating or evil. At least not like someone who is supposed to be the villain of a huge superhero movie. He seriously looked like some bodybuilder bro.
Also I hated how it seemed like they wanted us to feel bad for Thanos or sympathize with him. They used scenes of him and his "daughter" (someone he kidnapped after killing half her planet) and a scene of him crying (????) to make us like him? Um, no, his sole mission is to kill half the universe. That being said, I'm still confused by his motives. Why does he feel like he needs to balance the universe and why does he feel like it's his job to kill a bunch of people? 
He just didn't make sense to me and it kinda ruined the movie.

Author: jsamuelson-54389
Review_Title: Thanos, Thor and the Battle of Titan
Review:
*SPOILERS*
Marvel and the Russo Bros have outdone themselves. They took a giant, bald, purple guy with a scrotum for a chin and a magical golden glove the size of a human head and actually made him relatable and interesting. They gave you genuine reasons to empathize with him while simultaneously giving you genuine reasons to hate him. Also, some villains have moments that show they're really cowards at heart, or that they don't have the conviction to actually carry out their goals (such as Magneto in the first X-Men film), but there isn't a hint of that in Thanos. As far as he's concerned, not only is he saving the universe -- it's his destiny to save the universe, and he's willing to do whatever it takes to accomplish that goal, even if it kills him, or he loses everything. The Russo bros have said that Thanos is the protagonist of this film, and I saw it that way throughout the movie. I never expected him to be as developed as he was. He's easily the best villain in the entire MCU -- hell, he might be the best villain I've seen in ANY movie in nearly a decade.

Author: umarsonic
Review_Title: Infinity War is the Marvel version of Game of Thrones and it pays off
Review: Avengers Infinity War is one of those rare gems where a movie exceeds your expectations. The action sequences and tge production design is phenomenal no surprise in that as its an MCU movie. Thanos is a fantastic villain, I despised his actions in the movie but there was something about the way his character was written that makes the audience know why his motives and they've shown him not necessarily a conflicted character but a character that has a certain level of humanity props to Josh Brolin for making Thanos believable and not some generic bad guy. This film really shocked me with some of the decisions and some of the character arks and I'm glad that it didn't go the safe route. Honestly I believe that this may very well be one of the best MCU movies and one of the best to come out this year. My only problem with the film is that the film didn't flow fluently which I get because there were so many subplots but that's the only issue I have. Lastly, the Russo brothers deserve the respect of every movie fan for putting together such an epic and grand movie and making it good.

Author: acekaiba
Review: I am truly impressed with this movie and I thought that this one would have win an Oscar. I was especially blown away with Thanos and his Malthusian Theory. Although he was referring the all the population throughout the different universes, he has truly painted a factual picture about of life and the suffering of the population in planet Earth. I agree that it is a sad concept but his ideas and speech was very deep and quite concerning. Although I would not like to see half of the population get wiped away :D

Author: Night_Wit
Review:
I was about ready to give up on the MCU, to be honest. The villains were ineffectual, non-threatening, and the heroes triumphed every time with barely a loss. Civil War was especially disappointing to me in this regard - in the comic book storyline, the panel where Cap lies dead before Iron Man was one of the most personally impactful in Marvel comics. 
However, Infinity War does superhero movies right. It's big, it's loud, it's got enough lightheartedness so that you are still aware it's a popcorn movie based on a comic book - it's just fun. It does Thanos right, probably the most worrisome part of the film for me going in. If they couldn't make Thanos threatening, I would have stopped watching. But they did it. Whether they have the guts to stick with their decision in regards to the ending will be something else entirely, but for now, Infinity War has sated my appetite for a superhero movie. 
While I don't think it'll be something I'll watch twenty years from now like Blade Runner and will inspire deep, complicated thoughts, Infinity War truly was an epic spectacle, and if you were a fan of any of the previous MCU movies, there'll be something in this one for you.

Author: neloangeloo
Review_Title: Masterfully crafted film about fighting spirit.
Review: When was the last time you really wanted something? Now when you've pictured that moment in your mind; how much did you fight for it? Whatever that moment is for you, wether if it's a physical or mental. You pushed yourself through it, wether you succeeded or lost, you still fought for what you wanted. From the words of wise Mr. C; -"I don't need anything. I want." That is the power that we as humans inhabit, what strive us forward. You fight for what you want, because you, alone believe that something should change. Our beliefs are our own personal superpower. Because no matter how hard the obstacle is. If you want to succeed. You will. If you don't believe me, read a book. This world was built by believers. By wanters. The mad Titan Thanos and the world's mightiest heroes themselves believe in this philosophy. The fundamental difference between these people are ideologies. And now here we are. Avengers: Infinity War. Believers against one powerful, unstoppable believer. Rejoice.

Review: Review originally posted via Instagram ("@oratiosanctus") on April 29, 2018:

Author: eagleswings-25013
Review: I couldn't believe I saw some 1 star reviews on this film. Apparently they don't appreciate the time and effort that was put in this film. The film was very well put together, great chemistry between characters, some great humorous banter between characters and had some great action sequences. The acting was also well done and especially with Thanos and certain emotional scenes through out the movie. The ending is a little unexpected, yet we know there is a part two. What actually makes this film better than the other films is there are consequential stakes and sacrifice in this film which made if more intense. I really enjoyed all the characters in this movie, yet all are different and have gone through different struggles and some the same. The most thing I enjoyed about this film is how they went back and forth to different characters to allow each one to have their moment. Was this a perfect movie...No..but Marvel delivered an intense film epic film worth the price of admission.

Author: sderousse
Review_Title: Did something no other marvel movie has ever done..... and they absolutely KILLED it!! BEST MARVEL MOVIE EVER MADE!!
Review: I have waited for so many years for these amazing marvel characters to finally work together and kick some ass. Every single fight scene was pure perfection. I was just filled with so much happiness watching these superheroes fight together. You really can't ask for anything else. FINALLY marvel has made a villain on the big screen that is actually good. Thanos is one of my favorite villains after heath ledgers joker. You see exactly just how powerful he is and crazy he is. They also bring out his emotion side for a brief minute which is something I never saw coming. He is just amazing. And the comedy!! I would give the comedy a 10. You can tell that they aren't just jokes they added in at the last minute just to add it. Seeing Tom Holland being so happy just to be there was so good you can just tell how happy he is. He and tony stark are still like father and son, and they work so well together. All the characters get enough time in the movie so they don't just feel like they were put there just because they can and it'll make them money. I will worn you however, the ending will either make you hate it and infuriate you or you'll understand just why the Russo brothers did this. You might have to take a day to process what just happened but if you understand that the ending isn't a bad thing but kind of a work of art. I give a nine because of the ending and because there are those moments when they just feel a little long and you want to see thanos punch someone in the face but they really didn't bother me that much. So, in conclusion, this is my all time favorite marvel movie and I'm gonna see it like another 4 times at least while still in theaters. I'm still just amazed on how phenomenal this movie was and that we finally get the cross over we deserve and that it is definitely not a giant flop like justice league was. AWESOME movie.

Author: gcabaseballscott
Review_Title: My Life is Flipped Upside Down
Review: I don't recall any movie that had as much hype as Infinity War. I mean, it's the culmination of 10 years worth of work. That being said, I expected to be blown away, and I was. This movie delivers on such a magnificent level, there really isn't an adequate amount of words that can be said about it. It does an exceptional job of connecting the Avengers, the Guardians, and the citizens of Wakanda in a way that only a Marvel movie can. A fantastic film from start to finish that was shot beautifully, the only thing that may keep me from seeing this tons of times was the ending and how hard it was to see those particular characters disappear into the Soul Realm. The action was breathtaking, and I even openly screamed a couple of times, something I don't do in movies. I do want to applaud the Russo brothers for being able to deliver shocking twists to fans who have been around for 10 years and having the guts to kill (and supposedly kill) as many, and THE characters, that they did. I can't say enough good things about this movie, but I'll end with this: it was, far and away, the best movie, superhero or not, that I'v ever seen.

Author: ajbr-48095
Review: By the time the credits rolled, I was in tears. This film successfully brings together all of the heroes we've grown to love in the 10 years since the first Iron Man in a way that is epic, emotional, and satisfying...and all of this without it ever feeling too crowded. The tone is spot-on, with funny moments, serious moments, and emotional ones. Watch this movie as soon as you can - it is spectacular.

And from this point of view, the film ends very well. Maybe the next movie title will be about Thanos while the protagonists in the end will really be the Avengers

Review_Title: Some nice action and good ending
Review: I hope this was the last Marvel movie, at least last one concerning this story continuum. If it is not, i will be disappointed. Infinity War has good, memorable ending. If it is spoiled by future movies with the help of some "gotcha-trick", this movie will not stand a classic. If it is left as-is now, it will stand as a cult classic for generations.

Author: rogerhagerty
Review_Title: Good movie, but slow down on best of all time
Review:
I wouldn't expect, or recommend anyone to see this movie as their first introduction to this super hero universe. So, going forward with the premise that you have seen most of the previous Avenger movies, you should enjoy this one. To be clear, I did. Heck I gave it 8 stars out of 10. Now, my 8 stars is in real world a 7+, but that's not an option, so 8.
The movie does a real nice job of shoe horning all the different characters into it, without feeling like each characters scene was gratuitous. There is a nice amount of comedy, but not an over the top amount, like was in Thor Ragnarok. 
The Thanos character C.G.I. looks pretty good! His league of minions are typical bad guy cannon fodder. 
The numerous deaths of the super heroes in the movie is kinda sorta false b.s. though. We all know most, if not all of these passings will not take. Heck, it's all but spelled out what will happen, at least in a general sense, the next film so that all the deaths can be erased. So, anyone leaving the theater wiping their wet eyes on their shirt sleeves, buck up. Tony Stark and the remaining sup's will make short order of Thanos and bring all your favorite characters back soon. Just in time too, as I have no doubt that the studio will want another huge payday!

Review:
First thing first: Marvel has hit a bull eye with it's post ten year celebration with this movie. The movie had everything which a CB fan is looking forward to. From perking actions to tear causing dramas this latest installment in the Marvel series is a treat to watch. The only irky part about the movie is that it rushes to end quickly after a steady start, but when you have to pickup 22 superheroes' storyline that is what you should expect first.
Go to the theatre and have fun but take tissue along with you too.

Author: hassanfarooq-60472
Review_Title: Packed with action and comedy, a mind blowing storyline and breaking the cliches while shattering our hearts.
Review:
Avengers: Infinity War is latest installment in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, and they have taken an unbelievable and daring step with this movie. 
Kevin Feige and The Russo Brothers have cooked up a masterpiece, which will keep you at the edge of your seat, and when you least expect, it will send you into a state of denial.
An amazing quality of this movie is how unpredictable it is, and what an amazing job Marvel did and keeping the plot a secret until the release, by handing out fake scripts to the actors and whatnot. 
The special effects, and the CGI in this movie were better than any other movie of the MCU, nothing at all seemed unrealistic (except Proxima Midnight at certain parts of the movie.)
Another one of the best things about MCU's latest installment is that although it will be a completely different experience for Marvel fans (people who've watched the movies, who read comics and in a nutshell, know everything one's supposed to know for Infinity War) compared to people who're just watching the movie for the sake of watching such a hyped release, it'll still be pretty amazing for those non-fans. Because they've made the movie in such a way that even a person who knows very less will understand what's happening.
Another amazing thing was how they portrayed Thanos. They did it the right way. They made us see his emotions, his reasons for being a genocidal purple egg. MCU has done great with their villains in their past two installments; Thanos and Killmonger. With Hela they didn't really get into depth. And they didn't really show Hela as a person, they just showed her as a mad woman killing for fun and a hunger for the throne and power. But with Thanos and Killmonger, they showed us what they went through to have these motives and aims. They didn't show them as madmen, they showed them as people. Normal people, with normal thought processes, and the ability to feel, which in my opinion is the best thing you can do with a villain; make them as human as possible.
Now we get to the quality every MCU movie has; the humor. I think this might be the best Stan Lee cameo for me. And having this ambitious a crossover is difficult, very difficult infact, but they used humor to make the characters go together perfectly. Tony Starks sarcasm, Peter Parker's movie references, Thor not knowing what to say where and Star Lord's (hilarious) narcissism all mixed in perfectly acting as comic relief scenes. 
And the last of many qualities of this movie; the daring step and breaking the cliche. This movie is not like every other superhero movie, I repeat, it is not like every other superhero movie. It's the biggest Cinematic Event in the history of cinema. And that is for a reason, not just a very grand cast, but an amazing storyline. If you have seen it, you know what 
I mean, but if you haven't....then I guess you will.
As Thanos wants things "perfectly balanced", that's what they did with this movie; humor, action, climax and emotion blended into a perfect balance. 
One of the best movies of the 21st Century, for me.

Author: bigchub67
Review_Title: Marvel Studios has done it right! Congratulations on your 10 & 19.
Review:
The 10 years of hard work, planning, and steadfast belief in their stories and movies have resulted in a catalog of superheroes movies that are not only entertaining, but resulting in a universe that has captured the imagination of the world.
And Avengers: Infinity War is epic!
It delivers on its promise and then some more surprises. For a movie of this scale, it does sacrifice some plot development for pacing, but those who have been watching the MCU are familiar with all the characters and storylines that have converged to IW.
And so the story jumps right in to the events immediately following Thor: Ragnarok.
Watching this movie on Wednesday morning 8.15am in IMAX, I was blown away by everything I saw onscreen, feeling like I was reading a comic book like a kid again.
And that is the feeling Marvel movies have given me. Especially when I see all my favorite superhero characters coming together to fight Thanos.
The Avengers were not prepared to fight such a powerful villain and because the Avengers have broken up after civil war, they lack the unity to make a strong defense against Thanos, giving him the upper hand.
And when the closing credits rolled the audience were all silent and stunned, sitting in their seats for a end credits scene and then left quietly, probably going through the movie in their heads questioning what they had watched.
There's even more questions now, but looking forward to Avengers 4 in 2019.

Author: LordPravius1980
Review: From the opening moments to the last frame of the end credits scene, Avengers: Infinity War will blow you away. It would have been complicated to handle so many scenes and such a big cast, but it's been done brilliantly around a solid story-line. I want to go watch it again!

Review: Avengers: Infinity War could just be the greatest marvel movie.... oh wait..... it is!! This movie is bone chilling and ground breaking.
