Josh Brolin does an amazing job adapting the character. He even cry's! And that's motion capture. The standout is Robert Downey Junior though. Best Iron Man performance. You know what, everyone is great. The ending will 100% make you cry and is breathtaking!! 10/10!!!!

Review_Title: It was good but why all the hate?!?!?
Review: My problem here is with the people that give bad ratings. I am a bit of a hard-core marvel fan myself and didnt consider this film as great as people claim.

Author: gilberts-91420
Review_Title: Grab your wallet and hold tight.
Review: Once again no real full story. As I sat hoping for a helping of goodness I was left disappointed. Just about all the characters in the Marvel/Disney universe are brought together only to see them all torn asunder. Marvel/Disney sets you up with only part of the story. Looks like the Bad Guy has won and we are left wondering what will happen in the sequel. I realize this is a time honored tradition that dates back to the days of the "cliff hanger" shows like Flash Gordon but when you are paying the money we do to see a feature film I think it is time to finish a story. Yes another reach for our collective wallets. And now the collective Marvel/Disney people will go back to all the separate stories of all the remaining heroes and we will be left wondering how it will all shake out till they reunite them for another "Blockbuster"! At least those of us who have knowledge of the comic books have some comfort. The biggest spoiler of all so stop reading if you don't want to know. Yes, Thanos has all the stones but the "time" stone can basically redo all that Thanos did when he removed half of the beings in the universe. Take heart. Marvel/Disney would never really do away with any of their moneymaker characters for real. Just once I would like to see them refrain from the opportunity to blatently demonstrate the greed that pervades Hollywood. Just like the remaining heroes I guess I'll just have to decide next time if I will purchase the disc when it is released or wait till it is on Netflix or in a bargain bin.

Author: trevir-50147
Review_Title: A 10-Year Culmination that was Well Worth the Wait !
Review: It all started with Iron Man in 2008, and every subsequent Marvel film for the last decade has either contributed directly or indirectly to Avengers/Infinity War. This film has action throughout but is also heavy on story line as all the individual Marvel Tales of every preceding film converge to the epic point of conflict to a universal threat! With most characters faithfully depicted from all the movies we loved involved, this is a Journey into Mystery; the Ultimate Marvel Team-Up, with Tales of Suspense & Tales to Astonish thrown in for good measure! Two Thumbs ( both of mine ) waaaaaaaaaaaay Up !!

Author: johnneypickles
Review_Title: It's the best it could possible be
Review:
I really have to commend the Russo Brothers and Marvel Studios for this film. I can't imagine what a task it must have been to balance all these many characters and still make a good and entertaining film. That said, it's not perfect.
It's a bit too long, and a a little bloated. It particularly gets a little dull in the middle. However these flaws were always going to be unavoidable for a film like this, with so many characters and tones having to mesh. That's why I say that, while the film's not perfect, it's the best it could have been. 
The film is quite funny, and all the jokes land. The action is great. Seeing the characters meet and interact is very fun. 
The highlight of the film, for sure, is the villain. Thanos is fantastic. He has a clear motivation, and real menace.
Very fun film for everyone. It is definitely a part 1 though, so keep that in mind.

Author: rahulroyriome
Review_Title: Just awesome movie i love this movie
Review: Just awesome movie i love this movie best movie, this movie my one of favorite movie all hero just awesome

Author: cmko2004
Review: The latest addition to Marvel's onslaught of cinematic masterpieces really does its job of icing the Marvel cake. The acting and dialogue was superb, the special affects (as always) were amazing, and perhaps the best thing about this movie was its ability to NOT BE predictable. Josh Brolin's performance as the main antagonist Thanos was excellently executed and managed to get me to see things from the villain's point of view (I never do that). The other performances were as well fantastic. There is little to say in the realm of so-so for this movie, other than the fact that Endgame can't come more quickly.

Author: lewisbeale
Review_Title: READ THIS!! A Great Way of Celebrating 10 Years In The MCU!
Review: Its all been leading to this! Avengers Infinity War brings together the last 10 years of the Marvel Cinematic Universe! The Avengers, Black Panther, Doctor Strange Spider-Man and The Guardians Of The Galaxy come together to defeat the mad titan Thanos in an attempt to stop him from retrieving all six infinity stones. The ending will leave you confused, emotional but also very excited for the future of the MCU. However the fact that Ant-Man and Hawkeye do not appear in this film left me a bit disappointed as Ant-Man (2015) was a big part of the past 10 years as it introduced a new hero and I think to see him not make an appearance was wrong. Hawkeye was one of the original 6 Avengers so it would have been right for him to show up. In conclusion, the movie blows you away and takes straight into the centre of war as the film begins. You will love it!

Author: jedimack
Review_Title: One of the best MCU Films
Review: Like most people, I was really looking forward to this movie, as the first Avengers movie from 2012 has great meaning to me, as I believe it was the first PG-13 movie I ever saw in the theater, and my dad wanted to see it and I was unaware of it. Ever since then, I have seen every MCU movie in the theater with exceptions of "Guardians of the Galaxy 1 and 2", "Doctor Strange", and Ant-Man. I saw this in 3D opening weekend. We got there an hour early and by the time the movie started, the area behind us in the theater was almost completely filled up. This was one of those big movies that are a special occasion. 2 examples are "Marvel's Avengers" (2012) and "Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens". This will be another short review, but this movie gave us the Iron Spider suit, one of my favorite Spider-Man suits, and gave us Thanos, something they've been hyping up since 2012 as a post credit scene to "Avengers". This is my second favorite MCU movie, and the first is "Avengers". I could probably see myself watching this once or twice a year. This was so good, but I didn't feel for any of the characters that "died", as I knew they were coming back. But overall, this is a great MCU movie and definitely worth a watch.

Author: spookyrebecca
Review_Title: Avengers: Infinity War is probably one of the best movies of 2018
Review: Avengers: Infinity War, in my opinion, is the best movie in the Avengers universe. I was never a huge Marvel fan, I always enjoyed watching any Avengers film, but I was COMPLETELY and UTTERLY blown away after seeing Avengers: Infinity War. There's only a small list of movies that have taken my breath away after seeing them, and Infinity War is definitely one of them. From the incredible cast and character list, to the memorizing special effects, Avengers: Infinity War does not shy away from moments that make you rethink everything you have known about the Marvel Universe. One of my favorite parts about Avengers: Infinity War is the score, it really helped tie in the special effects in addition to the story-line, which contained both dramatic and comical scenes. The one thing you need to know is that the ending will truly, mess. you. up. Even if you are not a fan of the Avengers and you see this movie, you will still feel shocked. I definitely recommend seeing Avengers: Infinity War.

Author: owain-52760
Review: I think that this film is a very fun, action packed Marvel film. Some of the action is extremely well done and special effects are on point. The relationships between the characters are very good and makes you feel for the characters which makes the deaths even more heartbreaking for the audience. Although this film is extremely good I do think it is slightly overrated. For example, the way Dr Strange can't destroy the stone because he sworn to protect it is a stupid reason to keep hold of an infinity stone and wouldn't he hide it somewhere better than around his neck? Also, the Red Skull appearing with the soul stone didn't make any sense and was a very disappointing location for the soul stone in my opinion. Thanos is a great villain who has clearly lost a lot for whatever he needs the soul stones for and loves Gamora more than anything, except the soul stone? Surely if he loved her that much he wouldn't kill her to get a stone to kill half the universe. I just didn't quite understand why he needed the stones so much and hopefully in part 2 we can find out why.

Author: obaidanahe-42390
Review: Now, Marvel has already proven over the last decade that they can really keep surprising us and drwing us into the theatres to watch more and more of their movies. But surprises fall utterly short when it comes down to this movie. This movie doesn't surprise you with just a twist scene or an event, it surprises you with its tone. Holy Hell! From the first SECOND of the movie, literally, you could tell it's gonna be a bloodbath and a heartbreak. Real stakes? These are stakes so real you'd wish they weren't. Action scenes? This movie gives you so much epic scenes you'd get lost after you walk out of the movie on which was your favorite! And the villain? GOD DAMN, Thanos is a menace! Not best marvel villain. But one of the best villains period. The movie balances action, sadness, comedy, goosebumps, and shocking events perfectly. Easily, the best MCU movie and definitely the best Superhero movie to date!!!

Author: ls-73420
Review_Title: Avengers Infinity War: An ambitious Superhero Movie
Review:
Avengers Infinity War it´s the 19th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, and it´s the conclusion of 10 years of movies, with all of the characters (or most of them) coming together in one big, ambitious movie project.
This is a movie that took years to develop because of the release of the movies and for the development of all of the characters and story arcs.
Let´s now focus on the movie properly, in Infinity War the heroes must come together to defeat the big guy :Thanos. 
The story works, it´s not a great script and certainly marvel has done better, but it works.It´s great to see all of this characters together and all of the interactions between them.The villain is great, Thanos has presence he´s intimidating and the his story line made sense, the relation between him and Gamora was one of the most interesting parts of the movie as it gave depth to the character. The directing is good, the visual effects and the action sequences are impressive as they usually are in these movies. In moments i felt that there was probably an excess of action sequences, it was just a little too much.
By the end, Infinity War might not be the best marvel movie, but it´s an exciting, funny, touching and overall satisfying addition to the Marvel franchise.

Author: beware_of_the_werewolf15
Review_Title: Better Than Past MCU Films, But Still Has Almost the Same Formula
Review: Avengers: Infinity War comes after a long line of previous Marvel films, and some would say that the same old formula is getting pretty exhausting. Infinity War definitely has a lot of the same formula, and still plays it safe at times, but it is definitely a step up from a lot of the previous films. Doesn't say as much as Black Panther, but still has some philosophical moments. This film also has a villain a tad more interesting than most of the bland MCU films in previous entries, and we get to understand a bit more of how he thinks. He is a bit more complex than most of the previous villains, and that is refreshing. Avengers: Infinity War was a pretty good film, not amazing, but a decent enough Marvel film in a time when its formula has been getting pretty tiring.

Author: thechriscloud
Review:
Spoiler Free Review!
What an amazing and epic adventure! My only regret is not seeing it in IMAX. (I probably will) Contrary to my expectations, no characters were over done and none were wasted. A great balance of the most beloved and the "new to the show". This film was nothing like the "super boring and confusing" Age of Ultron, or the "funny but forgettable" Guardians 2, or the "not as great the second time around" Thor Ragnarok. Despite its epic scale (lots of locations and lots of characters) and loose ends it had to tie up, Infinity War was surprisingly easy to follow, and totally engaging all the way through. Fun, hilarious, emotional, action packed (with lots of real stunts and not cartoony CGI), great soundtrack and totally worth seeing more than once. The directors (the Russo brothers) may have finally dethroned "The Avengers" as my favorite MCU movie. Civil War is a close second, also directed by the Russo brothers. Those guys were a great addition to the MCU. Fantastic film, I can't wait to watch it again and no one spoil it for anyone!

Review_Title: Perfect ending to the series Part1
Review: Avengers Infinity war is the moment we ve all been waiting for. Since IronMan was released back in 2008 Marvel constantly build up a cohesive story with Captain America and Thor, which eventuall led to the beginning of the avengers. Avengers Infinity war took up all these movies to tell one last story against the hardest villain of all time: Thanos. Author: reid-54961
Review: If you haven't seen the movie, scroll away now. You've been warned. Now. Into the movie I've been waiting ten years of my life for. I'm gonna go through the whole movie. First off, Loki dying was a given. If there was anything predictable at all, it was that. Another thing that might be a flaw is that Idris Elba's character dies and I wanted soo bad to feel for him, but I just simply didn't. When the story finally came down to Earth, I loved the feeling of urgency. You literally get kicked into the action and the Avengers have hardly even assembled yet and there's stuff going on in the streets! You get to see Tony Stark and Banner and Doctor Strange run through the smoky streets looking for answers to the destruction around them and they find Thanos's servants: The Black Order. If anything, they weren't much more than mini bosses you fight to get to the real deal. The fight scenes on the streets were amazing (as with all of them in this movie) and it was a great introduction. Back on Earth, Scarlet Witch, Vision, Banner (Because the Hulk is scared to awaken since Thanos beat the green out of him), Captain America (Now, Nomad), Black Panther, Winter Soldier, War Machine, and Falcon prepare for an attack on Wakanda, all the while, trying to remove the Mind Stone from Vision's head. If I had a problem with any of that storyline, it is that it was a little rushed into. Something I loved however, was Thanos. This was his movie, almost more than the Avenger's. He is so fleshed out and you understand his motives. He really is doing what he truly believes is right. He is, in fact, the "mad titan". He has got more story, more emotion than ANY villain Marvel has thrown at us. He even kills his own daughter just to get the Soul Stone. And while we're on that subject: Red Skull is ALIVE. I just knew he wasn't dead back in the first Captain America movie. Back to Thanos. Throughout the movie you learn to hate this guy with such a passion. He is literally the most powerful being in the universe and you feel it completely. While the movie is going on you have this sense of dread. That something is coming, that some eventual threat is gonna make it's appearance. Now let's talk about a sensitive subject. When Iron Man, Doctor Strange, Spider-Man, and half the Guardians of the Galaxy actually have Thanos pinned down.. and then StarLord finds out that Gamora is dead and literally screws half the universe. They have the Gauntlet almost off of him, but Quill let his love and anger get in the way. I, for one, am not mad. In the moment, he was angry and blinded by rage. He lost his mom, had to kill his dad, and now another person he loves has died and he couldn't do anything to stop it. He was acting on his gut and it cost a giant price. In that same fight sequence, Iron Man is fighting harder than you've ever seen him fight before. He is punching and creating shields and his armor is tearing. And then Thanos stabs him, and I honestly thought that was it. I was about to be in tears as my favorite hero was about to die. And then Doctor Strange offers the Time Stone for Tony's life. Some people have a bone to pick with this but I believe it's all a part of Strange's bigger plan. Earlier, on Titan, he went through so many timelines to see if their outcomes and they only win one. And then at the inevitable ending, he tells Tony, "It was the only way." Showing that he had to make this sacrifice to have the eventual victory. Peter Dinklage was the dwarf at the birthplace of the Infinity Gauntlet and Thor's Hammer and it was a little awkward to see him that way but I was fine with it. Also Thor's new axe (and eye) is amazing. The Wakanda fight scene was, like I said, rushed, but ended up showing some amazing fight scenes, such as: Captain America and Black Panther running and fighting side by side, or Scarlet Witch showing off the true power of her abilities. And when Thor came down with his new axe, he obliterated tons of those weird dog-like aliens. And it almost feels like they are actually winning.. and then Thanos shows up. Thanos is here for the last Stone and with 5 already, he is unstoppable. It was hard to watch as literally almost every Avenger hurled themselves at him and he merely flicked them away like flies. Before he can get to Vision, Scarlet Witch destroys the Mind Stone.. only for Thanos to rewind time and rip it out of Vision's skull. As his body fell limp and grey, I could only imagine was Scarlet Witch was feeling. The one thing I didn't expect was when Thor almost killed him. I thought to myself, "Hey, this could be a good enough ending." And then Thanos wins. He snaps his fingers and half the universe dies just like that. And the big deaths begin to happen. All of the Guardians die, except Rocket, and he even had to watch Groot die in front of him. Bucky dies as Steve Rogers falls to his knees and is literally speechless to see his best friend turn into ash. Black Panther dies (which through me for a loop). Then Falcon and some of the Wakandans die, along with Scarlet Witch herself. I think the most heart wrenching moment was when Spider-Man began to fade away. He literally grabs onto Tony, his mentor, and begs for his life. He tells him that he's not ready to go, and Tony has to sit there as he dies in his arms. I still can't believe Marvel did that. They actually killed around 14 characters in the span of two and half hours. And 10 of them were in the span of 15 minutes. It was horrifying to watch these heroes die off one by one. For the first time, the villain wins. For the first time, I don't know what to expect to happen next. Half of the roster just died and it's too much to comprehend. This is the most serious, beautiful, and high stakes movie Marvel has ever created. The credits feel like an obituary to those who were lost. This movie was indeed a Marvel Epic, and I can and cannot wait to see what happens next year in Avengers 4. And on the end credit scene: I can't wait for Captain Marvel. This movie broke me, put me back together, and then tore me apart again. I love and hate this movie. This will be day in cinema history. 10/10 all the way.

Author: shanethedane
Review_Title: The Ten Year Wait Was Worth It
Review: The MCU has been my favorite since I watched the first Captain America in elementary school. Every single film felt like it was leading to something bigger, and this was it and it delivered better than I ever could have imagined. Stephen McFeely and Christopher Markus once again do a fantastic job with the screen play. I was amazed at how well they were able to balance every single character. Most characters don't have more than 10 minutes of screen time but everyone has a moment to shine, their presence feels much bigger. I really think credit is deserved for Thanos, everything about him. Josh Brolin does fantastic in this role; he is the best villain in a superhero film since the 2008 Joker. The CGI on him was also flawless. The visual and sound effects were superb in general. I was a bit worried about that after Black Panther which had mediocre CG, but this film looked excellent. This movie is paced in a way that provides exciting action throughout and offers a chance for the big characters to have deep moments, particularly with Star-Lord. If you haven't seen this, you need to, it is nothing short of spectacular.

Author: ironicaldigestion
Review_Title: Fantastic interpretation of the The Infinity Gauntlet comic.
Review: While I am a fan of comics I never was of its cinematic counterpart because almost always movie producdion houses and directors were not brave enough to adapt the movies like they were in the comics or close nough, in fear of not capturing the attention of the normal movie going masses. These last 16 movies by marvel decided to take a brave step in the right direction and expand on the comic universe in order to adapt some of the amazing and complex story lines from the comics. All 16 movies prior infonity wars led to the Infinity gauntlet event and slowly built up the plot for it in the backround of each movie. And finally with Avangers: Infinity War one of the most iconic battles in the marvel universe was fantastically adapted on the big screen. Avengers: Infinity War is the best movie of its genre, and the best comic adaption along with The Watchmen. I urge every Comic fan to watch this movie and be absolutely blown away. It blew all my expectations trough the roof!

Author: edwardsah
Review:
My goal here is not to get you not to see the movie. You're going to see it anyway. It's just to help you manage your expectations. 
Do you remember the first scene in the first 'Toy Story' movie when, as part of an internal dialogue, Woody's owner says 'I brought my attack dog with a built-in force field. Well I brought my Dinosaur, who eats force-field dogs?' Well, that's the level of writing in Infinity Wars. Only they mean it. Super powers have gotten to the point that anything can be anything else. The, by now, run-of-the-mill avengers powers are simply no match for for Thanos and his buddies. And yet, the avengers find completely unexplained ways to defeat some of the minions. Nothing. Makes. Sense. Even within the context of the movie. Things just happen. Some good, and some bad. Everything is at apocalyptic scale. Huge set-pieces are inter-spliced with other huge set-pieces, and all of it really to no avail. Any interaction between characters is simply short-hand. When everything is at such a large scale, you don't give a rat's ass who lives and who dies. Or what happens. If you just want a catalog of special effects, this movie is for you. If you still have an appetite for story, character development, and chemistry, lower your expectations.

I was worried the film would feel rushed and generic with forced cameos but I was dead wrong. This was by far the best superhero film I have ever seen. Author: woziak
Review_Title: It's Divisive but brilliant in its execution
Review:
Just got out of watching this movie in Imax 3d and although I love this film, it will have some negativity simply because it involves so many characters and only 2hr 36 minutes to tell the story. Ok let's start, the first act starts at a frantic pace just after the events of Thor Ragnorak and we instantly find out Thanos malevolent intentions, he wants all the 'infinity stones' to balance the Universe by wiping out half the Universe's population. After this showstopping first Act we are whisked off to New York where Dr Strange meets Spiderman and Iron Man for the first team closely followed by Hulkless Dr Banner. Thanos, Knowing that Dr Strange and vision has two of the stones on earth first heads to 'knowhere' from the GOG franchise to pick up the third stone from the collector drawing out Gamorra who is critical to the main and sub plot of the film, after using the reality stone to defeat The GOG he now tries to locate the 4th stone, the Soul gem which is hidden to all but one, before he will venture to earth to collect the final 2 stones. Thanos sends his children , 'The Black Order' to locate and find the two stones while he searches for the most difficult. During this rollercoaster of a ride that at times feels so similar to the cut scenes of the DC injustice movie, Thor meets the Guardians, then with Rocket and teenage Groot journies to the planet of the Dwarves to forge a new hammer called "Stormbreaker". All this is happening while Capt, Falcon, Black Widow rescue Scarlet Witch and Vision from the black order and then seek refuge with War Machine in Wakanda. 
 Also concurrently in the film we see Iron Man, Spider Man and Dr Strange hitch a lift to Titan, homeworld of Thanos where they meet the GOG all intent on stopping Thanos reaching Earth to collect the final 2 stones. Ok as you can see the plot is so fast there is no time to pause for breath and this is where some of the critics will have a field day but the film achieves its goals with brilliant pacing, fight scenes, special effects and great moments for all our heroes and villains alike and some stunning shocks that leave you gasping and exhilarated both at the same time. The ending is brilliant but you know especially with the aftercredits scene that the franchise simply can't end this way so Avengers 4 will be another must watch movie!! 
 Joss Brolin is rightly getting plaudits for his portrayal of a wonderful villain but for me, he's only the 2nd best in the MCU, behind Killmonger and still a distant 3rd in Comic book movies behind Heath Ledger's Joker, netherless his brilliant emotional arc of the character and in paticular Thanos relenting unerving motivation is what elevates the film to top 5 in the MCU behind Winter Soldier, Black Panther, Avengers 1 and Civil War. My only criticism is I wish there was more Wakanda in the movie but it does host the one of the best battle scenes witnessed on the big screen.

Author: ravithejaabboju
Review_Title: Avengers Infinity War is more than an epic and a masterpiece.
Review:
Avengers: Infinity War is more than an epic, a masterpiece, an emotional ride, visual extravaganza and cinematic excellence. Infinity War is a dream come true for Marvel fans from all over the world. Infinity war is not just a cinema, it's an experience, 3 years of await, 10 years of exceptional journey and 18 movies of long thread lead to this. Everything about Infinity war is spellbinding and mind boggling. Hats off to the Russo Brothers(Anthony and Joe Russo) for bringing Infinity war into life and meeting up to the fans expectations and the hype, their vision is extraordinary, you will know once you see the movie, how great their direction was and characters build up. They just nailed it. Half of the total credits must go to Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely for the amazing screenplay. The movie starts off with Thor: Ragnarok's post credit scene and ends up with "end of everything". Right from the word go, every scene was intriguing,engaging and thrilling. Every superhero in the movie has got their own space to showcase their powers and skills, you will scream for every scene, I promise, even if you are not a fan of a particular superhero, you will surely scream for their elevations. There are many sacrifices in this movie which are quite emotional and they are so meaningful. Even the mad titan himself has to sacrifice something to gain something. Thanos is not just a villain, he has his own character which has a lot of emotional depth. You will feel sorry for him in few moments which causes so much pain to him. His life, his children, his sacrifice and his goal everything means so much to him. He also respects his opponents even though they took out the blood from his face. Thanos says "I hope they remember you" to Tony, this scene is just awesome and you are gonna love it for sure. Josh Brolin is spectacular in Thanos role, he completely nailed it. Thanos' adoptive children Cull Obsidian, Ebony Maw, Proxima Midnight and Corvus Glaive helps him to fill the infinity gauntlet with six infinity stones. They also had few outstanding moments in this movie. There will be a heartbreak in the first 5 minutes of the movie, so, one should not miss the beginning. Heimdall's uses bifrost one last time to save Hulk and succeeds by the way. The scene in which Bruce Banner warns Dr. Strange by saying "Thanos is coming" is striking. Dr. Strange seeking help of Tony Stark is an another moment to cherish by Marvel fans. Scenes involving Peter Parker, Tony Stark and Stephen Strange were remarkable.
The entrance scene of Steve Rogers is breathtaking, Captain, Widow and Falcon rescues Vision and Wanda Maximoff from Midnight and Glaive. And also the scenes involving Thor, Rocket, Groot, Mantis, Gamora, Drax, Star Lord were picturesque. The king, Black Panther opens the door for the trouble and evil, he never hesitates to help "all of them", even if Wakanda destroys, he wouldn't care because he is the king.
The entire action sequences pictured in Wakanda and Titan are jaw-dropping. Climax of the movie will leave you baffled and so was the post credits scene involving Maria Hill and Nick Fury. That was the best time to call "Captain Marvel" to the scenario. Be prepared for the heartbreaks in the climax, they were too emotional.
On the whole, Avengers: Infinity war is a movie which will be cherished and remembered for a long time, like even for few decades or so. Infinity war is nothing short of an epic. A masterpiece. MARVEL-ous one from the Marvel Studios. I'm not going to disclose spoilers in my review, just go and experience the epic. We have to wait until May 3rd, 2019 to see how the mystery unfolds. Just 1 more year, we can wait as we have more Marvel movies coming this year and the next.

Author: sijazz38-597-199080
Review_Title: Why so much negativity from some reviews...
Review:
... I don't understand, yes some of the characters that were dusted we'll know will be back because they've more films announced but seeing the deaths of some of them during the dusting scenes were still an emotional gut punch, anyone who wasn't moved by Tom Holland's acting during his death scene have to be emotionless morons!
There have been 18 films in the MCU prior to this not as some have said 31! All those prior 18 films have had plot threads going into Infinity War. Thanos is the best villain Marvel has had in all their MCU films and Josh Brolin even in motion capture/CGI still made Thanos an interesting character who in his own twisted way did what he did for the right reasons. Part of the problem I think some reviewers had was the number of characters who had more or less screen time than they thought they deserved, and yes we know most if not all the characters who were killed will probably be back by the time the credits roll in Avengers 4 but this doesn't distract from the steller job the directors & screenwriters have done with such a huge story and cast. Believe the more genuine reviews rather than the overly critical ones, at least Marvel know how to make a superhero film work which is more than DC/Warners are doing with their films (I thought bringing Josh Whedon in to tidy up Justice League would help but unfortunately it didn't).
This is by far the MCU's best film and I would imagine there are others who agree with me on that!

Review_Title: Fun is the balance of the universe!

This movie turned the tide of what's considered a marvel Villian and produced some staggering scenes that took courage and consistency by Joe and Anthony Russo. This was indeed a Thanos film focused more on his quest for dominance and the infinity stones. It literally felt like 3 films in one bringing over 50 characters together and actually making this work well. I have never seen a director bring so many actors together and create such a memorable masterpiece!

Author: jayholmeshj
Review: Perfect movie for a marvel fan. As a fan who has watched all the previous movies and has followed the franchise, I can say that this movie has very much exceeded my expectations. This movie is packed with very emotional scenes, humour when appropriate, great action and an amazing storyline. What I didn't expect was how they portrayed Thanos by showing an emotional side to him unlike most supervillains. I had goosebumps all over me during some scenes because they were just so well-directed and just straight-up cool. I would've given it a ten except I thought that the way they killed off Loki was totally unheroic. 5 minutes into the movie and Loki is strangled to death without any sort of a memorable ending. I know how the directors wanted to be bold and kill off some characters but really? Heimdall's death was not in vain as he did something heroic before he died. Also Gamora's death was very emotional so, no complaints. But Loki, as a fan-favourite character, should have been given a memorable death. That's my only complain with the movie. Other than that, mind-blowing movie and can't wait for the next part.

Author: trexhunter-26422
Review:
After 18 films in the making it has all lead to this. An epic showdown of cinematic proportions on a scale that will never be replicated. The Russo's dons great job at juggling each band of hero's as they try to stop the mad titan. One of the best directed senes was the first big reveal of the black order in New York. The opening is cold and horrifying letting the audience learn how truly powerful Thanos is with just one stone.
Thanos is an awesome villain that is both powerful and sympathetic. He doesn't have a lady death like in the comics. His motivations are set out and make sense as a whole and Josh Brolin's performance is awesome and in my opinion Oscar worthy. 
The supporting cast as well is nothing to scoff at. They all support the main groups in a good way and each getting time to shine. An outstanding performance comes from Paul Bettney who is amazing in the role and plays off Elizabeth Olsen very well and makes their love more real. He in my opinion turns in an amazing performance that again I feel is Oscar worthy. He shows a wide range of emotion that effects the audience. Chris Pratt has an amazing moment with Zoey Zeldana and his duty to the one he loves. There are so many emotionally charged moments that effect the viewer well after you walk out of the theater. Though the ending is a little down for some unprepared viewers it still doesn't detract from the spectacle and scale the movie is on. The film demonstrates how low our heroes can go and the stakes that were there. Even one of the last lines is depressing yet hopeful. The film is a marvel (no pun intended) of cinematic and storytelling spectacle and how to pull off a great 3rd act of your series.
Though sometimes slow and characters lacking in substance and reason for being there it still is a great film that is one part emotional and another a war that lives up with its name.

Author: onetwentyinnafiftyfive
Review: This is going to be rather brief because it's difficult to discuss the film without spoiling anything. That said, oftentimes there's a pivotal moment or a reveal that drives a film's viewership based solely on hype and fervor. In such films, once the initial shock dissipates, there's little left to warrant rewatching, but it does encourage patrons to flood the box officer earlier than later. I suspect the studio push admonishing early moviegoers to avoid spoilers and inciting the hashtag movement, "thanosdemandsyoursilence", was likely a calculated tool to drive the hype. Infinity War, while having such pivotal moments, will probably stand as one of the better Marvel Studios films regardless of the hype.

Author: amerelium
Review:
Infinity War was clever. Endgame is just silly. You could write a novel about all that is wrong with it, but let's mention the most glaring examples:
1. Time travel. Never use it as a plot device. It becomes dumb, and removes any sense of consequence. It is basically a reset button. And Endgame takes the price for amount of self contradictions when clumsily making use of it.
2. Thanos was an interesting character in IW; here he is just a cartoon villan.
3. Everything with Thor. Ragnarok identified him as a true god of thunder; the hammer was just to focus his powers. And now suddenly Steve Rogers can call lightning?
4. Political correctness. Cap's main motivation for several movies has been his old pal Bucky, but now at the end it's suddenly black wing guy who gets the final moments with him and takes over the shield? I guarantee that was NOT the original plan. There's lots of PC in the movie, but this is the most glaring example. Another grating example is the whole presence of Captain Marvel; over-powerful, and yet useless.
5. Humor. In IW it was clever. Here it is mostly reduced to fart jokes.
6. Don't just copy yourself, Russos. The soulstone sacrifice in IW was moving. Here I could not care less.
7. Thanos, again. In IW a handful of Avengers almost defeated him when he had the glove and most of the stones; they only failed because of the emotional stakes (again, clever). Thor bested him after he got the whole thing. And in Endgame the whole lot of them, including supergirl cannot get in a good punch when his only weapon is a big axe?

Author: jacobmitchell-95957
Review_Title: Everything I wanted it to be.
Review: As a grown man I am not ashamed to say that I think I had tears in my eyes more than not. Whether it was from sadness or pure joy. To not give any spoilers I will say that there is an entrance that Thor makes that for some reason made me cry and laugh at how amazing it felt to see. It was truly awe inspiring. When Thanos first appears on screen my heart skipped a beat as I realized that it is finally here. Though two guys behind me wouldn't shut up and I had to tell them to do so during the credits when they were the only ones talking. I at one point heard one of them crying while saying through the sobs "I love this movie so much." This movie experience made me feel connected, even to a person I would normally not care for, due to the commentary he and his friend provided before and after the movie, and the random laughs and comments throughout which were more than audible. I felt shear panic, sadness, and joy all at once the entire movie. I am a big movie lover, I comb IMDb constantly for trailers, trivia, and any news I can find. When everyone else opens Facebook, or Twitter every morning in the bathroom, I open IMDb. I am obsessed with movies and the experience of seeing one in theatres for the first time. I can truly say that this was the best movie experience of my life. It wasn't until a couple of days later that I realized that Avangers 4 HAS to top it. I cannot imagine. Any true Marvel fan or movie lover should love this movie!!!

Review:
This film tells us the story of the Avengers, to close a chapter.... It surprised me.... I loved it...
The Avengers shows us the unity of the team, despite the adversity they face...
The timeline of films, from Hulk, Iron Man, Captain America, Thor, Doctor Strange, Spider-Man, Ant-Man, Guardians of the Galaxy, Black Panther, Captain Marvel, Black Widow, and the other parallel films, led us to that last movie Avengers: Infinity War...
I'm waiting for the next Marvel movie to send us to another universe, again....
Soon Marvel will release the new movies....
I can't wait to watch the movie where RDJ returns as Iron Man.

Author: shaheenbuet
Review: Over the past decade, Marvel has earned itself the benefit of the doubt. The studio has consistently delivered smart, funny, brave films that both embrace and transcend their comic-book origins. The 18 blockbuster movies produced since Iron Man first blasted off into the stratosphere in 2008 have not only reinvented superhero films as a genre - they've helped to legitimise it. Indeed, Marvel's two most recent films - Thor: Ragnarok and Black Panther - have received the kind of accolades usually reserved for edgy arthouse flicks.

Author: kinggolub
Review:
A masterpiece 10/10, A ++ and Second time in the Cinema.
Writers break the narrative into several branches, which develop in parallel, so the lack of dynamics is not felt from the word in general. At the same time, four to six story arches can occur and in an unprepared spectator the head can naturally go around. All the meaningful scenes after the credits of the films released over the last ten years that moved the meta-story of Marvel, are suddenly gaining meaning and developing exactly as if everyone has already been aware of what is happening. This forms a rather high entry threshold, to which many viewers, especially those who do not follow kinomics, will simply not be ready. But even without preparation the film looks great. Yes - you will not be aware of 80% of the dialogues, but you will be provided with the most powerful spectacle. A separate pleasure from viewing is the interaction of previously unseen characters. Joint scenes and mutual skirmishes are set up carefully and thoroughly.

Author: memojo
Review_Title: BEST SUPERHERO MOVIE OF ALL TIME
Review: This movie is truly phenomenally astonishing. It will make you laugh, cry, break your heart and will it will keep you intense throughout the entire movie. The ending of the movie is very smart and is such a cliffhanger however, I do have faith in the Russo brothers in what their doing with the MCU. One of the biggest and best plot twists in any superhero movie takes place here in infinity war. It is when Thanos and Gamora go to a certain planet to get the soul stone and are greeted by what we think is death and the turn out to be the red skull. Later on in that scene Thanos sacrifices Gamora for the soul. This scene shows how ruthless he is and how he will stop at nothing to get what he wants. In the film we are shown a different type of Thanos the comics. We see Thanos as a ruthless mass murder who will stop at nothing, and we then feel sympathetic towards him in certain scenes. The ending of the film is truly confusing, I say this because Thanos gets all the infinity stones on the gauntlet and snaps his fingers. We then see and alternate reality where everything is destroyed. We then return to our reality, we then see every hero in the movie apart from Captain America, Iron man, Thor, Black widow, Hulk, war machine, rocket raccoon and okye (the original phase 1 avengers and other heroes) turn into ash and disappear (this does not mean their dead but, they have disappeared). We then see Thanos in most likely another planet sitting down without the infinity gauntlet with a smile on his face. A young Gamora then comes to confront him. She says to him "what did it cost" Thanos then reply's saying "everything" the film then cuts to black. The end credits scene shows Nick fury and Maria hill in a car. A car the crashes in front of them they then go to look at who's inside, it turns out that nobody was driving. Maria hill then turns into ash just before we see a helicopter crash to the ground. Nick fury takes out a retro looking device and says "this is code red" he turns on the device. Just while it's pending Nick fury turns into ash just before he finishes his sentence. After he disintegrated the device is finished pending and shows the captain marvel logo. This is meant to show that after her solo movie Captain marvel will return in avengers 4. The film then cuts to black and instead of showing "the avengers will return" as avengers movies usually show it says "Thanos will return". This is meant to show that Thanos will comeback and it will be a much bigger battle/movie than this one was. Overall this is a phenomenal movie and I strongly recommend everyone to go see it. It has truly been worth the 10 year wait.

Author: Steven2168
Review: Avengers: Infinity War is an unrelenting thrill ride of action-packed spectacle. Thanos is easily the best antagonist of the MCU, with genuine moral depth and intimidation (Ebony Maw is also a stand-out). Many characters shine brightly in this film, while others are wasted or used poorly (at least in the theatrical cut). The screenplay has a few problems with exposition, logic and a few tonal shifts. Alan Silvestri's score is incredible, the 2.5 hour running time felt shockingly quick to my pleasant surprise, and the ending is powerfully impactful. Avengers: Infinity War is nevertheless an overwhelming and ambitious blockbuster extravaganza that is the beginning of an even greater culmination for the MCU.

Author: LeoAlexson
Review: At the moment, marvel cinematic universe has 19 movies. Whether you like them or not, they create an important part of modern cinema. These movies bring a huge number of people to cinemas. Some of these movies are incredibly original and creative, some are not. But they all represent a pop culture of the twenty-first century. In the twentieth century, the Avengers were cowboys. An example of real space cowboys are the Guardians of the galaxy. Throughout almost the entire first film, each of the Guardians pursued only personal interests, just like cowboys do in most movies. Or the actions of Spider-Man I associate with Shane from the 1953 movie. Turning to the new film, I want to say that I like Marvel, like their characters, their ability to inspire children. But I also like a good movies and a few of the latest movies of the cinematic universe are disappointed me with a weak script and focusing on visual effects. Infinity War I liked much more. There are a lot of characters in this movie. A lot. Some of them reveal themselves on the new side, they surprise with their abilities. But there is one character, which is more interesting to watch than all the others, his name is Thanos. In each scene where Thanos is present, you can watch his motivation, his rage, his ability to love and kill. From the first minutes viewers are given to understand that this movie will be much darker than all the past, that this movie is not afraid to kill the heroes. Everything that happens in the movie reminds an incredibly expensive theatrical production. The heroes understand that they don't want to die and see the death of those who they love because of the genocide of Thanos. Thanos himself and his hunting for stones resemble Disney and how they buy more and more studios. In conclusion, I just want to quote the dialogue between Thanos and Gamora at the end of the movie.

Author: thegagechesteen
Review_Title: Ten years of storytelling culminates in one of the most satisfying conclusions in recent memory.
Review: First off, I want to state that I am a massive fan of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. I have watched and loved every movie in the franchise, with the exceptions of Thor: The Dark World and The Incredible Hulk. I still liked them, but I didn't love them as much as the others.

Author: chrismylo
Review:
I couldn't be more shocked by a movie. My heart was beating so fast from minute one until the last minute. My legs were shaking after leaving the theater.
It is a thrilling ride with ups and downs (mostly downs). Many people say that it is exhausting because there are too many characters and too many things going on, but you cannot criticize this movie from this factor only. This is the movies nature. It was meant to be like that, to exhaust you until the last minute. On the other hand, there were too many characters but each and every one of them is shown equally with an enormous dynamic for all of them. Also, the scenes that were running simultaneously were masterfully crafted to fit in the story so that everything can end up the way it ended. 
Yes, there were many deaths and many of those deaths made us cry and made us emotionally unstable. But this is the movie, a movie about the possible end of the world. 
Thanos is the best villain that Marvel ever created. He threw Killmonger out of the window. We've seen an extraordinary part of his character. He is not the bad villain that everyone was waiting for. We've seen his good side in many perspectives, his only love. But we've seen what he is capable to do to accomplish his mission.
At last what Avengers: Infinity War has that no other superhero movies has is that ending. Those 10 last minutes that will haunt you forever and you will never forget them. Things take an unexpected turn at those 10 last minutes that you are not only left speechless but you leave the theater with your mouth fully open from surprise and your legs shaking from disbelief. 
It's of course the first part of a two part movie because it leaves you with an enormous cliffhanger but let's not forget May 2019 is not too far away from now.
Thus, this movie is a must see for all the marvel moviegoers and fans but also for people that have some knowledge on the movies background story. The cast and crew of this movie deserve a big applause and an enormous bravo from the entire world. I cannot believe that I've lived to see this movie. I quote what common sense media said "This is the most intense, complex, and stirring Marvel Cinematic Universe film yet"

Author: afrench_inshanghai
Review:
That's a lot of action, but good action, never too boring.
I felt strange, unease about this movie, because unlike my expectations the story and some images remained in my memory long after having watched it.
That is a total different dimension compared to the 2 previous movies: I could not watch them completely stopping after 30 minutes. These 2 remains in the shallow waters, the deepest philosophy is about why Iron Man has lost his mask... 
I started to analyse why this third one is different, and basically this is simply because it bring me back in my youth, Moses, the story of prophets that have changed the face of the world, and ancient greek stories, and realised that the big picture of this movie is nothing different...
As the bible is not my preferred book, this film is deeply rooted in my feelings and despite it is not my preferred movie of all times, it is definitively a great one.

This movie is a must see for any and every comic book fan out there and is highly recommended to those who are casual fans and sci-fi/adventure and comedy fans.

Author: wwide-52028
Review: Well, actually, Marvel Cinematic Universe has been doing good since 2008, when they released Iron Man. And till then, this movie was the best of all! I think, this movie has created it's own level. It's too much hard to create such an hype, make this the talk of the time and then serve even better than those! The only thing that disappointed me is Thanos! I thought I will see him as powerful as the comics but he wasn't actually like that. But it's ok, that was necessary for the movie. In comics we see characters like Doom, Galactus, Sentry, Living Tribunal but in that movie they were not present to stand against Thanos! So it was needed to reduce his power so that our heroes can do something. But it wasn't actually a problem. We got the chance to see how wise he is even without the destructive powers. This is how you should create a villain character, who has a strong will and a good heart. DC should learn a lesson from this, they should know that people won't accept villains like horrible stephenwolf. They should create something like the Ledger's Joker or bring on Darkseid!

Author: j_man-78380
Review: Having dodged spoilers for the past few days, I finally saw Avengers: Infinity War today. Let me tell you, it BLEW ME AWAY! I've been a Marvel fanboy since I was a kid and this is one of those movies you see and then just play moments over and over again in your head. You may think with all those stars and heros in there that things can get a little messy and confusing and the Russo brothers sorted it all out perfectly. I'd say the real star would have to be Brolin as Thanos. The presence commanded by him in every scene he's in is amazing! The way you see this shadowy character unfold over 2 1/2+ hours is something I had yet to see in another Marvel film. There are surprises you don't see coming, the trailers did a great job at not giving anything away so be prepared to scoop your jaw off the floor when it ends. Definitely leading up to part 2 as there's A LOT left hanging when everything wraps up and that post credit scene rolls.

Author: mollyzanlean
Review: It is a very rare occasion feeling like you wish something must be done so the protagonists beat the antagonists in a film. When I watched this, I hoped the Avengers solve this huge and problematic villan they have to defeat. The one that will make them lose all hope just like I felt. And I put all this trust and hope in them. This feeling of imcompletecity and this desire the viewer gets is like nothing before. We seek to see the true heroes they are and how they can succeed in this seemingly impossible victory. Along with this, we have good characters, each with it's memorable and distinct personality, and they all go along well in the story. Accompanied with nice humor and with great action scenes that show unique powers and fights scenes that you even interrupt yourself while eating popcorn

Author: litghtningkitzne

Author: lucasburca
Review: When I was going into this movie, I was kinda scared that I would be a disapointing movie. I was SOOOOOO WRONG!!!!!!!! The 10 year build-up for this movie was entirely worth it. Every character got a shot on the spot ( well not really the Black Panther characters cause we saw them in their movie). And in this movie, everyone's a badass (especially Thor). And this movie was filmed entirely off of IMAX cameras and that gives a huge advantage to this movie over all the movies because this entire movie is huge. And the action. OMG the action. This is the best action i've seen in a superhero movie and it's so exciting, destructive, and intense. But the main reason why I love this movie so much is because of-none other than-Thanos. He's literally the Darth Vader of Marvel villains. He has so much cinematic depth put in his character that even though he was a evil guy you gave a damn about him throughout the movie. And he had the most screentime out of all the characters in IW. And this movie had lots of emotion put in Thanos' character too. Like when he had to kill Gamora to get the Soul Stone, when he was crying, you wanted to cry with him also. And his motivations to get the Infinty Gauntletmade a lot of sense. They were cruel but they made sense. And this movie leaves you on such a cliffhanger ending that you can't wait for the next Avengers movie to come out which everyone is talking about. And lastly, don't listen to the haters for this movie. They're either drunk, high, DC biased or people that hate superhero movies. Do me a favour, buy it on Blu-Ray in watch it.

Author: priester-60247
Review: With a snap and it becomes #1 movie in the mcu. Can't wait for the sequel

Author: tasnuvat97
Review_Title: Incredible Movie That Will Beat Your Expectations!
Review: Avengers: Infinity War does an incredible job of melding together many storylines and characters into a beautifully intertwined story that's not even hard to follow. It does everything previous MCU movies have done, but on a much grander scale. The villain Thanos is especially compelling and has really done justice to all the times he's been hinted at since Avengers Assemble. This movie has it all - sci-fi, drama, fantasy, comedy, and action, so I'm sure all audiences will like something about it. The acting was pretty good across the board but since everyone had limited screen time (even in such a long movie!), what really stood out to me was the amazing visuals, and of course, the very long story arch finally coming near an end. The ending is also exceptional, but I won't speak much about that. Overall, I can't wait for the next ensemble movie and can't recommend this one enough.

Author: hdriessen-49303
Review_Title: A great beginning to the end
Review: Avengers: Infinity War is in my opinion the best mavel movie to date. It is unlike any movie I have ever seen before. It hasn't got a basic 3 part storieline and it doesnt introduce any of the heroes. This movie focuses more on introducing and following the villain. You heard that right, Thanos is the lead character in this movie. It is more a Thanos movie than an Avengers movie, and that is what makes this movie as great as it is. It is not your standard superhero movie and definitly not your standard marvel movie. Finally marvel has a great villain. Also the humor is on point in this movie and the avengers are great as always. In my opinion thor is my favorite avenger in this movie and his character has the most development of all the avengers. I gave this movie a 10/10, but i have to honest and say that i am a bit of a mcu fanboy. I think that if you like marvel movies in general you won't be disapointed, but if you have never liked marvel movies than this movie won't change your mind and you should better go and see another movie. I recommend seeing the other marvel movies first before watching this one, because it can be confusing for poeple who don't know these characters.

Author: lpnm2359
Review:
This movie is marvel at its absolute best. It strikes a perfect balance between humor and tensions. The last moments in the movie left myself and the entire theatre absolutely speechless. I was in tears during many parts of this film.
Josh Brolin gives a fantastic and entrancing performance as Thanos. I found my attention consistently captured on Thanos in every scene he is in.
Chris Evans, Robert Downy Jr. and Chris Hemsworth gave phenomenal performances as well. The entire cast was at their best. However, Tom Holland was the one whose performance moved me the most to tears.
Overall, this movie is amazing. The pacing and story are balanced perfectly (as all things should be) and cast is inamitable. This movie is one for the history books.

Author: moviesfromfranfg
Review_Title: Great ending to a saga but average standalone
Review: The Russo Brothers pulled off a great finale to the Thanos saga but found the story a bit choppy at times. The final development of characters is far from cannon, but directors are allowed to do that and they do so audiences don't know what is happening next. A bit slow in parts but it forms part of the build up to the final showdown. It's going to be interesting to see what they do from here. IMDB need to give more rating options between 7 and 10.

Author: councilmanus
Review:
Read through some of the reviews and, as someone has previously stated, it's beyond comprehension (and human reasoning) to downvote this movie for the stupidest reasons (no more superhoeroes movies, no plot, everybody dying, too much violence, etc.).
This is IT, it's the most epic movie in the MCU. 
From Stan Lee's one-liner (brilliant guy, don't care what others say about him) to Thor's shocking self sacrifice, this has been nothing short of EPIC. 
For me, if I were to choose a particular moment in the movie that moved me, it would have to be the arrival of Thor on Wakanda (builing up after the heart-melting moment of self sacrifice to get that Stormbreaker, with much needed sacrifice from the grumpiest Twig ever).
All in all, an advice for people out there:
> If you have seen the MCU movies until now, this is the cherry on top - part1, ergo, a MUST SEE.
> If you haven't seen the MCU movies (or seen just few of them), be open-minded, and give it go.
And remember, 2019 will bring us Cherry on top - part 2 (with the highly anticipated appearance of Adam Warlock, Captain Marvel and ... the Soul Stone).
Will probably watch it again this weekend.

Review: After 10-years of story building and character development, this is what we get; a montage of most (if not all) of our favorite characters that needed no story build up to understand where they were taking us in the overall story. The only character needing any maintanence during the movie was Thanos himself and that's because the movie was about him. His arc was the final piece to the 10-year old puzzle and it fit perfectly. Action, comedy, thriller, suspense, with a hint of horror, heartbreak, and romance, this movie was everything I've been waiting for and I'm excited to finish the story next summer.

Author: ajturbo-ajit
Review_Title: Perfectly Balanced movie with a perfect mixture of comedy, emotions & action! Don't miss it!
Review: The Russo brothers have done it again. The movie was paced very well, with the directors giving us breathing room between action heavy scenes for emotional moments & character growth. The comedy was also on point. The to and fro between the characters were perfectly timed & executed. The only gripe i have with the movie is the absence of 2 key characters. I was initially worried that wakanda parts would be given too much screentime (as i am not a fan of the overrated plothole heavy black panther) thankfully the scenes in wakanda were few. The Space sequences involving Thor & the Guardians were very well done. And finally Thanos is the best marvel villain since Loki & Red skull, who also makes his long awaited return with a cameo. The ending was anticlimactic but in a strange way fulfilling too, With what has transpired, I'm hopeful that we'd not be visually & culturally tortured with a black panther sequel anytime soon. this movie has dethroned Winter Soldier & is now my 3rd most favorite superhero movie ever after The Dark Knight & Civil War. The best part why Avengers succeeded & justice league failed was because Marvel doesn't waste time with SJW nonsense in their movies. (Atleast not all of them). I give this 9/10 stars. Don't miss it!

Author: alliedrein
Review: Just returned from the cinemas after catching the all new "Avengers: Infinity War" flick! And my oh my this installment was quite intriguing, all personalities and events in the film intertwining seamlessly into one cosmic universe and it was indeed incredible to witness and behold. Thanos as a villain is monstrous and intimidating with menacing disposition amongst an eloquent hyperbolic parlance. I found the mumbo jumbo regarding the nature of the universe rather mystical and quasi-Buddhist with subtle quantum overtones reminiscent of Oxford colleague chatter. The action doesn't disappoint either, with karate warrior-like combat scenes and mesmerizing space expeditionary incursions. The pace of the movie is never boring with plenty of funny comedic lines and dialogue. The integrating of all the characters from differing Marvel universes brought an eclectic vibration of diversity akin to a kind of balancing act of hormonal chemistry within the egocentric network. And good lord are Scarlet Witch and Gamora hot as fsck must I say. The element of realism and CGI prowess doesn't disappoint either.. Worlds and civilizations apart envisioning want of utopian resplendence and splendor. And The Hulk and Iron Man are f-in hilarious as toast rofl, with even each single Marvel character exuding a very vibrant distinct persona and aura in impressions formed. I of course to superlative extreme had fond appreciation for the whimsical substance and way in which the plot intrigue involving the omnipotence granting infinity stones followed through towards all of my five senses! All-in-all this movie was very captivating and entertaining indeed!

Author: steve_redford
Review:
A truly disappointing cinema viewing. This was hyped to be the big movie of the year but was flawed in too many ways.
I've had some hours to think how it was a disappointment and thing these are the key ones for me.
The difference in humour and relism between GoTG and the earth characters became so obvious, it make much of the movie feel unreal.
It became obvious from an early stage that the time stone would be used and at some point lots of killed characters will come back in due course, this obvious plot line meant there was no feeling of meaning to the story.
The sheer number of characters running and punching on screen and a serious lack of meaningful dialogue made it hard to invest in the storyline or the interactions on screen. In fact thanos became the most likabile character during the movie as he had the best lines and most development
There were some random character decisions that seemed out of place, but clearly necessary to enable plot progression so shoe horned in unexessarily.

Author: oviya-inian
Review: The MCU has been heading to this movie from Iron man part 1. This movie has an overarching sense of doom and heartbreak right from it's first scene. But it still takes you along for a rollercoaster ride with fun and light-hearted moments. In my opinion Thanos is one of the most complex and well developed villains ever. You understand his motivations. You almost sympathise with him for the sacrifice of his daughter and what it cost him. Yet when you see half the universe turn to dust, you despise him. This movie is unlike any superhero movie out there. Melding every single character and setting into a seamlessly perfect movie that any superhero lover should watch. Even in absolute loss, there is hope. Can't wait for endgame!

Author: vladimirvillanuevanait
Review: To all the reviewers who are giving this a 1 star because "this has too much visual effects" and "not enough character development" This review is for you! Avengers Infinity War consists of a talking raccoon, a humanoid tree, a dude that turns green that weighs about 1000lbs of muscle, a mad Titan from a completely different planet a floating wizard. Some of the scenes occur on different planets, in space, and on a spaceship. So when you complain about this movie having too much visual effects, unfortunately you just failed to understand the movie itself. Now to address the complaints about the lack of character development, if you knew anything about character development, these characters developed from different movies, Captain America in Captain America: the first avenger, Ironman in the first Ironman movie, formation of Guardians of the Galaxy in their own movie, Dr. Strange from his own movie and all the sidekicks were all introduced on other Marvel movies so all these characters are well developed. Avengers Infinity War was never made to develop characters, it is the culmination of these characters to fight a super villain. So if you're gonna criticize this movie because it lacks character development and its nothing but visual effects, KID, you have no clue what you are talking about.

Author: DrMBT
Review:
Avengers - Infinity War-Marvel(lous) Movie -
My review
Firstly for Superheroes movies - there are minimum 2 kinds of audience
1. One who have read those comics and have high anticipation of the characters
2. One who have watched the movies but not the comics, yet have high expectation of the movie
And maybe a bit of both...
Regardless this movie was a Highly anticipated, Awaited, High expectation movie for the Super hero genre.
So how does it stand?
Do read on...
For the record I belong to the 1 type audience, I grew up reading the super hero comics- both of Marvel and Dc so I am aware of the power and the character of the heroes.
The review is strictly of Marvel - characters of this movie.
To begin== A kickass- Blockbuster movie
Like I always mention a Super hero is made a hero based on the villain and the tasks that they undertake and accomplish.
The villain has to be good and strong. 
Does the Villain - have that impact- a strong YES, an exceeding expectation characterization of 'Thanos' as the villain.
All the trailers have not let down the character of Thanos in the movie.
He is a Granddaddy of all super villains- thus far. Exceeding expectation of the villain role. He is impeccable and portrayed as a super villain to perfection. No flaw in his characterization. 
Perfect fit a Super villain? >> 
Does the movie have flaw/cons - Yes, but do they impact the outcome of the movie - No Sir, The flaws are at minimum to negligible - only if you strictly try to find them, will they feel so.

Author: andrewtomneilson
Review_Title: Infinity War The Most Intense Marvel Movie Yet
Review: Marvel's Infinity War is the most complex and intense movie of the Marvel Universe. This film with its numerous heros may seem pretty challenging to follow if you're not a hardcore Marvel fan. However, even though there were 19 movies before this one, Infinity War did a fantastic job of bringing all the movies together into a plot that even a first time Marvel movie watcher could understand and enjoy. As said before Infinity War, movie number 19 of this connected movie franchise, has brought all of their heros and movies together seamlessly into an all out war against one very powerful super villain named Thanos. It's very entertaining to see how the groups of heros interact with one another. Black Panther and Captain America gives the viewers someone to look up to and respect. Dr. Strange and Tony Stark's egotistical outlook on themselves really make a good comedic relief between the many intense fight scenes. The biggest comedic relief however comes from the Guardians of the Galaxy ranging from their old music classics, to their funky way of running their operations really gives the audience something to laugh about amongst the chaos, the chaos of course being Thanos. There is so much background to this villain's rise for power so I'll sum it all up for you. Thanos is on a quest to find 6 gems. Each gem, even though they look like something out of a bedazzling kit you got when you were eight, hold very powerful and specific powers that ultimately will let him kill off half of the universe's population. This is the biggest, baddest, and scariest villain yet, not just because his goal is to wipe out half of the universe's populace, but because he is convinced that he is the good guy. He believes that he is doing the universe a favor by making the hard decisions for it. By killing half of the universe, it makes room for more people to have resources and food to go around ultimately leading to the survival of millions of different species. Obviously the Avengers and all the other heros don't agree with this, and tirelessly try to keep the stones away from Thanos. I will not spoil the movie for you but the ending is much more grim than you would expect and leaves you with more questions than answers. That fact may leave some people metaphorically with a bad taste in their mouth, but we must remember that this is the Marvel universe and not everything is as it seems. So in the meantime appreciate the fact the Marvel's Infinity War has the biggest wow factor in the Marvel Universe so far.

Author: tron09
Review: For years, people have demanded a superhero flick where the good guys don't always get there way, something that goes against the norm. And this did, it really did. This is amazing in almost every single way, I didn't like how they kept switching from groups to groups because personally I was just becoming immersed and boom, it changes to another group. This film is everything I expected it to be if not more. The trailers made me feel underwhelmed, esp when we got our first proper look at the CGI Thanos, that's going to be used in this fil. Speaking of Thanos, he may be the best villan that the MCU has to offer for very good reason, he's not just your typical, oh I want to rule the world, he actually believes what he's doing is right and goes incredibly far to prove it. I highly recommend this film for anyone, try to watch the other MCU movies and go in spoiler free, for this film to be truly impacting. 9.8/10, would watch again :)

Author: daniel_middleton2001
Review_Title: Fits in with the other films, but doesn't exceed them.
Review: Just a quickie. This film does well to hold up the standard of MCU films up until this points. The Russo Brothers to well to emulate the different feel of each and every character from other films like the Guardians. Most of the characters were pretty useless all in all. Cap did next to nothing, and to think this was meant to be the last film on his contact. There was a ton of action which, at the end, felt like noise. It feels like they pushed to have every single hero here whilst most were unnecessary additions. My main gripe is the deaths: Spoilers for Ant Man 2 btw. I realise that half the population on earth is about 3.5 billion but I think killing off pretty much everyone apart from the original team and Rocket was a bit overkill and convenient. All the Guardians are dead as well and the entire Ant Man team apart from Scott becuase the snap doesn't affect the quantum realm. Even Fury and Hill are gone. It's essentially just a big set up for Avengers 4, which is what annoys me. This film was hyped up for ages and as a fan of comic books and comic book movies in general I was really bloody excited but then it ended up being a huge set up with no real consequences. It's 100% obvious that anyone that turned to dust will be back. Holland is already filming Spiderman Far From Home, all the Guardians are filming Vol. 3, this was pretty much confirmed when Bautista threatened to quit over the Gunn controversy. Jackson and Smulders are filming Far From Home. It was annoying to say the least they these deaths were bigged up when they're all fake. Disney does not like to take risks. Loki dying is a grey area because I don't believe they would kill their most profitable villain and he's died before. Vision I believe is pretty much dead. Gamora is back for Guardians 3 so I'm unsure about her. We're all fairly certain that time travel will be involved in the next Avengers as well and one theory is that Shuri figures out a way to destroy the Infinity gems (yes I say gems because that's what they should be called) because she basically figured it out in IW, they go back in time and destroy all the stones before Thanos can get them which basically means Vision won't be coming back unless some sort of time paradox happens. Either way, the rate of the ones left alive is up in the air ironically. Basically, this film surfs on action and emotion but since the emotion is, for want of a better word, short-lived when you realise nothing sad actually happened, it basically works on action which echoes that of previous films. The emotion was high, despite as short as I felt it, especially Spiderman, but, in my honest opinion, I am going to wait until Avengers 4 to give see if this was a good or bad set up and if this was worth it. I hope it is.

Author: pdubs98
Review_Title: The most entertaining movie I've ever seen!
Review: Now based on the title card. I'm not saying this is the best movie I've ever seen nor am I saying that this is my favorite movie. However, from beginning to end I was hooked and impressively entertained with all of the scenes in this movie. Avengers: Infinity War will have you laughing, crying, and filled with rage. Combining all of these elements into a very emotional film. All of the payment from the last 10 years of Marvel movies is definitely worth it in this movie. The performances are great, each character serves a purpose to the story, and it probably has some of the funniest lines out of any Marvel movie apart from Thor: Ragnarok. The plot doesn't have a lot of depth and seems very simple. But if you've seen all the previous movies leading up to this one you won't even care. Please do not watch this movie if you are being introduced for the first time to the MCU. You will be confused and not care about the characters. Go watch all the MCU movies before seeing this one. This movie was one heck of an experience and I know I will be seeing plenty more of it in the future! WAKANDA FOREVER!!!

Author: crashrider-06443
Review_Title: The Russo Bros are the kings of comic book movie genre! A hat trick!
Review: Alright so I'm going to try my best to keep this as a NON-SPOILER REVIEW, as there are many shocking plot twists and surprises and I wouldn't want to ruin that experience for you. Wow! What a ride! This film was everything I wanted it to be! Exciting, thrilling, and beautifully crafted over the course of 10 years and 19 films. Yes, I have waited for this ever since the inception of the MCU back in 2008, but more importantly as someone who read Jim Starlin's Infinity Gauntlet series 17 years ago. It was breathtaking and jaw dropping to see something of this scope come to life on the big screen from the very same comics I read as a child. @therussobrothers did an amazing job balancing the tone of all the characters (comedic and serious tones) and giving every character their spotlight without making it feel too overcrowded or bloated. The action itself in some of the scenes were taken directly from the pages of Hickman's 'Infinity' run couple of years ago which made me really happy to see. Although there were a lot of surprises in the film, the one element that surprised me the most was the amount of emotional weight that the film carried, it really helped develop certain character arcs especially Thanos, and man oh man when Thanos comes on screen, he really steals it! Not only is he frightening and intimidating, but he has a very grounded and philosophical twist to his character that makes you sympathize for him and his surprisingly emotional motivations. Action was great and easy to follow with no shaky cams this time (yaaaaay!), but the overall story and execution was better than Civil War and Winter Soldier (which everyone knows I love to death). In the end this was everything I hoped and wanted to see in an Infinity War film and I really can't wait for Avengers 4 next year! Whatever you do, see this film before someone spoils it for you as there are many idiots going and spoiling it for others who haven't had the time to see it on opening day! Make sure you experience it in IMAX if you have one next to you, the screen is much bigger and visuals look more vibrant and sharp! Oh and there is one post credit scene so stick around after the credits for a treat!

Author: ed-184-531859
Review: One of the best, if not, the best MCU film to date. I wanted to see as much of thanos as possible and get to know this character more and they delivered 10 times over. The visuals and conceptual art in this film is utterly incredible. Weta of course.

It has a great mix of humour to make this movie not too dark, but a perfect amount which DC may be lacking. And once the movie is over, you will walk out of the cinema wondering "what did I just watch..." this is truly is a masterpiece that will be remembered for years to come, nothing can top this.
