Author: s-92573
Review:
I'd been looking forward for the Infinity War before I went to see it. Sadly, it was on a fortnight later than other countries in China. So I went to see it in the first run. All the trailers and interview by the cast and director indicated the new Avengers movie would be a blockbuster, as well as heartbreaking. I was spoiled that Loki will die very soon in the beginning of the movie and I was very very sad . 
I watched the movie 5 times in all. The first time, I watched the movie with my friend and I was totally shocked by the begining scene. The dark light, horrible voice, blood and fire, broken tesseract, defeated Thor ,all showed Thanos's enormous capability. I'm big fan of Thor and Loki, I just can't believe one of my beloved characters died painfully within 10 minuets and Thor was exploded into the space, unknowing what will happen to him.
Infinity war is grand. We can see almost all the superheroes from the former 18 movies, which is incredible. Thanos is absolutely the toughest vallain ever and his goal is to wipe out half of the universe randomly. I don't judge his purpose is right or wrong, but I don't like him. What broke my heart most is that heroes faught and they still lost. Everyone lost too much, including Thanos. The avengers are real avengers in the end.

Author: mfennessey-00886
Review_Title: Everything up to the snap was incredible!!!
Review: When I saw this movie I was having an emotional rollercoaster. Thanks was intimidating and just an overall excellent villain. When he got the mind stone I was like oh my god it's over. When Thor stabbed Thanos with the axe I thought it was over, but then he snapped and I was like holly crap. After the snap everything got really stupid like why did they all disappear and where did hey go. And when you just see Thanos and it ends I was so mad.

Author: cnarek
Review_Title: Mainly a DC fan here but all in all The Best Marvel Film yet!
Review: One of the best Marvel (Avenger) movies ever... The graphics, acting, visuals, story line and overall action was mesmerizing! Would I recommend this movie to anyone of course without a doubt! I really enjoyed seeing all the superhero's together especially The Guardians of the Galaxy, Black Panther, and Doctor Strange! Author: eriboq
Review:
Epic.
Emotional.
Two and half hours of total excitement and when credits hit the screen, I was there hoping that second part of the movie were about to start.
So sad I have to wait one more year for that.
It was very dark with more of a serious tone. Darker than Winter Soldier which I love.
The villain is finally here. The villain par excellence, Josh Brolin portrays the best villain in the MCU.
In the beginning I hated Thanos. By the end of the movie I even felt sorry for him for a few seconds. They made him scary and strong at the same time vulnerable and understandable.
For the most part, Infinity War does justice to the many heroes who have been assembled for the film.
And there are a few standouts amongst all heroes. RDJ and Cumberbatch most of all.

Author: danpoe
Review: I don't know how a superhero sci-fi action film can be any more entertaining than this. It was such a well-paced, well-scripted film which was filled to the brim with excitement and had just a dash of humor. The story never once seemed too big for the directors to convey or the characters to portray considering the end of the universe was at stake. Credit the Russo brothers for their vision and the cast for an incredible delivery. Marvel set the bar so extremely high here that its hard to expect anything more than disappointment when Part 2 rolls out in 2019. Maybe I'm wrong. Hopefully I'm wrong. Because I sure can't wait to conclude this epic tale of triumph and destruction come next year. Once again Marvel, your hold on the cinematic universe has just become stronger than Thanos's grip inside the Infinity Gauntlet.

Review: I enjoyed this movie way more then I expected. I am not a marvel fan, but damn, this was good. Somewhere in the middle the story got a little boring. The characters were pretty great, and the humor was good. The plot is intriguing.

Author: markrc-36914
Review_Title: Just a short way off of being epic or a masterpiece but lives up to all expectations
Review: First of all before my review of the film, I think we all need to say a huge thanks to Marvel Studios/Kevin Feige for the last 10 years of hugely entertaining films that they have gave to the whole world, if your a fan or not, what Marvel Studios has achieved will likely never be replicated or done again by any other film studio and you have to congratulate them on their huge success, so thank you Marvel Studios and Kevin Feige for releasing in my view, the most fun, most entertaining movies anyone will ever watch in their entire lives. I personally think Marvel Studios could bring out a movie about a garden fence or a broom and it would still be a box office hit and be the most entertaining thing you'll ever watch. Marvel Studios and Kevin Feige simply have a Midas touch, everything they do literally does turn to gold, albeit box-office gold, long may they dominate and be as successful as possible.

I dare to say, without a doubt, that this is the greatest superhero movie of all times. 2019 and Part II can't come soon enough. All that's left now is wait for the denouement and introduction of new characters, and new stories that come along with them.

All the cast members were incredible especially Brolin himself. His take on the mad titan is so daunting yet so relatable. (Not the best father figure) but you can see the time and effort which has gone into the character. Also he is an absolute beast!!! (Like Barney the dinosaur on roids) the storyline is captivating and for such a massive ensemble of all star actors, the film delivers and keeps the viewer interested and does not feel to overpowering and overcrowded at any time. Overall it's a good movie, definitely better than Age of Ultron. Just wish there was more dialogue with some of the teams, and more explaination with the Red Skull and Vormir, kind of seemed a little out of nowhere....
One more year

Author: megsaha
Review_Title: Exceeds Expectations and Delivers on the hype
Review: Over these 10 years, apart from a few exceptions Marvel Studios has delivered film after film that have been beyond amazing with lovable characters and some smart writing . When I look back on the kind of comic book movies we got in childhood then this film would seem completely impossible . Yet the Russo brothers pulled off the best they could , nobody other studio has ever tried something like this. A lot of people have complained about character development but the thing is we've already had 19 films that focused on our heroes' character arcs. The only character we didn't know anything about is Thanos so the movie mostly focused on him . An argument can be made that such popcorn flicks are for every casual viewer out there and you can't expect everyone to watch 10 years of movies , but that would basically be similar to being excited about Season 8 of Game of Thrones without having seen the first 7 of them . MCU does follow a serial format when it comes to crossovers and this can be considered the first half of the series finale.

Author: mrwwe-95402
Review: Avengers infinity war (IW) is, easily Marvel's gutsiest film and definitely its best. Absolutely no doubt about that. The core is pretty simple: Thanos wants the six infinity stones and the broken avengers must stop him before he vanquishes half of humanity. But the key is in the screenplay and direction. What seems impossible on paper is put together almost flawlessly by the Russo brothers.

Author: by-17413
Review: This was a movie that the dishonored wolf said it was a good film. Infinity war is a masterpiece of the marvel series. it was a unexpected unique film I've seen in a while. i know there are a lot of those marvel fan 5 year old screaming and giving the movie a 1/10 yelling "spidey died!!! bad movie!!!". this was the first avengers or even marvel movie for the protagonists heroes to lose. while there are also debates happening online that the protagonist is Thanos. this was one of the few movie that we could understand the antagonists objective, at least for me and many other people. The fight scene was very forgettable until i saw the film twice which is just unfortunate. the films action scene was on spot. its almost the definition of awesome. at the last fight scene, i thought for sure that thor would kill Thanos and vision would only die because, well, this is a marvel movie. but nope! every one just evaporated which was mind blowing and heart breaking. especially spider mans death was super sad. his dialogue expressing him desperately not wanting to die shows him that hes still young and even heroes risking their lives are still afraid of death. because i didnt see the comics of marvel, i dont know the future of marvel, i think this film was a fascinating way to finish the marvel series.

Review_Title: A movie well worth the 10 year wait.
Review: This film, by a universal account, is the best Marvel film I have ever seen. To start off, I am a fair critic of film, and I cannot say that I have full enjoyed each Marvel film, however this one does not fall in that category. The promotional aspect of this movie falls very short in how amazing Avengers Infinity War actually is. The performances were stellar, the action was an achievement, cinematography will blow your mind, and you will be shocked over and over again. You will laugh, your will cry, you will truly enjoy this amazing film. Thanos is given a dynamic the likes of which I have never seen in that character, and I was completely glad to see how they were able to bring him to life on the big screen.

Author: vishwas_r_
Review_Title: The most ambitious crossover in history of filmmaking indeed
Review: Everything was almost perfect. The cast, the villain, the fight sequences, it all happened like a dream. The humour was good too. The ending was not only touching but also kept me craving for the second part of the movie.

Author: pavanbhartt
Review: This movie will leave you floored. Marvel means business now. This movie brings together all of your favourite superheroes and weaves them into a desperate and complex narrative which surprisingly doesn't feel strained. The Russo brothers have done it again, they made a film that brings together all of these icons yet still tells a complete, well-defined story. This film has great humour but is mainly a darker film. The situation is tense and there is a strong feeling of hopelessness. Thanos is a very strong, compelling, almost sympathetic yet ruthless villlain unlike any the Avengers have faced before. Bring your tissues people because this movie pulls no punches. The film takes all sorts of risks and there are moments that are truly heartbreaking. YOU NEED TO EXPERIENCE THIS AS SOON AS HUMANLY POSSIBLE! Fantastic movie that surprised me after 18 Marvel movies of the same.

a really must see

Author: mcdanielp-78228
Review: As a big Marvel fan, this satisfied everything I could ever want out of an action movie. Josh Brolin did an incredible job playing Thanos and he became my favorite Marvel villain. I loved that we got to see all of the characters come together to fight Thanos in Marvels most epic battle yet. The jokes are funny, the actions sequences are intense and the characters all have their moments where they shine. The ending will leave you wanting more and very impatient to get it. Not only is it Marvel's best, but probably one of the best movies I've ever seen period.

Author: surajitphukan
Review: It's his story that drives the whole plot. He is the main characters of this movie, not any of the heroes. Thanos in my opinion is the greatest villain the MCU has ever produced. As a character he is truly threatening. In most of these movies deep down I know the hero will always win. For the first time I wasn't sure if the hero would win or not. Through the movie's entirety I was on the edge of my seat wandering whether my favourite characters would actually make it out of the movie alive. To have a villain with that level of genuine threat I thought was fantastic. I also felt slightly conflicted by his motivations.

Author: gjek-06360
Review_Title: What a amazing movie!! Marvel surprised me again!!!
Review:
Prepared for 10 years, infinity war was definitely the best movie of Marvel series ever. 
First of all, let's talk about the characters. Iron man, Tony showed his responsibility to save the world, after the civil war. That meant he didn't stick to the rules but followed his will to save lives. Captain American still fought for his justice, so do other heroes, such as black widow, black panther, and scarlet witch. Thor felt sad, angry, and helpless, but he still stood out and fight for the people. In addition, even though Star lord looked easy about the destruction, he knew that he had nothing to lose; that's why he was angry about Thanos when he heard about Gamora's death. Most important of all, the villian, Thanos, also had lots of stories. We knew that he had a dream, that the balance of the universe could persist. Consequently, he searched infinity gems with all his heart. There were so many other characters that could not be analyzed thoroughly in my review. However, that meant the movie was successful about building characters. 
Second, this movie gave us a strong emotion, despair. At the begin of this movie, it showed us how much powerful Thanos was. Until the end fo the movie, we still couldn't figure out any solution to defeat him. That stressful plot made audience to gave more concentration. Additionally, some funny parts really spiced up this movie and made this movie not so sad. 
Third, the action scenes were designed so great that I couldn't take my eyes off the movie. Take some examples, such as Dr. Stranger's fight, the invasion of Thanos's army, and the fight against Thanos. 
There were a lot advantages that I couldn't mention in this review. However, there were still some defects of this movie. Take an example. Thanos's love to Gamora was not so obvious, that I couldn't feel sad for Thanos.
Overall, this was the best Marvel movie ever.

Author: TonyFranco64
Review_Title: The most ambitious film project has arrived
Review: The most anticipated crossover presents us the search for the infinity stones by one of the best villains in the cinema in general ... Thanos the "crazy titan" that had been shown to us from the post-credit scene of The Avengers in 2012, after a Great cameo in Guardians of the galaxy in 2014 and for the last time in the post credit scene of Avengers age of Ultron. The film focuses on showing us why Thanos wants to opt for all the infinity strones since he believes that with them he could bring balance to the universe by annihilating half of it, and thus save it from itself, because of the overpopulation and lack of resources in the universe . The movie is full of epicity, insertity, and is full of surprises, the whole ensemble of characters is perfectly balanced. All the characters retain their personality, and shine one by one, the teams are fantastic. The action is unexpected, from the first minute of the pecula there are completely epic ballas and with good choreography, the tension is felt throughout the film being sanded with classic MCU humor no joke feels forced, they are necessary to release tension. The end of the movie is something so unexpected and surprising, without a doubt it is the best movie of superheroes in history, and it becomes more than that since it has a plot that is totally well realized and a villain who is totally well written that ends up being the protagonist of this epic infinity war that leaves us thinking seriously about the future of our heroes and the MCU.

Author: CALSR-IMDb
Review:
"Amazing","best MCU film ever","so good". These are just some quotes from people who saw this summer blockbuster before me. Don't get me wrong, it was amazing and a visual spectacle at that, but was it just me or was it just too much?
Firstly, it's a film you need super human bladder control for, as the mammoth 150 minute feature is so quick paced you will be lost even if you miss even 5 seconds of it, tirelessly trying to keep up with the characters whereabouts. As Thanos causes destruction everywhere he steps foot, it brings all of our favourite heroes together. Special mention to Thanos by the way, easily one of my favourite characters. His primal need for the stones is engrossing and you almost want him to succeed in retracting all of them just to see what madness will happen next. Visually it does live up to the hype, I saw the film in 2D and sort of regret that decision as I was completely blown away.
As for the story line I loved it. However, the sheer amount of avengers/guardians of the galaxy stars crammed in, it felt that there was never enough time to get involved with anyone's story before I was thrown into someone else's.
This installment did not mess about with instant anquish for characters and fans from minute one and showed no signs of slowing down.
One word I would use to describe this film would be futuristic and that's probably my only grumble.

Author: losermcgee
Review_Title: Good film, not as good as recent Marvel films
Review: Let's start this review by saying Infinity War is a good movie. The problem is it's just not a great movie. It feels like all the Marvel movies lately have been at that great level, and in the case of Black Panther, in that rare spot above great. Yes, there is a definite dip in quality in this movie, but it feels like a much greater dip due to how amazing the studio has been lately. As for why this movie wasn't as good as the rest, well my main problem is that it ends up feeling a bit overstuffed. There are way too many characters to keep track of, and you end up losing track of them. It ends up feeling like you're waiting for your favorite character to show up, and every second they are off screen, you are not as interested in the film. Also, I feel the end does have a major problem. Not what happens and the decisions that were made but the fact that it is simply unsatisfying. This is the movie we've waited for 2 years to see, the movie with all of these actors, all this hype. Not to mention, we have to wait another year for the next movie, with the way this film ends, one can't help feeling it could have delivered a slightly more complete-feeling film. However, there is still a lot of good stuff in this movie. For one, the as-promised dark-drama theme of this movie is ever-present and makes the movie feel like no other Marvel film. You probably are skeptical this kind of genre would work for a Marvel film, but as soon as you hear the voiceover in the opening credits, you know that despite whatever you feel about your Marvel films, the Russo Brothers have done a damn good job making a dark one. Also a lot of the characters hold a lot of value. The best by a clear mile in my opinion is Thor. He has come from being the goofy, hard-to-take-serious hero to being the hardened, hell-bent god that he is made out to be. Thor, in this movie, is one of the most badass superheroes ever, if not the most. Also, Thanos, despite being the villain is a clear highlight of this film. First we had Killmonger, now Thanos, it seems the MCU villain effect is wearing off. Josh Brolin gives an excellent CGI performance kin to Andy Serkis' Caesar or Gollum, not to mention the character development for him is incredible. An especially high point is his relationship with Gamora, which is beyond what we could have hoped. It is extremely emotionally strong. Those two are the definite highlights in term of characters, but there are plenty other great characters. Doctor Strange has several mystical-action scenes, some better than what we saw in his title film. Teen Groot surprisingly has a strong character arc. The only character I disliked was Star-Lord who not only makes out-of-character decisions but feels like he is either mad or confused the entire movie and fails to show much else. His character arc also feels pointless as it fails to resolve any conflicts with the character. All in all, Infinity War delivers a strong sequel, it just has a few flaws, which is not something I can say for the previous 6 MCU films.

Author: tonyvg-98399
Review_Title: Where will you be when it all ends? Probably in the theater watching this movie.
Review: Juggling a wide array of characters from 18 different movies, across a 10 year span, Avengers: Infintiy War delivers on all cilindars. Marvel has once again taken a seemingly impossible task, and proved they can handle anything thrown their way. Each character gets their chance to shine during the runtime, and although there can be clashing tones, the movie never loses its audience. For a common movie fan who hasn't followed the marvel movies, you may be lost. The movie contains no character development, and it doesn't have to, as we've been developing these characters for 10 years. It's fun to see characters you known thrown into situations and forced to interact. This movie is a great time, and any fan of the marvel movie will be happy with it. I don't anyone needs a recommendation, as you already know if you will be seeing it.

Author: rocconanut
Review_Title: Epic and unforgettable, a genre mastepiece and a milestone
Review:
Russo's brothers warned us that would have been an unforgettable movie, but neither in my best dreams i could expect something like that. The characters are perfectly managed, lots subplots that risked of weight down add something new, and their characterization gives me goosebumps beacuse of his consistency. See the characters we love interact between them is as funny as serious, because of Thanos's imminent threat, wich here is simply monstrous. One of Marvel's biggest problems has always been the villain, often too flat and stereotypical, Thanos instead it's all the opposite and He gives us a memorable villain, with which you empathize and that behind the Motion Capture hides a heart and a soul. From a technical point of view the film reaches roofs never topped, with breathtaking visual effects and a fast and frenetic direction, which in the fightins gives the best of itself. While not having a dark stile, the film proposes mature and tragic's themes, answering a lots of questions but leaving us with many questions marks wich will presumably be unveiled in the next chapter. My only issue is in my opinion the hurry with which the final battle was managed, although this defect is blown away by the end. Russo's brothers have been able to do what 10 years ago(release of the first Marvel movie) seemed impossible and they did it dosing everything perfectly, everyone has his role to play within the story. Nobody is indispensable, but everyone is necessary to face a threath wich concerns them closely and that risks to undermine everything they care about. Humour is not exaggerated, but on the contrary, it contrasts very well with the dark's themes, and Guardians of the Galaxy fit perfectly. Like it or not, Avengers Infinity War is destined to enter in the history of cinema, for social and economic importance, it's the culmination, the apotheosis of 10 years of hard work, and It won't be Pulp Fiction or Citizen Kane but is a genre mastepiece. On conclusion Avengers Infinity War is destined to become iconic, it's epic, unforgettable, exciting and courageous and despite some little defects it's going to be one of the best entertaining movie ever made, if not the best.
Score: 94%

Author: souzachristopher
Review: Rian Johnson, Shane Black, Warner Brothers, take notes! In a day and age where films such as Iron Man 3, Justice League and Star Wars: The Last Jedi subvert audience expectations to infuriating results, Avengers: Infinity War does it in a way that actually works. Returning behind the camera for IW are The Russo Brothers who previously helmed the last two Captain America films for Disney/Marvel from a screenplay written by Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely who also wrote all three films in the Captain America trilogy and who were writers for the first two Chronicles of Narnia films. The plot follows the Mad Titan Thanos (played by Josh Brolin) in his attempt to find all six Infinity Stones and bring balance to the universe. Though the Avengers have split up months after the Accords situation, they must sacrifice all in an attempt to stop Thanos by teaming up with allies, old and new. At first, it might look like too much to Cram all of these 50+ characters (yes, even the Stan Lee cameo) into one movie, but in all fairness, it's all been building up to this since the first Iron Man movie. And I'm pleased to say that it definitely lives up to expectations and like I said before, subvert those expectations in a way that doesn't alienate audiences. Whereas Iron Man 3's idea of subverting expectations is doing a live-action rehash of The Incredibles while at the same wasting the acting talents of Sir Ben Kingsley, Infinity War's version of it is a Marvel sequel influenced by films like Wrath of Khan, Empire Strikes Back, Aliens and even Apocalypse Now while telling a different story at the same time. Whereas The Last Jedi's idea of subverting expectations is a pointless side quest to Casino Royale, Infinity War's version is a side quest to meet a giant Peter Dinklage (YESSS!!) who actually does something that moves the plot. And whereas Justice League's idea of subverting expectations is 2 hours of Superman's CG Homer Simpson mouth and PS3 quality graphics topped off with a forgettable score from the always talented Danny Elfman, Infinity War's version is two and a half hours of amazing visual effects and impressive CGI work on Thanos and to top it all off,a beautiful orchestral score by Academy Award nominated composer Alan Silvestri who composed the scores to Captain America: The First Avenger and The Avengers (2012) and whose known for his collaborators with Robert Zemeckis (Back to the Future trilogy, Roger Rabbit, Forrest Gump & Contact) and Stephen Sommers (Mummy Returns & Van Helsing) and who also worked on films such as Predator 1 & 2, The Abyss & Ready Player One. But obviously the highlight of the film is obviously Josh Brolin as Thanos in what might be his best preformence in all of his career (tied with No Country For Old Men). The moment he is on screen from the cold open to the very end before the credits roll, I was impressed with Brolin's preformence, even considering the fact that Thanos is a character that could only be created through VFX,I felt like I was watching a preformence instead of another generic CGI baddie and I really sympathized with his motivations.And he's definitely the best villain the MCU has introduced thus far. All in all, it might be the most divisive film of the Marvel Cinematic Universe and the most divisive film of 2018, but it did live up to my own expectations and therefore it instantly became my favorite film of the MCU and my favorite film of 2018 overnight. I was completely silent by the film's final moments when I saw it in theaters on my first viewing and I'm still impressed with the film after multiple viewings. Also, stick around for the credits! 4/4 Stars (A+)

Author: yougotknifed
Review_Title: Too long like every Marvel movie
Review: The first half was almost a masterpiece but later on, it started to drag and the second half was like every other Marvel movie with a not very exciting showdown. I wish they'd keep their movies at 1h 45mins max and scale back the boss battle or do something new because the formula is starting to bore me. That being said, I found the telekinetic bad guy at the beginning more intimidating and interesting than Thanos. I had the time of my life the first half, the second half was good and even though the ending was different, it's painfully obvious that it doesn't matter. Shame they had to kill off Quill, Spiderman etc because they already announced another Guardians and Spiderman movie. If Marvel wants their movies to have conequences or intrigue they should stop announcing sequels before other movies those characters appear in. Really, really stupid. And the way Loki died was also unearned. Still, probably the best Marvel movie for me.

Author: thakkar-35984
Review_Title: Avengers: Infinity War was a fantastic movie
Review:
The movie, Avengers: Infinity War, is one of the greatest Marvel movies ever made.
The movie consisted of tons of action, perspective changes and plot twists. The movie also had a lot of Marvel superheroes. Secondly, there was 10 years and 18 movies building up to this movie. Lastly, Infinity Wars made a grand total of 2.048 billion dollars. I think we can all agree that a movie with plot twists and a lot of action can be extremely good. These additions can not only make the movie more enjoyable, but they also help contribute to the amount of movie it makes. Let's look at the 2.048 billion dollars Infinity Wars made.Movies are filled with different elements. Plot twists, perspective changes, action, they all contribute to making the movie a great film.Infinity Wars consists of all these attributes, and more. Also, a movie that has had 18 other Marvel movies building up to it, it's bound to be good. Lastly, a movie that has made over 2 BILLION dollars is undeniably worth watching.

Author: uicrob-93105
Review_Title: The Build Up We've Been Waiting For!!!
Review: After the first time I watched Infinity Wars, I left feeling much like everyone else, mind blown at what I just seen. "What just happened", I told myself. The good guys lose, evil won. With such a huge cast of lead characters, it's expected that screen time would be limited, but the Russo brothers managed to create a story that utilizes the full potential of each character move the story in a way that don't clutter the screen. Thor is on a mission to forge a new weapon that could slay the Mad Titan, Iron Man, Strange and Spidey team up with the Guardians to fight Thanos on Titan, while Cap and crew try to protect Wakanda and The Vison against Thanos' army. So long story short, Thanos recovers all infinity stones and with the snap of a finger, half of all life in the universe cease to exist. And yes I know this isn't the end of the story, but for such a massive filming event to end on such a somber note, was something else. The second time I watched the film, I seen it in a different light. Although Thanos is a villain to everyone watching, he is very much the centre of the movie. He is in fact the protagonist of the film. I mean, watch the movie from his point of view. Yes he is a genocidal maniac, but to him, his mission is just. This is not a film about The Avengers fighting Thanos and losing, this is a story about Thanos and what he thinks is protecting the future of the universe, and succeeding. The Avengers are just road blocks set up to keep Thanos from carrying out his plan. I've seen many videos of people saying that Thanos is the hero of the Infinity Wars. And although I disagree with Thanos being a hero, to Thanos, he is the hero. But, isn't anyone who wins a war considered a hero to the people fighting that cause. Finally, I want to talk about the character of Thanos in general. Not ever has the MCU experienced such a layered complexed character. Many villains in the MCU can be classified as one dimensional who's only goal is world domination and revenge. Than Thanos emerges from the shadows and gives the MCU exactly what it needs, a complex character who shows emotion. One thing I can say about Thanos is that, he don't seem to do all this for glory or to "rule the universe", he simply believes that what he is doing to benefiting the future of all life. Josh Brolins performance gives Thanos so many layers, and should be mentioned in the same conversations as Andy Serkis.

Author: kunamaharana
Review: There are six Infinity Stones, the film explains, Some are spread across the universe, but half of them are on Earth, where they've play The film can't spread around its camera time in equal measure, but it does give all the characters an equal shot at despair. A decade of films have led up to Thanos, and Avengers: Infinity War delivers on that threat with a film that upends the entire fabric of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. No character is safe from the far-reaching implications of his actions, and it's impressive to see just how dark Marvel is willing to go for this story. Even the biggest fan favorites are truly vulnerable, and the movie reinforces that idea - relentlessly, at times - as it sprints toward its final stunning moments. By the time the credits roll, audiences will no doubt be aghast at just how far the Avengers have fallen.ed significant roles in past MCU movies. Thanos is trying to collect all of them,This is a comic book universe, after all, and the fact that Infinity War is able to embrace this darkness in the first place is a wonder. The only real crime is that audiences will have to wait until 2019 to see the conclusion

Author: aliaarockatansky
Review_Title: The superheroes' movie that will make history.
Review:
There is a dilemma of not being able to say much after you watch this movie when you follow the directors' request of keeping the hype free of spoilers. Also, I would hate to spoil it for fans as much as I might have killed who do it to me. It also happens that I cannot contain my reaction so here what you should know. So this is a review about nothing.
First, let me tell you the other possible tag lines that describe this movie the best:
1. The Greatest Superheroes' movie of All time.
2. NO MATTER HOW MUCH YOU THINK YOU'RE PREPARED, WELL, YOU ARE NOT AND YOU CAN NEVER BE.
Second, let's talk about the movie itself. Avengers might be in the title but you will certainly feel it's like the ones before. It is like four whole movies merged into a big one. First you will visit the worlds you know, and then those worlds will come together and get divided into whole new worlds, which will again get together in the most unexpected way. You will find yourself switch from one world to another the way you switch channels, feeling confused before you remember this is infinity War and that it's supposed to happen. It's not the way this movie summed up a whole universe of 18 movies before it that it's considered genius, it's how you find yourself get transitioned from one world to another, how to get from one point to a very far way one so simply and naturally only to leave you not feeling anything but stunned. 
Third, what to expect?
Well, there is actually no point cause no matter how you watched and rewatched every single work marvel had produced, you will still be left thunderstruck. You will laugh, cry, sometimes both at the same time. You will be hit by surprise that you find nothing to do except to stare at the screen with wide eyes and a jaw dropped to the floor. You will be scared, shocked and lot of the times will catch yourself sitting on the edge of your seat, literally, raising your hand to your mouth in the most unexpected moments. The most important thing though that all of this will be in a good way. 
Request: Please go watch it. Whether you are a Marvel fan or not , whether you are a superheroes' movies fan or not. You might regret that you didn't experience it in the time when it's still fresh and no one had spoiled it for you, but what's even more important, is that you will find whatever you wish for in it. If not, watch it to witness an example of how passion and dedication take works of art to excellence.

Author: jordan_ottenbacher
Review: If you're a fan of the previous movies, this film will definitely make you laugh one moment and cry the next. The movie starts an incredibly fast past, largely because the tension has already been built up in the after credits of the previous films (Thano's 2-3 cameos). The star of this film is definitely Josh Brolin, as he displays unique emotional depth as the nihilistic villian Thanos. I don't think I've seen another movie that packs quite so much into the time frame given I wouldn't have cut or added anything. After the film was over, everyone in the theater said something similar to "I need to go sit down and think about what just happened." This is likely due to the emotional shifts, the constant struggle of the characters, and the sense of unending dread the movie makes you feel. I gave this movie 10 stars, because there really isn't any valid criticism to give. This was an incredibly hard movie to pull off and my hat goes off to the guys at Marvel and the directors for being able to do so. I'm excited for Part 2 and the next Phase of the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Author: masterpops
Review_Title: If you ever liked a superhero movie, you'll love this (no spoilers)
Review: Infinity War contends to be the best movie of the superhero genre ever made. The sheer feat of juggling such a massive cinematic universe and having he pieces land in place is something I would have thought impossible, yet having missed 4 of the 18 movies preceding it (missing Ragnarok was the biggest gap going in) the entire film still flowed incredibly smoothly. I am and know some real hardcore comicbook enthusiasts, and so will there will always be some squandered potential, plot elements that did not fire on all cylinders, or characters we want to see more of, but there are strikingly few missteps to pick out given the scope of this film's ambitions. The incredible number of characters, plot lines and events that fit in here rarely seems ponderous, helped by a script that is laugh-at-loud funny without sacrificing the impact of the third act.

Author: davyn-70767
Review_Title: Why are there so many negative reviews?
Review: I can't imagine that so many people would hate this one. Avengers: Infinity War is dark, emotional, and entertaining. THIS IS NOT A COMEDY!!!! Sure, there were some jokes, but that doesn't make it a comedy! The first iron man had jokes, but it wasn't a comedy either. It is obviously the biggest and the best marvel cinematic universe movie. Why can't anyone else see it that way? And about Thanos, I myself am a reader of his stories in the comics, Disney had nothing to do with him, marvel had to make him a more complex villain. There's no way Disney would allow thanos to be a one dimensional CGI villain like steppenwolf from the DC universe, they wanted to humanize Thanos to be a more sympathetic and honorable character, he makes hard choices like we do, he makes sacrifices like we do. I have Infinity War twice in different cinemas, the more you rewatch it the more you appreciate Thanos, I know that I should've written a review last month a few days after watching it but like people say better late than never. Before you call this review 'unhelpful' I just want you to know, the Russo brothers did an excellent job in making such a great film like this, don't trust those reviews that say this film is for kids, it's not, it's for teenagers, young adults, and adults. And don't be such a critic to the ending hopefully those people who disintegrated after the snap will be brought back to life, because they still have some upcoming movies of their own. My rating 9.3/10

Author: stanchilds-115-99344
Review:
SO for so many characters to be assembled in a movie, I thought it was well done without feeling too over packed. The plot developed at an appropriate pace and there was still character development.
I was a bit dissapointed that The Gaurdians of the Galaxy so readily split apart(it just doesn't go with the family message of their last film).
I was extremely dissapointed that Marvel has eliminated Captain America. Never was his super hero name mentioned in the film. No more red, white and blue; he now wears black. No more stars on the chest or shield. He now introduces himself as "Steve Rogers". And every reference is to "Cap" or "Captain" at best. Shame to see the iconic hero being changed for the sake of international ticket sales.

Review_Title: AMAZING ONE OF THE BEST FILMS EVER

Author: zoebrouwer
Review_Title: It broke my heart, and showed me why I love Marvel.
Review: This movie held no punches. It immediately started taking away characters fans have admired for a very long time. But this is what the Marvel Cinematic Universe has been building up to for 10 years. They have blessed fans with unique characters played by remarkable actors, and this story would tell the world that good things don't last forever. At least that's what I expected. The movie took me but surprise when they took away characters we have just started to love. The movie slowly built up to the final battles between good and evil. That is when I expected them to put an end to the original line-up, but they didn't. They knew exactly what the audience was going to expect, so they gave us the opposite. This movie made me sad, angry, and happy. I laughed, and cried. The movie was full of reunions, and introductions between characters. And Thanos is by far one of the most complex villains I've ever seen in a Marvel movie. Even if the ending was the opposite of my expectations, the movie reminded me why I spend my money on these movies. Why I anxiously wait for the next movie to come out. They know how to make their fans feel every single emotion, and in the end, that is truly what good movies do.

Author: MattJStevenson
Review: Incredible.If Avengers was the first successful comic book team-up movie, then Infinity War is the first successful live-action comic book event. This movie achieves exactly what it set out to do, and with so many characters in play, it is an absolute miracle it is not a complete mess. When taken as a stand-alone movie, it probably doesn't deserve this score and the same is true if you aren't fully invested, but as an MCU fan, I really can't give it any less. I don't think there has been another movie quite like it.

Author: ninjaben911
Review: For literally a decade I've been frustrated by the inconsistency and plotless attempts of the MCU movies, but specifically the two Avengers films. There have certainly been huge hits for me (Dr. Strange, Iron Man 1, Guardians of the Galaxy 1) and some major misses (Thor:Ragnarok, Guardians of the Galaxy 2, Iron Man 2 and 3). But I've never liked the first two installments of the Avengers films. However, this time they finally got it right. Infinity War is everything every avengers movie set out to be and everything the first two didn't have. A compelling plot, character development, real dialogue (With none of the forced humor that ruined GotG 2, Ragnarok and Black Panther thank God). And an actual compelling ending that legitimately makes me unable to contain my excitement for the next one! Something no Avengers film has done this far. Well done, well done, well done.

Author: carlhenrik-kristoffersen
Review: That's all I can say. This movie could have gone so incredibly wrong with all it's potential to fulfill, but it goes so incredibly right. The shifts in tonal voice and feel, the balance between the superheroes and their abilities, the choreography of the fight scenes, the smooth dialogues, the humor, the emotions - it could not have been done better. I'm baffled by how they were able to pull this off. The only thing that could have lifted the experience for me was if Ebony Maw (black order) was voiced by Bill Nighy - but that's just sugar coating the cherry on top.

Author: jamesalexanderavila
Review_Title: If you don't understand Marvel your not a fan!
Review:
I was greatly anticipating this film and it did not disappoint. Of course we all see the MCU big and grand which it is and then some. 
 You literally have to be a Marvel fan to understand the story line and had to have watched all the movies to get to this point. As a movie goer you have to invest the time to fully critique it. 
 The characters I have come to enjoy and I feel the majority of all top billed actors embody the superhero or villain persona and play it well. 
 You can also read the comics to get an idea of where the director will possibly go next in part 2. 
 From comic book to the big screen Disney has achieved what most studios wish they can do in the super hero arena and be extremely successful at it. Kuddos to them and I'm delighted Marvel is in such good hands. 
 Lastly, I read some reviews on here which I carefully dissected and I've come to the conclusion they did not read comics or just not Marvel fans. I recommend reading before critiquing.
 Just admit it was a great film and if you were asked to take part in the next film as an extra or actor you'd raise your hand immediately. That's all!

Review_Title: MCU teach us how to put ALL (almost) their heroes in a Movie, the RIGHT way

It's impossible to talk about this movie without spoiling something, so I just say GO watch this movie, it's fun, it's action, it's drama... it's MCU on it's highest values. Thanos is amazing, all Marvel's fan will get some easter eggs, the movie is AMAZING and it's clearly showing the world how you can build a full Universe of Movies connected, put them ALL together and get HYPE going on with GREAT quality and ideas. DC, shame on you... Marvel did it again, and probably, will keep on doing it.
It's amazing how Kevin took such a risky move and showed us how you can make something work when you LOVE what you are doing, and work hard.
Thanks to all the directors, actors and everyone that dedicated time to build up this movie, I pretty sure that ALL the ppl that saw the film that day on the cinema, got 2:30 hours of JOY that will not forget for a VERY long time. We were childs again, adults and happy at the same time. And I'm pretty confident to say, that the same will happen to many many more ppl in the following days, weeks and months.

I watch comedy, indie, horror, action, drama, romance etc. I have never left a movie feeling like I did at infinity war. It was a roller coaster ride from beginning to end. It had the best storyline, best action sequences, the ending was unbelievably sad even though we know it probobly won't end the way they showed as it is basically a 2 part movie and most of hero's have other movies coming out. Author: parker-36293
Review_Title: It's the Mad Titan's universe, and we are all just paying rent.
Review:
A towering achievement in modern day blockbuster storytelling, Infinity War hits hard right out of the gate, and continues to pummel you with spectacle beyond compare throughout its nearly three hour run time. 
While it's thrilling to see so many amazing characters meeting, and sharing the screen, make no mistake, this is very much a film about Thanos. Brolin's performance as the Mad Titan shines throughout the film. He is both bombastic and nuanced. Terrifying, and fallible. Thanos is now by far the MCU's most fantastic and interesting villain. 
Weaving together so many characters and storylines could easily have gone horribly wrong, but the Russo brothers navigate it seamlessly as they take us through the story, and from planet to planet at an almost break neck speed. It's no surprise that it's thrilling and hilarious to see Tony Stark interact with Doctor Strange, or Thor banter with Star Lord. Every character gets their moment and their chance to shine a bit(Spiderman and Doctor Strange were both standouts for me personally)even if that's all they get. Because the film never really slows down, you shouldn't expect a lot of character growth, or deep narrative arcs for any of our heroes. We've had eighteen films for that, and this is about seeing them all play and interact in this world together. This is an event film after all, and can really only be judged in the context of the MCU's entirety. There's no denying that Infinity War's greatest weakness is its assumption that you are very invested in these characters and storylines. So when I sit back to judge its quality as a film, I do so as a fan of the franchise and as someone who has seen all the films many times. Basically what I'm saying is there is no way for this film to really stand alone. If you haven't seen or didn't like most of the other MCU films, you will be very confused right from the start. 
In the end, this film absolutely belongs to Thanos, and we are all the better for it.

Author: brasilluciano
Review: I still preferred The Dark Knight better than this movie but this is the second greatest comic book movie ever. It had everything I wanted and then some more. I love that during this movie I couldn't take my eyes off the screen. Every single shot was not wasted and everything moved the plot along. The main character was Thanos and we actually had a villain with character instead of a big bad brute who just wanted to kill for the hell of it, there was purpose behind it, at least in his mind. There were many moments where I was laughing, then 2 minutes later I was sad. So many highs and lows throughout the movie. The acting was great all around besides Bruce Banner. The ending was so great because no body expected it and it just leaves us wanting more from these movies. I cannot WAIT to see what they're going to do next year. Absolutely phenomenal.

Author: whirlwindk
Review_Title: Good vs Evil... and Evil won (!!??)
Review:
What the hell? When we grow up, we been taught that: Good always wins over evil, Kindness always wins... Good will always prevail... Be good to others.. Always be kind... Pray for those who need it... and blah, blah blah.
This movie is really f* up (pardon my French), Thanos is a homicidal/genocidal maniac and yet the movie tried to depict him as some kind of hero or god on a mission. Hulk is just like a sad clown trying to be funny but so pathetic, I guess because the idiot director from Thor Ragnarok made him that way therefore the 2 idiots directed this movie carry on the same path.
Like one of the reviewers commented, we go see superheroes to feel good, seeking escapism. We wish to have someone like Ironman, Spiderman, Captain America to right the wrongs, to seek justice for all, to protect the weaks and so on which doesn't exist in real life. And my 11 year old son adore them all (all the Marvel heroes), and I made a BIG mistake by taking him to see this sorry-ass movie, and it brokes his heart. It not nice at all to see all your idols get their ass kicked left and right throughout the movie then get killed at the end. Then... hang around waiting for the credit to end to watch some last segment of the movie indicate and left the movie theatre with some vague hope that "part 2" (which won't be out until next year) that something will happen to justify all this heart-breaking nonsense.
He is so sad that he told me today to give away all his bluray collection of Ironman, Captain America, Guardians of the Galaxy. That would tell you something huh? I will not pay to see the next instalment of this crap and that a promise.

Author: PedroFilipeVasconcelos
Review_Title: The Culmination of The MCU is an Amazing Experience
Review:
After starting with the first Iron Man 10 years ago and teasing for the first time the big underlying villain that would be Thanos 6 years ago in the first Avengers movie, we have finally arrived to what it all was building up for, and it was well worth the wait.
The Movie has an incredible story told in a incredibly paced format, all the characters seem important and are able to shine in their due time, not only that but the comedy was just right and the team ups and fight scenes in the movie are the best I have ever seen. Thanos is without a doubt the best villain we've seen in this universe so far, not only for the long foreshadow but also because of his motivations that are perfectly explained and in a way which every viewer can, in a way, understand why he believes he has to do his mission. Beyond that, the relationships between characters are explored and developed in a brilliant way, which makes the movie feel more alive combined with the perfect editing that makes the two and a half our movie fly by. I must also mention that not only the CGI was amazingly done and detailed but the whole movie had stunning visuals that showed us the amazing universe that was created for this experience.
At last, the story ended with an unexpected and wholesome bang, that made me not only tear but also feel complete. I loved every bit of this movie and I certainly recommend it to everyone, but i do recommend you to watch the prior movies in order to feel the correct attachment to the characters and to understand how well thought out the MCU was.

Author: harryincanderson
Review_Title: More interesting than most superhero movies, but still has problems
Review:
Let me start off by saying I thought the movie was good over all. The plot was more complex than that of most Marvel films, the intersections of the Avengers storyline with Black Panther, Doctor Strange, and Guardians of the Galaxy being well-done.
The movie had the obligatory Marvel comic relief, but also left plenty of room for tragic moments. The ending was not at all what I expected and is a nice departure from everything-is-undone-in-the-last-20-minutes that many superhero movies feature. The dialogue was witty and for the most part well-written, and the special effects were unbelievably good.
My only complaint with this movie is with the pacing. I realize it is supposed to be the big battle Thor Ragnarok (as well as Age of Ultron and Blcak Panther had been leading up to) but the back-to-back action sequences sometimes left me thinking the movie had too little plot spread across too great a time span.
I nonetheless enjoyed it and would recommend it to anyone remotely into Marvel.

Author: alanaji
Review:
Avengers: Infinity War, directed by Anthony and Joe Russo( who gave us the terrific Civil War and The Winter Soldier), is what we can term as a satisfying summer spectacle. This is not a film. It's an event. In a film with more than 20 superheroes, not once does one feel that any one of them are underutilized. 
The plot, as you all know , is about the conquest by Thanos (who is a computer generated character and given a terrific performance by Josh Brolin), to conquer all the 6 infinity stones and to wipe out half the universe. It's all up to the Avengers along with the Guardians of the Galaxy to stop his evil plans. 
That's all I can tell u about the plot. Because revealing too much will kill the experience. The director(s) have packed in all they can - marvelous action set pieces, humour, twists and dramatic moments etc....
Almost all the department have done their jobs neatly. Be it the stunning VFX or the exhilarating background score , the film has it all.
The climax, I would like to mention, is not at all what you would expect, especially since this is a Marvel movie. Also the character deaths too will come across as a shock. 
Now coming to the performances, the list is going to be too long if I mention each and every actor. Everyone has done their roles perfectly and not once do you feel that a single character is given prominence. Hats off for the director(s) for undertaking a project of this magnificence. 
So all in all this an experience or should I say THIS IS the Marvel movie we all waited for. So go in and have a Blast.
My rating- 4.5/5
Note: Do not miss the END CREDITS...

Author: fla-31186
Review_Title: You stupid Little one star assholes
Review:
This is not the end. This is Infinity war the culmination of ALMOST everything that has happened in the marvel cinematic universe until NOW. This is just round one of a bigger fight. Would you like to see how Thanos gets to search, assemble, use and lose a weapon of massive destruction in one movie, a movie which fans have been waiting for years to finally watch it?
 What do you think this is, Justice League and it's lame "DCEU"? Just one movie to end something that they put ten years of effort to make? 
Marvel invented the cinematic universe, nobody thought it was a good idea and they surprised the WORLD with what they have become. 
I'm not gonna lie, the movie had its flaws, but look how many others have tried.
DC and Warner tried to make the same, but in five movies they are already crumbling apart.
Universal studios and it's "monsterverse" failed at the FIRST movie.
Star Wars has tried but it is going down while trying to make a tenth movie.
But Marvel knows how to make it right. They managed to make 18 movies connected in this great event. Of course there were some flaws, but the did it, and they did it awesomely.
This is not the end, why did you thought that they called this movie "Avengers Infinity War PART ONE" before.
Everybody but the fans thought this was the end, but this is just the beginning of the end of a twenty chapters story. Why did you thought there were so many kills? To make people return to see what happens next? NO! They did it because they knew that there were too many characters, and people were going to be mad at them for the short screen time. The end of this story will be in Avengers 4, but the saga will continue with 20 MORE CHAPTERS with a new story to tell. 
Say goodbye to the infinity stones. After this it's going to be some OTHER villain with some OTHER plan; just like in the comics, that it's what Marvel Studios plans.

Author: cmw-81128
Review_Title: Exceeded all of my expectations. And my expectations were extremely high. Wow.
Review: I have been a major fan of the MCU since it's beginning, starting with the first Hulk move that was made. My love only increasing with the first Iron Man. If you are as big of a fan as I am, this movie should be a top priority. I can't even begin to describe the utter beauty of this movie. I was crying, laughing, crying, getting chills, laughing again, crying again, and so on. Marvel has outdone themselves with the CGI and effects in this movie, as everything looks incredibly real. You see emotions, the tiniest movements, and incredibly realistic wounds in the faces of some CGI characters. They are just so real. Don't let other reviews fool you when they say the plot of this movie sucks. I felt it was incredibly well-driven, even though this feels like 2-3 movies put together. But who wouldn't want to see multiple movies flowing together into one? Isn't that why we all love the MCU so much? The characters were amazing (as always). The Black Order was incredible, as each of them could have been standalone villains in their own movies. Thanos was just the best villain I have seen in any movie in a long time. I empathized with him, hated him, and had that moment where I was like, "You know? He's kind of right. But he's still a jerk." Just, all I have to say is Marvel truly outdid themselves. The ending is just...wow. They could not have carried that out any better than they did. Perfection. I found nothing wrong with this move. (Well, maybe just one thing: Where did Wanda's accent go??)

Author: kenlai-35989
Review: The Avengers super-mash-up has out-done itself once again: more heroes, fiercer baddies, grander scope, and greater peril. It's almost too much and yet not enough in other ways, because the screen time for many characters get spread so thin. Assuming you have seen most of the MCU movies up to this point, you'll appreciate that a handful of the characters previously under-developed have gotten more attention, but many of the favorites who were previously better-developed got barely enough time to be a cue for a crowd cheer. For some of them, it felt like the actors/actresses couldn't even get into character or understand the context of the scene -- one may posit that the secrecy over the whole plot had a negative impact on their performances.

Author: daz-14498
Review: Just see it, go now! One star reviews for this Film are completely ridiculous! This is the culmination of 10 years of Marvel films, everything's gradually been building towards the Infinity stones story line. Don't watch only this film and then complain there is no plot! The best parts of the film are the character interactions, it's genuinely hilarious, although overall the film is pretty dark in tone. It's no real spoiler to say that major characters do die. The standouts for me were Thor and the Guardians, so much great banter. The same can be said for Stark, Strange and Spider-Man. Most characters get enough screen time and the action is relentless, jumping from one action set piece (or World) to another without feeling too much. You will experience just about every emotion watching this film. The scenes in Wakanda was also a stand out, especially the battle! Make no mistake though, this is definitely part one of a two part film. It's going to be a very long year to find out how this story ends in Avengers 4.

Author: yangankonki
Review_Title: Worth every penny and bring tissues
Review:
I have been a fan of the Marvel movies since the beginning, but I was a fan of Marvel long before that. Through the comic books and the cartoon series, I have grown to love this world and the characters that inhabit it, and the MCU movies truly brought them to life, they allowed them to be in the real world. This instalment of their adventures was showing all their hens coming to roost - there were jokes of course, but it was deadly serious from the very beginning. Every character knew the stakes were high and by the end of it, the silence by which the characters expired thickened this seriousness. I was brought to the verge of tears, holding them back only because I was in public, because for all intents and purposes my friends are dead. 
This is a brilliant film and merges all the light-heartedness that the MCU is known for with the true grit and realism of the Netflix shows, despite the aliens and flashy lights.
Thanos is given a much more grounded reason for his tirade and this makes him one of the more menacing and powerful villains ever seen. 
I truly cannot wait for the next film in the MCU and the next Avengers film.
Well done to you all for this.

Author: terrytipper
Review: Though this is very much an Avengers movie, it feels like it could easily belomg to Thanos'. I always watched Marvel Movies in the same childlike glee I once had at a younger age, excited for the action and comedy but never really overly afraid or anxious of the outcome. More often than not, super hero movies end the way you expect them to, not much trepidation is required, and with Marvel's formula of mirroring what makes a villain I just couldn't ever feel the edge of my seat. This movie however, blew all that out the water. Not not only did they manage to create a monster I can sympathise with and at times agree with, they conjured up the perfect anti-hero. This is the film where Marvel put on it's big boy pants and, as a self proclaimed DC lover, it beats every super hero movie out there. In one word, shocking. Just...shocking.

Author: giordyd-06882
Review: Avenger: Infinity War is a great film and I think that the directors have mastered the ability to create films that draw in the audience and places you in the characters shoes for 180 minutes. The film is funny but serious and engages the audience, Thanos is by far the greatest MCU villain and in my opinion the greatest comic book movie villain (period). Can we talk about RED SKULL, he was the last person I would expect to see in this movie and also the last person I would expect to be guarding the soul stone. Thor and his new hammer (or axe), storm breaker has to be the highlight of the film...but he should have gone for the head. Loki's death seemed almost meaningless, almost like it was just an excuse to show that there not to scared to kill off characters...within the first five minutes. Gamoras death has a lot more meaning as it leaves Thanos emotionally damaged through the course of the film. Overall the ending was disappointing and left much to be desired, but I guess we will have to wait a year for the currently unnamed Avengers 4. The post credits were just a huge slap in the face (like Spider-Man homecoming), but the end credit scene has me excited for what is to come in the future of the MCU, and Captain Marvel.

Author: lilydang016
Review:
I have to admit, before seeing this movie, I didn't take time to re-watch all of the previous MCU films. I still enjoyed Infinity War very much! The action scenes are breath-taking, the character development is fantastic, and the ending is emotional-it broke my heart. After seeing Infinity War, I re-watched all 20+ MCU movies in the following days, and you know what, I was really amazed by how this story was prepared since day 1, and carried out so well. All movies and post-credit scenes combined made so much sense for the plot of Infinity War. 
The best character, which I wasn't expecting, was Thanos. He was not some villain who just want to control or destroy the world. Thanos character was built with deep emotion, and a real good reason for his action.
I am not good with words, so I cannot express how much I enjoy this film. I really recommend anyone who is going to watch this, re-watch the 20+ MCU movies first. Check on Youtube for how to watch MCU movies in the correct timeline order, don't watch them based on their year of release.

Author: premlesnar
Review:

Author: johnjsk
Review:
10 years in making....and a grand finale. A flood of emotions hits u as the characters reveal their distinct persona.....The ego clash between doc and stark.....The newly recruited Spidey who doesn't wanna disappoint..... Hulk with his 'issues'....Star lord's jealousy towards Thor.....The love between Wanda and vision....And most importantly the heart within the Titan.... Everything makes your butt stick to the seat even when the movie gets over.....You might need some tissues for the climax.
The grandeur of the fight sequence and the way it is filmed just blows our brains out....A solid villain with a solid intentions who almost convinces us that he is doing the right thing. The visuals are extraordinary and flawless making it a visual treat....
A part of the final portion is a bit 'surreal' but overall a celebration with a mixture of emotions delivered on correct propotions for this summer.

Author: sswanson-34937
Review_Title: For all of you "plot-hole" people out there
Review: This movie is about as well-done as I can imagine it being which is the main reason why I give it a 10-star rating. It is EXACTLY what I expected out of this two decades-long movie in the making: it featured all of the MCU characters that it could handle (and possibly a few more than advisable), amazing CGI and fight scenes, and a great setup for a fantastic finale to the infinity war story line that has been led up to for 31 movies so far.

Author: bbeyke
Review: This is saying a lot considering I'd hyped it up all the week prior by rewatching the last 18 Marvel movies, and I was still shell shocked. This movie took my expectations and obliterated them, it's a nigh perfect culmination of subplots and characters like I never would've expected, and the ending... truly gripped me. If you haven't seen the prior MCU movies I would not recommend watching this one yet simply because you'd have very little time for character development with each character; there's a reason for the 18 movies prior. However, if you're a Marvel fan, or even someone that's just caught up on the MCU movies and not necessarily a die hard fan, you can safely go in with high expectations, as the unprecedented ending and plot will leave you shaken with surprise.

Author: jeremycarin
Review_Title: Genuinly incredible they pulled this off
Review: I think everyone had extremely high hopes for this movie, but the realist in me expected it to be a literally impossible feat to coordinate this amount of characters in a cohesive story. I know the result is not perfect and a lot of critics complained about pacing issues, but I genuinely believe that they did the best possible job of juggling all these characters. Even movies like civil war which the Russos pulled off incredibly well pale in comparison to the pure amount of material needed in these 2.5 hours, and it's just an absolute thrill to watch everything together come so well. Of course, everyone's talking about the ending and thanos being great, which I obviously agree with, but I think it's important to remember how impossible of a feat this movie truly was, and I can barely wait for next year's conclusion to this epic story.

Author: Rishi_Prakash_Sharma
Review: With a brilliantly structured plot, some of the best acting in the MCU, and a good number of truly powerful emotional moments, it's not hard to see why Avengers: Infinity War is Marvel's best film. It has a great story, great acting, and awesome looking. If you aren't a Marvel fan or haven't watched most of the previous MCU movies this however, won't be something for you. The great thing about Infinity War's action-driven storytelling and the fact that the heroes are just delaying an inevitable tragedy with no hope of stopping it is that the whole movie feels like a third act, it felt like the climax of the entire MCU.

Author: kvsaivineeth95
Review_Title: Infinity War is a non-stop adrenalin gush throughout its entirety
Review:
The movie delivers overwhelmingly and worthy for every buck spent.
A triumphant blockbuster from the MCU sure to break(ing) and set(ting) new trends & records. It is packed with an intense and intricate narrative that wastes no time building its momentum and connects all the 18 movie threads coherently while solving minor plotholes of each film, suffered individually so far.
Particularly applaudable and respected is the writing to embed such a huge lot of characters by Christopher Markus & Stephen McFeely and the gripping direction by the Russo brothers in creating this massive behemoth. The blissfully orchestrated music by Alan Silvestri is what keeps you hooked unconsciously.
Marvel has finally learnt to justify their villains through Thanos and his villainous motives. The CGI and VFX unlike previous marvel movies have all been taken to a whole new level. Such high order ingenuity and planning in film-making is rarely observed in hollywood movies these days. 
Turn your heads down and you will regret missing an alluring moment. The makers left no stone unturned. 
Sadly the fate of few characters and the waiting required to watch the untitled Avengers film next year is unfortunate because of the shocking surprises. Hope Ant-Man and the Wasp & Captain Marvel give us a peek into what's coming next. 10 Years of creative efforts ultimately paid off from MCU & Kevin Fiege. James Cameron feels there is an avengers fatigue incoming, and it has been appropriately answered through this one that MCU will never take you there.
It is one super-hero movie that has to win many awards in the next year oscars!

Author: weintrjb
Review_Title: I made an account just to review this movie.
Review:
I've been going to marvel movies since the first Spider-Man movie hit back in the early 2000s. I've seen so much change and disappointment throughout the years. Over the past 10 years however I have been a die hard fan of the majority of the marvel movies that have come out. 
With that being said this is absolutely 100% my favorite. You've probably read articles and reviews that have described how the audience was unable to control their reactions to certain scenes in this movie. From my experience that holds true. 
You've probably also read that the movie is so overwhelming that many people are going to have to see it more than once. That also is true. 
What completely blew my mind about this movie is the way it was able to throw the fanbase off in speculation only to show them that they were wrong almost completely 
Every character (aside from 1-2) that dies was predicted to live. While all the characters that people were sure were doomed Were the last ones standing. 
This along with one mindblowingly shocking of a former villain that wasn't advertised at all were the best parts of the movie. 
I liked this movie too much to give it anything less than a 10 but 2 things I didn't like were the cliffhanger and the post credit scene. At least we know that there's sequels for a lot of the characters that died and on top of that at least there's only a year gap between this one and the second part.

Author: nejesnejes
Review_Title: The most fun of experiences you can have in a cinema.
Review: First of the expectations for this movie were one of the highest ever, some would say a bit unrealistic and a tad overhyped with all the trailers and promotions, Now after watching it I can honestly say that all my expectations were met, I probably got even more than I asked for, The characters were perfectly implemented with none of them feeling left out, everyone had their moment or two as they were in my opinion perfectly juggled trough out the whole movie, The acting was on point, the action was everywhere from minute one with only slight pauses that would let you catch your breath along with the perfect amount of humor before all hell breaks loose again. Now I don't think the movie was absolutely perfect, there are a few mistakes that I would like to point out, first one would be Ebony Maw freezing in space instantly after getting ejected into it, as we know it would take hours for a person to freeze in space because the only way to lose heat up there is to radiate it away witch takes hours, the second thing i didn't like was about Thanos, even though he was really consistent trough the whole movie it would often be pointed out that if you give him what he wants he will spare at least half the lives he comes across, with the exception of the dwarves, he only left one dwarf alive while telling him rather mean things to make him feel even worse, I think that was a mistake and it made him feel slightly inconsistent. But to be honest those things are hard to notice during the movie and it still earns a 10/10 for the experience and the amount of fun I had watching this movie.

Author: joepermaul
Review: Going in to this film I was already a massive fan of the movies that had come before it. I had been introduced to characters I knew such as Captain America and Iron Man, characters I've never heard of like The Guardians of the Galaxy and reimagined characters in this cinematic universe such as Spider-Man. Though a couple of these films may have had flaws (Iron Man 2 for example) they have all been building up to this movie and my God have they pulled it off and more. This film is fantastic and easily one of the best if not best superhero movies released. I have been asked how it compares to Christopher Nolans 'The Dark Knight' and they are two different beasts. One is a superb crime drama with super hero elements and the other every comic book fans dream of a superhero mashup! From the first minute to the last your eyes are hooked, there is not one dull moment as it each fantastic action scene is filled between with tense moments. Each actor plays their roles to a level where you can't see anyone else being these characters. When Spider-Man appeared on screen I became I 10 year old kid again watching the cartoons, you are just swallowed by the film and when they film ended silence fell in my cinema except for a few gasps from the crowd, me personally I had no words for what I had just seen. I laughed at the funny moments, on edge of my seat at the dramatic ones and teared up when the film decided to go on an all out attack on my feels (one moment in particular killed me). All I know is when the film ends I said to a friend that the next film will make more than this one based on the fact you NEED to see the next film. One thing I did say is DC have the Joker Marvel have Thanos. I was absolutely blown away by the villain in this film and put him up there as one of the great movie villain in recent cinematic history, this film is more his movie than the avengers and I was impressed with how complex they made his character.

Marvel fans especially will be ecstatic about this film and speculation over what will happen in A4 will take over the internet. This movie is exciting, funny, and, at the end, devastating. One day, people are going to be telling their kids about the first time they saw the snap and how they reacted.

Author: flilley
Review_Title: It's a great movie but nothing's perfect of course!
Review: Alright so obviously this culmination event film is full of awesome action, hillarious comedy, and some heavy feels :'( and it would be crazy to say it isn't a good movie or even potentially a great movie. That being said there are problems one of which id like to focus on. The power scaling is so crazy throughout the whole movie, when Thanos fights hulk 1v1 with only the power stone(it does give it's bearer increased strength and durability) and bests him easily I was shocked. Later in the movie Drax and Spider-Man holding Thanos is enough to subdue him albeit with some help from the others too but physically paralleled strength seems weird compared to Hulk and Thor. Another example of this is the scene when Iron Man is fighting him primarily on his own on Titan and he cuts his face while also being able to go toe to toe while he had the power, space, reality and soul stone. I suppose we don't know the biology of the alien members of the guardians and clearly Star-Lord retains his half celestial lineage aka his physical durability is better than a regular human but it seems crazy that they even held him off for that long. That being said it obviously sets the stage for what happens when you have Hulk(hopefully not as weak/not ready to fight), Thor(with a new weapon), Iron Man, and Captain Marvel working together as the probable strongest avengers still alive at that time(and potentially in general aside from Doctor Strange and if Star Lord ever taps back into celestial powers) working together to fight him instead of being separated. Honestly at this point the rest of the team is really there as support. Other than Captain America and Vision(who depending on what happens with him could have different powers and/or weakened ones) who could put up a little bit of a fight everyone else(Black Widow, Hawkeye, War Machine, and Okoye don't compare to a full Infinity Gauntlet Thanos. The brains of the Mcu still alive(Shuri, Iron Man, Rocket, and Bruce) will have to help in other ways too.
