Author: s-87601
Review_Title: This movie should never have worked, but once again, Marvel finds a way to do the impossible... and break our hearts at the same time.
Review: Picking up right where Thor: Ragnarok leaves off, Avengers: Infinity War never takes a break. The emotional blows come just as early as we say goodbye to Heimdall and fan-favorite Loki. An amazing performance from Josh Brolin as Thanos left me terrified for every single character that he shared the screen with. Robert Downey Jr. was excellent as always, this time teaming with Tom Holland's Spider-Man, Benedict Cumberbatch's Doctor Strange, and most of the Guardians. Chris Hemsworth makes you fall in love with Thor even more as he works alongside Rocket Raccoon and Teenage Groot. I wish Chris Evans had a bigger role in this film as Steve Rodgers, but in a movie this crowded, its a wonder this film ever even worked. I loved the fact that Marvel Studios made Thanos the main character of this film. He was easily the best villain we've ever seen in a Marvel film (sorry Killmonger). After he snaps his fingers, we watch helplessly as our heroes start to disappear. Tom Holland delivers a gut-wrenching performance in his "death" scene, and though I know he'll return, it broke my heart to watch my favorite superhero from the time I was little go out that way. This has left me dreading the next Avengers film, but not because I think it will be bad. I am in fear of exactly what will happen to my favorite heroes when they try to "avenge" the Earth and once again take on Thanos.

Author: barryallenchandler
Review:
This is a really good action movie, but it has a rather large hole in the plot which is not irreconcilable, but it needs to be explained.
Dr. Strange claims he has seen millions of futures and they win in only one, making one think that he had to let Thanos have the time stone... 'it was the only way'.
But they appear to just about have Thanos separated from the gauntlet (it appeared to have just come off) when Starlord loses it after hearing that Gamora is dead. Starlord losing it, appears to give Thanos the opportunity to regroup and hold onto the gauntlet. You have to believe that Dr. Strange saw this future (he did this before Thanos showed up), so it would appear that they just have to contain Starlord so that his stupidity does not give Thanos a chance to regroup.

Author: leet-27756
Review:
I recommend "Avengers Infinity War" because unlike other movies it shows that you should fight for what you believe in and to keep the things you love close. Another reason to watch this is because even though this has more of a serious and detrimental like tone/topic, it encompasses humor into the movie.
The movie "Avengers Infinity War" is a movie created by Marvel. Marvel continues the story of the first movie, Avengers. In this movie it shows how the hero's fight for their beliefs at all cost as well as fighting for others and their safety. This film has a relatively young and energetic cast that displays the connection and expressions of the hero's very well. The story of this movie is the hero's trying to stop the notorious Thanos and his dreams of destroying half the Earth for a result of world peace.
I've seen all the Marvel movies and many more and i recommend you to watch this movie because of how it shows the will power they show of fighting for hope and the safety of others no matter what comes their way. I like how it shows this theme in not only some parts of the movie but throughout the whole movie. This cast does a good job of showing and emphasizing what their character believes in and has close to their hearts. They show this in the movie by fighting this superior being (THANOS) for the safety of the people on Earth even though all odds are against them.
Another reason why i recommend this movie is because it has a way its own way to include humor and joy even though this movie has a serious tone to it due to what is at stake and the results that could happen if they failed to do their job. Thanos is a superior being who is known for destroying planets in order to get what he wants and desires, the Avengers are known as Earth's trusty protectors. They were just meant to meet and have a battle. In this serious circumstance they have moments that inflict comedy and ways to show that in dark times we have ways to give others hope and comfort.
Overall i think this movie was great to watch and a movie that i think you would enjoy if you are a marvel fan and like action packed movies. I recommend this movie if you have seen all the marvel movies so that you are able to see the smaller details and so that you have a better understanding of the movie. I can't wait for the second part of the movie, "Avengers End Game".

Author: burdissl
Review:
To be honest, I've been watching these Avengers movies since I was 8 years old. It was actually the first PG-13 movie my parents let me see, afters piles of weeks of heavy convincing. I remember going to the theater with my older sister, and my friend Dylan. Over the course of these last few years, as i've grown up, my friend and I have always gone back to the movies to see the new Avengers movies that had just hit the silver screen.
With him almost a year ago, I saw Avengers: Infinity war. I was blown away by this movie, from the incredible acting by a star studded cast, to the plot twist at the end that will leave any person in the theater speechless. When the lights turned back on, everyone around me was either crying or their jaws were laying on the floor from being so shocked by the ending. From the astonishing editing, to the great camera work, this movie swept me off my feet.
I usually admit whether I'm biased towards a certain something or in this case a certain franchise, but there is no need to admit being biased in this case, this was hands down of the greatest movies i've ever seen.
The plot of this movie is that Thanos( the most powerful Titan in the universe), is trying to get rid of half of Earth's population. The only way he can accomplish this is by retrieving all 6 infinity stones (these 6 stones are the only reason the universe is a thing, at least in this made up world). Thanos believes that our world's population is becoming too large, and killing off half our population will solve so many problems. After bombarding asgard( basically like heaven in this world) and killing almost all their people, Thanos retrieves the second out of six infinity stones. This is when he orders his army( the black order) to go to earth and retrieve 2 more stones, while he goes out into the depths of the galaxy and gets the two someone only of his power and stature could get. Meanwhile on earth, the almighty universe protectors, The Avengers, are going through a rough patch. They recently broke up( or as the hulk says, Like a band, broke up?"). They got into a huge argument about if they wanted the Avengers to be government run or if they wanted to continue running themselves. Playboy Billionaire tony stark(or iron man) is basically retired, but is then forced to come out of retirement due to being contacted by Hugo Strange(Dr. Strange) an is told that by both him and Bruce banner(Hulk) that Thanos is coming and won't stop until he gets all six infinity stones and ends half of the living population on earth as a whole. After fighting off the Black Order from earth, Stark and 16 year old Peter Parker(Spider Man) follow a spaceship up into space to take back a kidnapped Dr. Strange and the almighty time stone he carries and protects with his life. After saving strange and killing the wizard from the Order( Ebony Maw), they crash land on Thanos's homeland, Titan. They then develop a plan to lure Thanos in and kill him. Meanwhile back on earth, the hero's from the other parts of the world keep trying to fight off the Black Order, but the Order fights back and the battle for the infinity stones commences. Who wins? You'll have to watch to find out!
The acting in this movie blew me away. The star studded cast (Robert Downey Jr, Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson, Josh Brolin, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Pratt, Benedict Cumberbatch, etc.) made the movie the blockbuster breaking film it was. I could really feel the sadness of when Tony Stark(Robert Downey Jr.) had to leave his wife from earth to go and try to save the world, instead of staying behind and starting a family like he promised in the very beginning of the movie( and i'm sure before then as well).They always say great actors make movies what they are. I have to say without this all star lineup of a cast, this movie wouldn't of been close to being as good as it is. Also, I believe less people would have paid to see this movie if the movie had actors (and actresses) of a lesser caliber.
I have to admit, i'm surprised this movie didn't take 10 years to make. I say that because I was shocked about how realistic the aliens and the other made up characters looked in this movie. I have to tip my hat to the film editors, their job was outstanding and i'm surprised they didn't recently win an oscar for best film editing at the Oscars. The perfect example is the final fight scene on Titan with some of the Avengers vs Thanos. All that camera work goes unnoticed(you'll have to see it to know what i'm talking about). The camera work in this movie was also great. In the intense action scenes, both behind the camera or behind the computer, this was one of the main reasons that i'm praising this movie.
If I had to compare this movie to another movie like this( not counting the other like 30 Avenger movies made), I would compare it to it's crosstown rival, Justice League. I compare Infinity war to this movie because of the similar plots and the similar use of superpowers in both stories. I also compare it to The Dark Knight Rises, because it also relates to the topic of being a superhero and protecting what you believe in. That is what I saw almost automatically when I saw this movie, and that is why I wanted to compare these movies together.
After this movie, I think totally differently about movies as a whole. This movie change my way of thinking due to the fact that the ending was so shocking. ALso, in this movie, the directors and writers make you believe one thing will happen, that this movie will end like every other superhero movie ever made. But then suddenly, it totally switches, and the plot that you have been led to believe doesn't happen. Trust me, by the time the credits are rolling and the lights come back on, your eyes will be wide, and you will be shocked. This movie was spectacular in every way possible, and I can't wait for part two!

I have never loved an ensemble of characters so much in any art form (except possibly the comics these films are derived from), and nothing has ever inspired me more. Author: rebeccaaquilina
Review_Title: I wish I never watched it
Review: I love Marvel movies but I hated this Marvel movie... I'm not just disappointed, I'm really upset. They've spent years building up this universe and they've managed to ruin it all in one movie. I could make a massive list of the things that upset me but for my own sanity I'll just sum it up. Everyone was out of character - so much so that my mother who doesn't follow the movies could tell. Characters aren't as powerful as they're shown to be in other movies which makes fight sequences very frustrating. It feels as if the story was being made up as it went along and character development is thrown out the window. Walking into this movie I knew characters were going to die, I didn't anticipate though that they're deaths would be absolutely meaningless. I feel cheated, it just wasn't good story telling and no amount of shock value can make up for that. It had its moments (which is why I've rated 5 stars) but as a whole it was so terrible it's actually put me off the exisiting Marvel movies. I just don't know how they're going to fix this... I'll never be able to re-watch the other Marvel movies and enjoy them knowing just how horribly they end the journey. I'll let you judge for yourself but I can't see how fans of the MCU could enjoy this. I was in tears out of frustration. The MCU is capable of so much better.

Author: y-96735
Review_Title: Infinity War and Endgame: Perfectly Balanced, as All Things Should Be
Review:
Now that Avengers: Endgame has been released, it seems high time to re-evaluate its predecessor, Infinity War. Endgame was certainly able to do more with setup than simply resolving it, in fact introducing new arcs and conflicts to keep the movie interesting in its own right. Regardless, Infinity War deserves much praise for being able to set up the dramatic scenario of Endgame, while being entertaining on its own.
Infinity War centers around anti-hero Thanos (Josh Brolin) on his quest to collect all six Infinity Stones, in order to wipe out half of all living beings. His reasoning? "This universe's resources are finite. If left unchecked, life will cease to exist."
The film's opening scenes depict Loki failing to trick Thanos in an attempt to save his brother, Thor, and protect the Tesseract, which holds the Space Stone. Despite a surprise attack from Hulk, which seems to turn the tides, Thanos eventually overpowers him and acquires his second Infinity Stone. In this very first sequence, Infinity War introduces its key theme of inevitability. Time and again, the Avengers appear to gain the advantage, only for Thanos to beat them back and continue his destructive plot.
In one of the film's most iconic scenes, Doctor Strange (Benedict Cumberbatch) uses the Time Stone to look into "14,000,605" possible futures. When Tony Stark asks, "In how many do we win?" he pauses, then replies "One." With the extra context of Endgame, we know that this singular future is the one in which Thanos "wins," and then the Avengers triumph in Endgame (more on that later). At the time of first viewing, however, Doctor Strange's lines imply, (in one of the most intensely mocked moments of Infinity War) when Strange simply gives the Time Stone to Thanos, that the universe has already lost. This perfectly sets up Endgame, where the Avengers crawl back from a world which has already lost.
But! in Endgame, the ultimate theme of inevitability is turned on its head, and the viewer realizes that Doctor Strange's odd decisions were actually necessary to defeat Thanos. Rewatching Infinity War now not only dramatically recontextualizes the "14,000,605" scene in a sad new way, but also totally rewrites Strange's apparent 'turn to the dark side' as a clever ploy, establishing that, with Strange's help, the salvation of the universe in Endgame is what was truly inevitable.
This fantastic scriptwriting, by the Russo brothers, is what truly brings these two films into masterpieces. Needless to say, the graphical effects are also likely the best and most believable ever seen, from miniscule dust particles adding immersion to perfectly rendered faces, like Hulk and Thanos. Aside from that, the most common complaints about both films are from poor character development. The role of Drax (Dave Bautista) was mostly unfunny crude comments in Infinity War, and he (thankfully) isn't present much in Endgame. Even more egregious is the role of Captain Marvel (Brie Larson), who is not at all present in Infinity War, and barely contributes in Endgame despite being portrayed as incredibly powerful. Granted, Infinity War and Endgame were filmed before Captain Marvel (Brie Larson's introduction). Thus, the character was not yet established and didn't even have an actor in time for Infinity War. Still, this obscenely powerful character being absent from Infinity War, when she is needed most, is not at all excused by "there are a lot of other planets in the universe" (her brief explanation from Endgame).
In any case, it seems apparent that Anthony and Joe Russo are much less interested in individual characters than their fellow Marvel Cinematic Universe directors like James Gunn. It's clear that Avengers: Infinity War and Endgame prioritized their overall directions more. The way these two films take totally contrasting stances with the common theme of inevitability gives each film a unique flavor. Where Infinity War felt like a spiraling fall into calamity, Endgame feels like a desperate crawl towards salvation, eventually leaving a single, inevitable outcome of victory. Ultimately, Endgame seems to outshine its predecessor, but largely because of its impressive setup thanks to Infinity War. Like the first and last acts of the same story, the first builds tension and ends in climax, and the latter manages to bring the climax to a close, rewriting the tragedy of the first, with some major lasting sacrifice still in effect. Truly, there is no better outcome to get us excited for Spiderman: Far From Home!

Author: panemumakailash
Review: World-shaking events are kid stuff in "Avengers: Infinity War," the first installment of a two-part sequel to "The Avengers" and "Avengers: Age of Ultron." The whole universe is under attack from Thanos, an infinitely villainous villain sporting a multicleft, prognathous chin. Universe-shaking throwdowns succeed one another with truly stupefying regularity as the Avengers and their Guardians of the Galaxy allies take turns rising to the challenge. But moments that touch the heart are few and far between in this almost-culmination of a decade of Marvel Comics movies. The finale, scheduled for release in May 2019, may well bring the adventure to fittingly grand fruition. What's on screen now, however, is table-setting for events to come, a groaning board of superheroes, a superabundance of undifferentiated superpowers, and an ending that's more exciting than anything that precedes it.

Author: needie
Review: This is my first review at imdb and I have only one thing to say, this film is 'masterpiece'. It is beautifully shot and every moment of the film is worth remembering. It is more than just a superhero movie,it is a celebration of the wonderful ten years of Marvel Cinematic Universe. Each character shines throughout the entire Film. There were moments where I laughed and cheered, there were moments where I was deeply tensed for the characters and most important of all some unexpected moments that made me cry. My mother who is not much of a fan of superhero films enjoyed every moment of every scene. There was one particular scene almost at the end that really broke my heart and quite possibly one of the saddest scene in the entire film. Thanos is by far one of the best villains MCU ever had, he is scary, you cannot help but love and hate him at the same time. Avengers Infinity War is truly a spectacular superhero movie. The cast and crew members should be proud of themselves for the amount of effort they put into making this epic masterpiece. Cannot wait for Avengers 4!!!!!

Author: satyamkumar-75360
Review: Being a Marvel fan myself, i was expecting a kind of Avengers movie which would literally blow my mind ( After all the Hype & taking in account the previous MCU movies). As expected, Marvel delivered yet another masterpiece. This movie will surprise even those who are not new fans of Marvel. The plot is executed exceptionally well. The costumes, certain dialogues & some occasional humour ( Yes, you read it right. Surprised, aren't you? ) they are all just FANTASTIC. Each and every character has its own role to play ( Except Peter Quill AKA Star Lord . Just Kidding) be it small or large. So many characters, still you never seem to forget any of those as they are all AWESOME in their own way (of course not as cool as Iron Man or Doctor Strange or Thor). A big thanks to the directors (The Russo Brothers), who did their absolute best in satisfying their fans (& not giving even a slightest of hint about anything in the movie during all the promotions). Guys, do watch it even if you are not a Marvel fan. The movie will not cease to surprise you time and again.

Author: mateysami
Review: I watched painfully as my childhood started to break piece by piece, hero by hero. This is a film that will live in our hearts, in our mind as one of the most (maybe even the most) emotionally intense movie we will ever see. That night I did not sleep as I was so broken inside. This movie lives up to the hype and gives us even more than what we ask for. We do not deserve this movie. But it does deserve us, as in front of me I saw a group of 3 friends which were dressed up as: Nebula, Star-Lord, and Cap (and also a grumpy lady which threw me popcorn as my friend teased her). This is the best MCU, maybe even SUPERHERO movie that exists. 10 years of movies leading up to this. This does not happen regularly.

Review_Title: This movie will make you laugh cry and say WTF.
Review: If you like heartbreak laughs and action all in the same movie then this one is for you. The Russo Brothers have done a tremendous job with Avengers Infinity War. it starts off where Thor Ragnarok left off with the big ship which happens to be Thanos' and it keeps you guessing and guessing and begging for more. In the end of the movie you see Thanos snap his fingers with all six Infinity Stones and a lot of people die or so it seems. It keeps you guessing whether or not Thanos is trying to do the right thing by eradicating half the universe. My theory for Avengers 4 is that since they are in the end game, as Doctor Strange calls it, I think that the people who supposedly died are inside the Soul Stone and I believe that Doctor Strange has a plan to get everybody out of the Soul Stone using Ant-Man and the quantum Realm.

Author: khanglobalstudiesofficial
Review: Avengers: Infinity War (2018) is an epic and action-packed cinematic marvel that brings together the beloved superheroes from the Marvel universe in a thrilling showdown against the formidable villain, Thanos. Directed by Anthony and Joe Russo, the film lives up to its immense hype, delivering a visually stunning and emotionally charged experience.

Author: CodyRybak
Review: This movie is everything a movie should be. It combines everything the prequals have done to build up this franchise throughout the last twenty years and finally after all this time we get infinity war. Combining different groups of heroes such as the avengers and the guardians of the galaxy fighting together to stop the all evil and powerful thanos was a immaculate cinematic experience which can't be replicated. All of these stories coming together and watching them all fight alongside each other really takes story telling to another level which this movie does incredibly well. The movie flows perfectly and honestly there's nothing to say that could downgrade it's status.

Author: paperbackheroes
Review: Hello there , after seeing Avengers Infinity War this morning I felt I had to share a fraction of my enthusiasm for this movie. It's a rare thing indeed that a movie lives up to its hype , how often have you went to the cinema only to discover that the best parts are all in the trailer ? Well, fear not , because this is the best Marvel movie so far. The first 5 minutes are awesome and hooks you straight away but hang on because this is truly a roller coaster ride that just speeds up from this point. Whilst some people might worry that at 2 hours 20 , this may be a bum-numbing experience , but rest assured , this movie flies over all too fast and leaves you wanting more . One major advantage this super hero film has over the rest is the main villain, Thanos. This is the first time I can actually remember a murderous tyrant having a rational reason for destroying half a galaxy and Josh Brolin's performance is nothing short of incredible. Seriously , go see this movie NOW before someone reveals the many great scenes or plot twists - YOU WONT BE DISSAPOINTED !!!!!.

Author: Ryan_Gobin

Author: briggenguy
Review_Title: The best superhero movie in film history. Better than the hype.
Review: I expected this movie to be amazing, and I am glad to say that it somehow EXCEEDED that expectation by a long shot. The balancing between all of the different groups of characters was perfect. I never felt like one group had too much or too little on screen, it's just how Thanos would like it; balanced. Thanos is by far the greatest villain in any superhero movie. He had so much screen time that one could argue it was less about the Avengers and more about Thanos and his journey to destroy half of the Universe. Thanos as a character just had so much depth and character development in this film, which isn't very common in films as most of them only tell us "they are the evil asshole trying to kill everyone" and that's it. In this, we get many scenes with him that explain his motivations and his perspective, which really felt like a new thing to me. Moving on, there was not single scene in this film where I felt like the pacing was off, and no scene where I felt bored. The film hooks you in from the very start until the end. The humour in this film is exactly the same as what you would expect from a Guardians of The Galaxy film. When Iron Man called one of The Children of Thanos "Squidward" the entire crowd burst into laughter and nobody could stop. It was simply amazing. There is not really any characters that I disliked in this movie which I found incredible considering there is something like 80 characters in this film. If I had to pick, it would have to be maybe Black Widow and Mantis since they really didn't contribute all that much. Speaking of, basically all characters (with a few exceptions) contributed a fair part to the overall plot, which again is hard when you are juggling 80 characters at once. The ending was completely unexpected to say the least. Thanos succeeds in killing half of all life in the Universe, killing characters such as Spiderman, Dr Strange, Black Panther, Nick Fury, and so many more. I know for a fact that they will come back, but despite that, I am very intrigued to see how this all plays out and how they will bring at least some of these characters back. Overall, this movie was everything it needed to be. Congratulations to the directors for making a truly awesome film experience.

Author: rowcoolsville
Review_Title: The Unexpected Twists of Fate of Infinity War
Review:
From the beginning of the movie, I knew that this was going to be a hell of a movie. This movie begins with Thor and Hulk's ass being handed to them, defeating 2 of the heavy hitters, giving us a statement: Thanos does not, and I mean DOES NOT mess around and he has no mercy. Hulk is teleported away by Heimdall, and Thanos kills him in retaliation. Shortly after, Thanos demands the Tesseract from Loki, which he is reluctant to give. Thanos threatens to kill Thor if he doesn't receive the Tesseract. Eventually, he gives it up and reveals that a stone lies within the power cube. Thor is subdued, Loki begins to act and tries to kill Thanos but unfortunately, Thanos has now the power of 2 Infinity Stones and easily stops Loki. Commenting about his fake deaths and his power in mischief, Thanos gruesomely kills Loki, sealing his death. Thor is left to mourn his brother and his people, afterwards Thanos destroys the ship and leaves Thor to die. 
All throughout the movie, the characters interact with each other and its nearly perfect how they talk and work together to produce such an amazing team. In a Lord of the Rings sort of way, 3 stories occur, 1 group on Earth, 1 chasing after Thanos and 1 making a weapon that can kill Thanos. In the eve of all the situations, 2 battles occur, one against Thanos, and one against his army and minions/children and those who were making the weapon (Thor, Groot and Rocket) join the battle on Wakanda. Meanwhile, the battle against Thanos reaches a point where the group is able to subdue him, Star-Lord unfortunately learns of Gamora's death and hits Thanos breaking the connection the group has subduing Thanos, with Spider-Man almost removing the Infinity Gauntlet. To our disappointment (in terms of good side winning), Thanos defeats the group and comes close to killing Iron Man but Dr. Strange cuts a deal, Thanos spares Stark and Strange gives the Time Stone to Thanos. 
It comes to rise. One final stone to retrieve, Thanos has 5 and is near invincible. He travels to Wakanda via space portal. The final stand is now here. Everyone with the will to fight tries to stop Thanos but no one can stop him, not even Captain America stopped him, and in return, receives a kick-ass sucker punch from Thanos. It comes to a close, all that lies between Thanos and Vision is Scarlet Witch, and she comes to a hard decision and destroys the Mind Stone (is that even possible? awesome!) and its all over. Thanks however has the Time Stone and is able to reverse time where he revives Vision and rips the Stone from his head, killing Vision. At last, he puts the final Stone in the Gauntlet and with that, he is truly powerful, powerful enough to wipe out half the universe with the snap of his fingers. But WAIT, THERE'S MORE! Thor comes to the rescue and throws his bad-ass axe towards Thanos, nearly killing him at an instant. But as I said, nearly killed him. Thanos snaps his fingers and the goal is completed. Shortly, half the Avengers and nearly all the Guardians die, even Spider-Man fades away, leaving the team and the audience grief stricken.
This movie is truly a great movie, it shows us that heroes don't always win and that sometimes, our emotions and mistakes can get in our way. From all the movies in the MCU, this is the only one (and probably the only one) that has the bad guy win and had him decimate half the freaking universe. Some people may say this ending was expected or cheap, or maybe thats just what the MCU needed, a ending where the good guy doesn't always wins and sometimes evil triumphs over good. This movie is the most anticipated movie of all time because its the cumulation of everything we seen and end it in a way we've never seen in the MCU.

Author: heyyquinn
Review_Title: Hated the plot, loved the characters and their dialogue
Review:
1. I think this plot was really uncreative, especially compared to Civil War or Winter Soldier... or really any other recent Marvel movie. I ADMIT its amazing to see ALL these superheroes together, I enjoyed their dialogue, and the simultaneous battles were cool, but its wasted on a pointless, lazy plot. Bad guy gonna kill (50% of) everyone. Wow.
2. Why does Thanos care anyway? How does killing 50% of the universe make him feel any better about the fall of his own planet/society? Even Loki's pettiest motives were more solid than Thanos'. Also, why did he "love" his "adopted" (abducted) daughter more than his blood daughter?
3. This is colonial-imperialist propaganda. Usually Marvel films seem to me critical of the military-industrial complex. But this film promotes the idea that because of the failings of ONE LIFESTYLE - mass industrial society - all forms of life are unsustainable. Not everyone lives like a spoiled American/ect. Some people actually take responsibility for supporting themselves and dont depend on slave-labor from others. Some people don't dump their excess in landfills and oceans.
4. That ending was just cruel and unnecessary for MCU fans.
5. Thor didn't even show any skin. Does he charge extra or what? Thats the least I deserve for enduring that.
6. I'm no prude, but the profanity seems out of place. Who is their target audience? I'm 28, no kids, but it still just felt inappropriate and tacky, for cheap laughs.
7. I hate the MCU post-credit scenes. Just put it all together. If theyre that desperate for us to watch the credits, just play awesome music.

Author: jdorr-64972

Thanos is not just a mindless killing machine. We could even grow to understand him. The other characters may still be in their own box, but that's they way we love them. Despite that, they've all developed over the last 10 years, been through their troubles and triumphs.
Keen as to see the next chapter in the Mavelverse for Earth's Mightiest Heroes.

Author: pj7214
Review: Avengers Infinity War is the spectacular culmination of 18 previous movies over 10 years that exceeded my expectations! As someone who has followed the marvel universe since it's inception, I can say that this film successfully brings together an enormous cast, a remarkable story, twists that will keep you guessing, serious and gut-wrenching dramatic stakes, and an ending that left me both immensely satisfied and yearning for more at the same time! With a cast of this size, I was worried that the film would be confusing or bloated, but the directors jump from story to story in a way that is very easy to follow and each character gets at least one moment to shine! The antagonists of the majority of the previous entries in the marvel cinematic universe have been characters with no real deapth or motivations that don't entirely make sense, but the mad titan Thanos is quite the exception. Thanos sees himself as the hero of his own story and this movie does an excellent job of making the viewer understand why he does what he does and I empathize with him on some level. This movie has a lot of serious and emotional moments that would make sense for the most part if Avengers Infinty War was your first marvel cinematic universe film, but that being said, those moments are highlighted by context from previous entries in the series, and you would not have the same emotional payoffs you would if you possess at least a general knowledge of the marvel universe. Overall Avengers Infinity War is an excellent film that is not only impressive from its technical achievements, but also for, its superb cast and story that left me eager to see what will happens to earth's mightiest heroes!

Author: supersain17
Review: Alright let's get something straight, to anyone rating it bad because it was all over the place and it was too funny, THERE ARE OVER 60 MAIN CHARACTERS OF COURSE ITS GONNA BE ALL OVER THE PLACE the Russo brother did a magnificent job on getting all characters into the movie first off but every character got 5 minutes or more of screen time which is incredible considering if all characters got 3 minutes individually, the movie would be 3 hours long of just characters appearing. Next if you think it was too funny, you clearly have never seen a marvel movie ever, they all are supposed to be hilarious, well maybe not captain America but still no one with common sense would want a MARVEL movie with little hilarity, and if you didn't realize, DRAX STARLORD IRONMAN ROCKET GROOT ARE ALL IN THIS MOVIE SO HOW COULD YOU NOT EXPECT HILARITY, clearly you have no sense of humour. Lastly if at the end you were like "NO why would you do that, end the mcu like that, this movie sucks" you do realize there is a second part coming out in 2019? Also if you get emotional (being any emotion except boredom) , then the movie did it's job, what you except to go into a movie and sit there and not feel anything and walk out with nothing happened? Point of a movie is to make you feel something anything except boredom it's called escapism.

Review_Title: A nice movie with a bad ending
Review: Overall a very good movie ...despite the fact that it is a big movie it doesnt bore you..nonetheless it excites you scene after seen ...BUT thats all cause of the tension of the moment...when you get out of the cinema and start thinking about the movie there some questionmarks with the biggest one being the ending...for example a minor question mark is the ''hulk'' ...why would you not show us in this movie the great clash between these 2 ''titans''...at the comics thanos is constantly avoiding conflicts with hulk ...why would you make hulk seem so afraid in this movie...now about the ending...it's really really nice to see some characters dying ...especially the way they died in this movie cause it keeps the agony levels really high..another BUT coming ..BUT why would you kill characters that they already have confirmed or at least 90% confirmed sequels..we already know that there will be a spiderman 2 and gotg 3(also black panther doctor strange are likely to have sequels if not surely)...which means we already know that none of these characters will remain dead...i believe that the movie would be much much better if other heroes died in the end...it had great action and emotional scenes but the ending was poor...(sorry for any grammar mistakes or any mistakes in general)

My overall review of Avengers: Infinity War is "EPIC" 
It had the story line that it needed and also multiple aspects within the film from start to finish. It has the must needed action that everyone is desperate to see. Author: rialdiirenius
Review:
This movie is a conclusion of all marvel cinematic universes movie in the past 10 years and its put it all together very well, but not very neat. It put the heroes on various moment that we can't correlate with. As we know, the main villain, Thanos is a fanatic on his own belief and He tried to make a religion out of this, put his ambition all over the universe whom he believes is the best choice that universe would ever have. But I fail to connect to what Thanos belief, as a good villain must convince what he's doing is probably the best choice for the audience. In the past movie, we don't know Thanos true intention to collect all the rocks for but we know that he is very powerful and his reason must be as powerful as he is, turns out its just incomprehensible obsession over balance.
One thing that felt weird is when Rocket and Groot easily join Thor on his quest considering Rocket's skeptical view on people. It's also strange when the rest GotG flew to Knowhere and trying to stop Thanos while Thor, Rocket, and Groot go on their side quest to create a mighty weapon to destroy Thanos, It's like the Quill's team would face a predestined lost. But to everyone who said that Thor's hammer is freakin' cool, I must agree.
On the other side of the fight, Doctor Strange, Iron Man, and Spider-Man is a great collaboration of fun and glorious fight. The way Doctor Strange fought with his magic is pretty cool and it's like he always has some trick to confuse Thanos while an iron man and spiderman showed their father to son debate which makes a bit of fun on the pretentious moment. 
The fight in Wakanda took a lot of heroes but very little exposure of all of them. It's like when all the triumph moment come it always gone quickly, moving to another main character's scene, I don't feel the fight was set on the Wakanda, it's like the director just changes the scene madly to show the heroes. The plot doesn't make any straight line conclusion, Thanos seems like a confused guy trying to get all his toys, and why the hell Thor just farming on Thanos's crazy monsters not just directly confront him as he always wanted to do in the first place and the main reason he crafted his new weapon.
The biggest wasted potential on this movie is Hulk. Before I see this movie, I think the only guy that would be able to defeat Thanos is the Hulk. But when he's beaten on the Asgardian's ship, I hope that he will get angrier and make an epic comeback on Thanos, even if he's not gonna defeat him, I expect that there is an epic moment of Hulk beating Thanos.
On the end of the movie, the conclusion is not what I expected, but the result is. The story left me nothing to expect on the next movies, so when the movie ended I felt no insurmountable urge to watch the next, it's because the ending of the movie is just like the ending of the Avengers movie.There's no one taken any hostages, no one alive to fight for, and the villain is retired on his tropical hut. The possibility of the next movie all about is as the title of the movie, to avenge, and this time for the dead one.
One thing I felt missing in this movie, the triumph song, it's like the immigrant song on thor Ragnarok and African black panther's theme song. There are a lot of cool moments and if it guided with a compatible back sound, It will bring more ardor to the scene, but instead, it's only a flat monotonous back sound that I may say is the secondary storyteller, besides the scene.
I must appreciate how Russo brothers put the details very neatly despite a great deal of character and story to take care of. And respect given from me to the director when they could still maintain all the characters sways and jokes and made me feel a little bit nostalgic feeling of the past movies and a brief moment of clarity of how big this movie is.
Some people may expect more from this movie, but I can't see another way to feel enjoy the character in any other way. This movie brings the characters personally as it brings all the character as a team. They put the movie on tight chess game with some sacrifice and some winning, making an unexpected move while making sure the ending is inevitable. And I believe for the next movie, the remaining characters won't go easy on Thanos. The Avengers will avenge. That's what they do best.

Author: harrywman
Review_Title: The Best MCU movie made so far!
Review: I did not go into this movie with very high expectations, it looked to me that it would be a mess with all the main characters. I am very happy to say that I am wrong. The way that this film handles all the main characters is great and and did not expect it to be this way. I honestly can't say this is a film, this is more like a three hours of straight climax which is actually done really well. Another thing that this movie does well are the characters themselves. While some characters get more attention then other (for example War Machine gets a lot less screen time than Iron Man), most of the characters are given adequate screen time. One more note about the characters is that Thanos is genuinely the best character in this movie. He gets the most character development of any Marvel villain and any character in this movie. Most of his development in the film is spoilers and I don;t want to deprive anyone of this amazing experience. For those reading this don't spoil the movie for anyone, don't kill the moment some have been waiting ten years for.

Author: stepanvich96
Review: Really a great film to watch. A lot of action and twists in only two and half hour long movie. A new anti-hero, whose character has been crafted for over six years in previous movies and post credit scenes, is at the rise and his powers are becoming unstoppable. The cards between heroes and anti-heroes are dealt very well and a great balance between them are established. You can be excited for a lot of traumatic deaths in this film. But who knows if there be a resurrection. The ending is just hilarious and unpredictable. The DC Universe seams like a rubbish in compare with the Marvel Universe. I hope that the next movie will be at least as good as this one. Though, If you miss some Marvel movies in the past, you may have some problems with the understanding of the plot of this great movie. However as a Marvel fan it is a super movie that honourably ends a third phase of the Marvel Cinematic Universe and I am really excited for the next part.

Author: actonthomas1
Review:
As my brain scrambles from scene to scene in an attempt to relive the significance of its originality I've come to the conclusion that this was everything I expected and more. 
The jump from different city to different planet to different spaceship was relentless but I suppose it just had to be, right? The Russo brothers have given every thought to every single character in this film and has made them all feel as equally as important within the main plot. 
As for that main plot, well Mr. Brolin may have just written is name down in iconic villain folklore alongside the likes of Mr. Vader and that clown from that other universe... He shows us why he is 'the biggest and baddest villain yet' and makes our heroes seem so 'tiny and small'. 
Our heros are as appealing, warm and heroic as ever as they put their differences aside to challenge this apocalyptic threat. There's no time for getting to know each other, it's all hands to the deck right from the off! 
Heading towards the climax the Russo brothers have still managed to keep you guessing right until the grand finale. Then it hits you, like a golden gauntlet to the face!
The question is, how am I supposed to wait another year to find out if the swelling has gone down?

Review: It was a pretty good movie. I just saw it the other day, and I thought that it was pretty good! I almost cried 3 times, when Gamora dies, when Spider-Man dies, and something else I can't remember. The most I cried was when Spider-Man dies. He's just so innocent and I shed so many tears. Apart from the sad parts, it was a pretty good movie! The only reason this has 8 stars instead of 10 is because I cannot keep up with all of the Marvel movies that you are spewing out every month or so. I didn't know most of the superhero's in the movie, because I don't have much time in my day to watch the other movies. But, overall it was pretty good. Another good thing is that the villain won, and you don't usually see that in movies. I like the uniqueness!

Author: Nchenry48
Review_Title: INFINTY WAR DOESN'T DISAPPOINT IN MAKING THE TOP MARVEL FILMS!
Review: WOW. Is the one word I can possibly describe such a huge, remarkable movie. This is the beginning of the end of one phase to such an expended universe, and this movie makes it app worth it. If you have not seen this move, HURRY AND GET YOUR TICKETS! IT'S WELL WORTH THE PAY. From beginning to end there is just the right amount of humor mixed with emotions and gut wrenching moments that it was hard for me to sit still in my seats. Dare I say, Josh Brolin plays one hell of a villain (Thanos.) I promise you will feel this characters presence throughout the entire movie. Be glad to know Thanos has earned the spot in the top villains of the MCU which make sense since we've known he existed since 2012's The Avengers. It's all been building up to this moment and I can assure you, this movie is such a thrill that I myself plan to make another viewing soon!

Author: alex-113-883833
Review_Title: Puts all other movies to shame
Review:
This movie takes the past 10 years of MCU history and brings together all of our favourite heroes. During the movie we are put into different situations with our heroes, but this is a thanos movie ( Kevin Feige wasn't kidding). We learn lots about Thanos through the course of this movie and see why he is trying to destroy half the universe. 
The heroes in the movie were amazing with Spiderman getting his new suit to Drax throwing in punch lines all over the place. Interactions between characters was amazing also seeing all these different personalities interact and how they fight together as a team. This movie is very dark with lots of death, but the heroes still make us laugh throughout the movie 
Overall, without spoiling the movie we don't stray too far away from the comics and this movie is really a part 1 to next years avengers 4. You will be on the edge of your seat this whole movie to the end of the credits. Mind blowing movie 10/10

Author: LBarina
Review: When you watch the climatic film of a company who's produced superhero films for a decade, you wouldn't expect to see anything you hadn't seen in one shape or form of another. But this film defies all looming expectations and does an impeccable job of pulling you into it's rich overlapping plot and to-die-for characters in a epic part one finale of the first generation of the MCU. It's distinct bold flavor breeds massive success, and the whole world is thirsting for just one more film. And that's what they'll get. And somehow, it will be even more outstanding and extraordinary than the last.

Author: rawanalasirii
Review:
This is everything I hoped for.
I have waited for infinity war for so long and I didn't try for once to lower my expectations because I simply couldn't, i went to the movie with high expectations and boy it DELIVERED.
I cried three separate times in those two and a half hour period.
The movie was intense, the crowd was intense and everything was intense. Most people were setting on edge and are so locked with the story and the characters.
You don't feel overwhelmed by the huge amount of characters and storylines and i think the editing -which was so so so beautiful done- had a huge impact on that 
Now I'm not going to spoil anything but i have to say Tom holland's performance in one particular scene was so beautiful and heartbreaking and the acting was overwhelmingly good. He never fails to amaze me.
Going to this film I heard people say how heartbreaking , sad and dark it is and I thought i was ready for it but I wasn't and I don't think you will.
I hate this film in the most loving way possible.

Author: nazmi_sktg
Review_Title: ONLY IDIOTS WOULD THINK THIS IS A BAD MOVIE
Review: For all the people who rated this movie badly, SHAME ON YOU not Marvel. Every movie doesn't have to be a happy ending with shining rainbows all day round. Infinity War has broken the traditions of having good endings. Thanos is the biggest bad-ass in the universe and YOU SHOULD ACCEPT that fact. Infinity War is basically a Star Wars-esque movie and Marvel did it brilliantly. It is called INFINITY WAR, yes WAR for a reason so the pacing is a little bit faster than usual yet cost us more than 2 hours. If you are a true deep-thinking Marvel fan, Infinity War is basically a new beginning of something bigger than itself. Kudos Marvel.

Author: songbird_sings_forever
Review: It's COLOSSAL. MONUMENTAL. EPIC! Indeed the biggest Hollywood movie of 2018. It's an EXPERIENCE. Avengers: Infinity War gathers Iron Man (Robert Downey Jr.), Captain America (Chris Evans), Thor (Chris Hemsworth), the Hulk (Mark Ruffalo), Black Panther (Chadwick Boseman), Star Lord (Chris Pratt), Spider-man (Tom Holland), Doctor Strange (Benedict Cumberbatch) and the rest of the Avengers together & unite in order to battle their most powerful enemy yet: the evil Thanos (Josh Brolin). On a mission to collect all six Infinity Stones, Thanos plans to use the artifacts to inflict his twisted will on reality. The fate of the planet and existence itself has never been more uncertain as everything the Avengers have fought for has led up to this moment.The hype that surrounds the movie is real. You haven't seen a film that puts together 19 of the biggest stars in Hollywood in one mega extravaganza. It's 2 hours & 29 minutes of big cinematic moments after another, with all possible elements of filmmaking combined together to make one gigantic film. You get your fill of action, comedy, suspense & a pinch of touching scenes in between. Like any film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, you also get your fill of fantastic visuals, top notch editing & great cinematography from Trent Opaloch. Alan Silvestri, fresh from the success of Ready Player One, delivers another memorable musical score.Directors Joe & Anthony Russo gives us not only an unforgettable superhero film, but the biggest film of their lives. They also directed one of my favorite films in the MCU (Captain America: Civil War) so rest assured that this movie is in totally good hands. I was literally shookt when the film ended, was not able to stand up even after the end credit scene was shown because I still needed to process what just happened in the whole film. It's that good! My advice: JUST GO SEE IT! DON'T READ NO SPOILERS! Whether you're a Marvel fan or not, JUST GO SEE IT! ASAP!

Author: dropdeadfriend
Review_Title: Compelled me to write my first review
Review: Me and my 5 yrs old daughter enjoyed every bit of this film. How new teams form up was exciting. Team work was entertaining. I wished more from Banner... Hulk did almost no thing, so did Natasha.. But eagerly waiting for Thanos to be back. Thanos was nice!

Author: cjtheman
Review_Title: First Movie to Leave Me in Awe
Review: I've seen a lot of great movies, some even recently, but Avengers: Infinity War gave me this feeling that no movie has been able to accomplish. I was constantly thrilled by the action and on the edge of my seat through every exciting outcome. When I had left the theatre, my friend had said that I had cried like I had lost a family member. The characters I grew up with, the character who I've seen develop through the years and to see their emotions and their reactions. It's fascinating and heartbreaking. This movie grabbed my attention the moment it started and didn't lose any focus. I'd recommend the MCU to anyone just to have them watch this movie. Congrats to the Russo brothers for making such a breath-taking experience! I can't wait for Captain Marvel and Avengers 4!

Author: jumalammaa
Review: I actually don't know what to say. This had some uh very big twists. It does not end how you would think with a major comic event happening. Uh my theory was right but I've told very few people so. Let's just say I laughed, I cried tears of joy, W specially when cap came in and the avengers theme played, and I cried tears of sorrow when four legitimate character deaths happened and at they very end when something big happened. Very big. Thanos was well done. He was a very menacing villain, possibly the best MCU villain and is actually relatable. A character we've longed to say again comes back. One we haven't seen in almost a decade, wink wink. The black order was ok. Wished we could have learned more about them but it's ok. A lot of the trailer content was not in the movie. However most of that should be on Blu-ray. A character is teased in the end credit scene but they troll with the usual mod credit scene which is actually not there and the "this character/team will return". That honestly was a mixed bag with the other viewers. Highlight was this one guy who saw the solo trailer said wait not on that the fourth when the realest date came up and multiple crying and oh man is that nova, oh it's the defenders form one dude. He was ignorant and also said there are three parts although the Russo brothers stated there are no parts. Each movie can stand alone. And there were multiple NO *cries loudly. So be weary with your audience. The cgi was rough in very few places and acting was good as always and the pairings of the hero's is notable. One being tony and strange. They were a good duo. The movie so many twists I couldn't even explain. I'd have to rewatch the movie before I can explain it. Overall with all the moments where you feel like yelling with joy, my audience as well as I sure did and very loudly on my part, and the multiple crying moments this movie probably deserves a solid 8/10 but with all the actually good things a movie needs like a solid story big surprise out of nowhere and solid pace this as of right now gets a 10/10. I'm definitely seeing this again and will probably cry myself to sleep tonight.

Author: akay-64411
Review_Title: You'll enjoy watching it, but it's not a good movie
Review: This movie is incredibly entertaining. The comedy, the costumes, the CGI, the music... all of it is extremely well done.The acting is incredible, and it's great to see the characters we've loved for a decade all come together in an epic war for the future of the universe. That being said, this is a bad script disguised by great production. There are plot holes everywhere, the ending is unsatisfying, and there is no character development. Thanos is incredibly well done and the backstory is compelling; in contrast, the heroes Marvel has spent so many movies developing and making real and complete fall flat because they have no real development. There is no theme. It is true that the people who are saying there is no plot are wrong- there is a plot, there just isn't any emotional substance behind it. It is action without a compelling story for our heroes. Hopefully, all of this will be fixed and explained in the next installment, but for now, this movie is entertaining without anything more to it.

Author: quyengiamdoc
Review_Title: A true masterpiece for someone who deserve it.
Review:
Big love from huge fan from Vietnam. I don't care much about people mixed review. All I needed from a perfect movie is here, to conclude all great previous effort of Marvel studio have putted into their fan. Only someone who have time following the cinematic timeline of MCU can truly understand the ultimate meaning of A:IW.
Story: Everything is inter-connected and solid (from objects to characters). The pace is not too fast and not too slow for us (fan) to enjoy it.
*Spoiler Alert*
The movie continues right after ending of Thor: Ragnarok, showing the battle between Thanos's forces and Marvel super heroes (include almost any heroes from previous we have seen so far). Thanos, who looks like a chaotic lawful super-villain. His ultimate purpose is to destroy half-population of entire universe (including Earth) as a solution to over-population on universe which bring so many terrible things to mortal life (such as starvation, planet pollution, resources exhausting, wars for survival....). I can rarely see any movies which can deeply depict into a super-villain this far, to show how their defines justice. Thanos is like a god-like hero in his own right, with extremely will-power and determination to achieve victory over our beloved Marvel superheroes.
I can not say how I feel after so many deaths of our heroes. But to be honest, I am grateful for that, because that means we can see more interesting characters in the future. This is not only a definite meaning to the MCU itself but to Marvel studio and viewers as well.

Author: andyfriedrice
Review_Title: One of the best films of all time
Review:
I've seen this film probably half a dozen times at this point 3 of those while it was in the cinema. The film has such a great pacing that I never get bored. Are there thing's missing yeahh I was kinda dissapointed that a few battles are missing, but I can't dismiss what we did get for what we didn't get it as the action is still astonishing. We finally get to see the MCU come together with characters meeting and using their powers together against a familiar foe. It has an amazing soundtrack and visuals and is not afraid to keep the focus where it belongs instead of trying to give everybody equal screen time and the ending is incredible. Totally ready for End Game.
I felt the need to write this review as there as so many negative reviews on here its crazy do these people have no sense of wonder or are they just bashing Marvel cause they can't stand there success? The best film in the MCU and promises more greatness in the future. Screw the haters.

Author: ericversion
Review_Title: Marvel's Version of the Empire Strikes Back
Review: I've always been saying that this generation, whilest the Star Wars franchise is still going strong, the Marvel Cinematic is this generation's Star Wars. And Infinity Wars is one of it's finest work. Everything from the beginning all the way to the end, just resonates with action and drama throughout. I have watched this twice and I barely even noticed the two hours pass by up to the final scene. Marvel have truly made you invest in the characters to the point where you are happy or sad for what happens to each of them. And much like the Empire Strikes Back, it makes you want to see it again and come back for more when all is said and done.

Author: aj-movie-watcher
Review_Title: Great Movie - All movie aspects - Sorry I watched it....
Review: Life is usually a fight, not always physical and definitely not always to the death. People, by enlarge, work hard to make things better. They do it for themselves, their family, employees and sometimes co-workers. We go to the movies to feel... Some look to feel scared, some to feel good and others to just think. We don't go there to feel like losers. To the people that own the creation of Avengers - Infinity War, you took our heroes that motivate us to stay in the fight and do more... Do more than most of us are capable and you made them losers? Shame on you...

Author: NightFuryFan150
Review: This movie was just, wow. This movie was simply amazing, I won't go into too much detail but the performances are great (especially Josh Brolin), the directing is great, the writing is great, the action is awesome, and the special effects are incredible. The best scene in the entire movie was definitely 'The Snap' scene, where Thanos wipes out half of our heroes. It left me in total shock, and that scene still gets me every time I watch it. And what a way to end an amazing film on such a cliffhanger, the villain won and the heroes lost, completely unexpected. If you haven't watched this movie yet, I 100% recommend it you to, even if you don't like superhero movies, this one is just something else.

Author: stephughes-12355
Review: I don't normally write in to comment on any movie or anything else in general,even if something vexes me, I usually just like to read other peoples comments and then either smile or huff and puff.I will say I am a great fan of Marvel Studios and have seen all the current movies right back to Iron Man at the pictures,I also like many others own them all on disc to watch over and over again,which I am currently doing.I even remember seeing Ang Lees HULK at the flicks,and Ben Afflecks starrer Daredevil,(though not Marvel Studios then),both of which at the time I quite liked.However we are in a whole new ball game now,with each new Marvel film hitting new heights of what is possilble on screen.I saw Infinity War ,the day it came out I couldn't wait,and I enjoyed it ,it never dragged not for a long film,but in my opinion and it is only my opinion,I did not enjoy it as much as I thought I would or as much as say Avengers Assemble,or the other Russo brothers films Captain America (Winter Soldier) or Civil War,and I don't really know why,the acting was all top notch as usual ,the SFX excellent,the banter and script all in place,Brolins Thanos never anything other than gripping and believable.It just didn't gel for me,I think there was just so much going on with all the different characters they had to fit in ,it just felt a little rushed.Ok there was plenty of screen time for Iron Man (as there should be),Doctor Strange and Spider Man,Thor and the Guardians were well catered for too,but the other Avengers and the stars of Wakanda less so,a little more Hulk might have helped.I hope this will be addressed in the next film,but in general a wonderful achievement by the Russo brothers.So because there was so much to take in ,I'm off to see it again tomorrow ,perhaps I will enjoy that bit more,and give it 10 out of 10.

Author: acherfi
Review: This film is what we've all waited for. Every Marvel fan has been anticipating this monetuous masterpiece for years on end, since the golden spark of Iron Man 1 was ignited for the world. Every decision, every move made by Marvel in the previous films that many thought unexplained or irrelevant has proven to play a huge part in this film. Such moments can make your hairs stand on end with excitement! Corny? I think not. This is one of the few films in the world that deserves every ounce of praise it receives from all directions; the only criticism being... WHAT HAPPENS NEXT?!

Author: seth-25058
Review_Title: Best Marvel Movie To Date....But It's Too crowded.
Review: I enjoyed every bit of this film. The directors and producers did the best they could with this massive cast load and it was really fun to watch. But that being said, there are a lot of characters in this movie. With many characters that demand much screen time it was definitely a challenge to make sure that happens. I'm guessing that's why the movie was so long. I have nothing but good things to say about this movie. GO WATCH IT. The only negative is that I left the theater feeling that the movie was very crowded...because it was. The movie went all over the place and at some points you could really feel how crowded it was and it distracted you from the film. Other than that it was really well done. Thanos is definitely the best Marvel villain we've seen and it'll take a lot to top him.

Author: madichibrown
Review: After 18 films and 10 years of building up to this moment, Avengers: Infinity War has finally been released. It is directed by Joe and Anthony Russo who also directed two other films in the Marvel Cinematic Universe: Captain America 2 and 3. The film is a huge culmination of 18 films and 10 years of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Before the film was even released it was already bound to be huge as it had 2 unique selling points. The first is that Infinity War marks the first time that a feature-length movie has been filmed entirely on IMAX cameras. The 2nd is that the directors promised that several characters will be killed off which was something that fans wanted due to the argument that the films lack stakes if characters always survive.

Author: smcole-44300
Review: Superbly written and wonderfully executed. The film delivers from beginning to end. Some CGI is weak but not for the main character Thanos. They accomplish him to the screen in a perfect fashion. The film is 3 movies in one. They squeezed an entire trilogy worth of action, emotion, suspense, and excitement into a single film. The movie is 2hr and 40 minutes in length so plan your bladder accordingly. No handicap patrons had attended the show so after a few minutes into the film, I moved from the very side of the theater to the center of our row where wheelchairs would sit for better seating for my son to see. This led to us being in the walkway for anyone that needed to leave. Every person that had to leave to use the bathroom was literally running to not miss one more second than they needed to of this phenomenal film. I love Marvel (Disney) but have never enjoyed a movie enough to go back, spend money again, and watch it a second time in theater, until now. Consider Infinity War, Maximus Decimus Meridius because you will surely be entertained.

Author: niueve
Review:
Waited till May 11th to see it on IMAX in mainland China. The theatre was filled. The line of people waiting winded outside into the mall. People were excited before they went in, and hyped after they came out. The best cinematic experience ever.
There were indeed a lot of characters, each and everyone of them loved by so many fans, had their moments in the movie. Some has more screen time, some less, but not even one second was bad. All the pieces and moments were good, in a way that it either pushes the story line or build up the characters. 
As someone who's more fond of the original Avengers, I do have some complaints about the Guardians' lengthy journey compared to the short appearance of my beloved Steve Rogers and Black Widow. But if you take the storyline into consideration, the Guardians were indeed more intertwined into the plot. So I understood what the directors wanted to do.
But, again, why can't there be more backstory about what Steve Rogers and Black Widow did after the Civil War? Instead, I had to look at someone eating snacks for over a minute~ I laughed at that scene, but, I still wished that I had seen more of Steve Rogers and Black Widow after waiting sooo long for this Averagers film.
Even though I still LOVED this movie. It's definitely going into my blue-ray collection.

Author: dianahussain
Review_Title: The best Marvel film I have ever seen
Review: This film depicts many stories that come as one for a final battle against an unstoppable tyrant. The stories are all 3 dimensional. The movie moves at a consistent pace where we do not feel too rushed or too slow. There are no parts whatsoever which lack in character. Throughout the film you've got a raging stiffy. This is created through every amount of screen time which shows Captain America. This is not a film that non marvel fans will hate. This is one they shall love. This movie caters to their fans, dropping in Easter eggs here and there. The film will put you in a mental coma. Please watch at your own risk. Batteries not included.

Author: ahmedkhanmak
Review_Title: Perhaps the best Marvel movie yet!
Review: Avengers infinity war is the culmination of all what has been built in the past 10 years. Directors had come and told their stories but now it was up to the Russo brothers to put everything together and make all these characters with individual story lines work in a single setting, though that had been done in the previous movies but this film took it to a whole new level. The movie in spite of so many people didn't feel over crowded and everyone got their time in the sun shine. Thanos was an exceptional villain with motivations and goals that made sense. He was powerful, wicked yet had weight in his actions, so great in fact that you think "Hmm this guy has a point". Despite Marvel taking a dark route this time they don't shy away from making jokes time to time heck I would say this is the funniest Marvel film yet. I tip my hat to Marvel for making the most funniest and saddest film yet. My gripe about it would be that the Dark order was boring,bland and cliche. Can't wait for what's next!

Author: ddfinn-45488
Review_Title: Avengers: Infinity War is possibly the best Marvel film so far!
Review:
Avengers: Infinity War is possibly the best Marvel film yet!
Out of all the Marvel movies that have been released over the last couple years, there are none as special as their last, Avengers: Infinity War. Infinity War is an intense, action-packed film with every superhero in the Marvel Cinematic Universe fighting against the mad titan Thanos. Ever since 2012's The Avengers, Thanos has been a potential threat to the universe. The way that Marvel linked this film with the films in the past is also very impressive. All in all, Infinity War is Marvel's number one masterpiece full of dynamic characters with astonishing chemistry, dramatic, thrilling moments left and right, and an emotional storyline that has consistently built up in the franchise. 
One thing that is instantly noticed are the amount of characters in the film. Almost everyone in the Marvel Cinematic Universe is in Infinity War. Having all these famous characters like Thor, Thanos, and Iron Man combined into one film is both awesome and breathtaking. Not only do all these characters connect with one another, they also have amazing chemistry. For example, every scene with Tony Stark and Dr. Stephen Strange are both hilarious and intense because both of their personalities are very alike, therefore, creating a clash. Marvel does a very good job grouping these characters, both alike and different, together to make the audience laugh and fall in love with these characters even more. 
Marvel movies are always known for their suspenseful moments of action and heroism. What's nice about Infinity War is that there are so many characters that have their own fight scenes. For example, there is a scene where Captain America, Black Widow, and Falcon fight two members of the Black Order, while another has Spider-man, Iron Man, The Guardians of the Galaxy, and Dr. Stephen Strange taking on Thanos. The fact that everyone is fighting to save the universe against only one villain makes it even better. Not only is Thanos one of the most known villains in the Marvel Universe, he is also the most misunderstood villain. 
Thanos is a very complicated character to understand. He is always seen as this evil tyrant who wants to wipe out half universe, but, if you really try and look at it from his point of view, you may think otherwise. There is a scene in the film where Thanos and Dr. Stephen Strange are having a conversation. Thanos uses the stone of reality to show Strange that he was born on the planet Titan and how it's corruption led to its demise. He reflects his possible solutions on how he could've saved Titan, but it's genocide. Strange says to Thanos, "Congratulations, you're a prophet." "I'm a survivor." Thanos states. "Who wants to murder trillions!" says Strange. Thanos says to Strange, "With all six stones I can simply snap my fingers, and they would all cease to exist and I call that mercy." This shows that in Thanos' eyes, he is doing the universe a favor. He believes that the universe needs to be balanced, even if it comes down to wiping out half the universe with a single snap of his fingers.

Author: mattqbsky
Review_Title: A Culmination of Ten Years Work Results in a Masterpiece
Review:
It's not often that movie franchise with 18 movies already creates something fresh. Avengers: Infinity War is exactlty that. A fresh creation from the Russo brothers who excellenty craft a film of immense build up and hype around it. They effortlessly get the best from their cast, many of whom who have not had on screen interactions together. The result is a massively enjoyable journey in which you're given moments of hunour, joy and the inevitable sadness. The on screen cast of what may be the best ensemble cast of our time, works incredibly well with chemistry which for some takes two or three films to develop. Infinity war delivers, whether your a lifelong fan of marvel stemming from the comics, the MCU or quite simply a one off movie goer this film is a delight. Marvel have created something fresh and just as exciting, if not more so than the first Iron Man movie ten years ago. Thanos is without a doubt the best MCU villain, making all who come before him look like a weak pretender and he the true big bad. The Russo Brother's portrayal of him is perfect, instead of him being 'Mad' the way he is in the comics. They attempt to humanise the mad titan, almost making you undertand his goals, almost. Josh Brolin's performance is brilliant, his delivery of the lines makes Thanos a modern day Darth Vader. A being torn by his beliefs into something so twisted that nothing will get in his way. The tone of the film was perfect, hopelesness was looming over all but despite this our Avengers never give up. For the pressue from inside and outside for this film to succeed, the Russo brothers deliver an effortlessly crafted masterpiece. That has rasied the bar for all over superhero films that will follow it. Bravo to all involved. As this behemoth culmination of work, leads to the best superhero film of our time. 
Well, until Avengers 4 perhaps. 
Go and see this film, you will not be dissatisfied.

Review_Title: Good movie but doesn't add up.

The villains that serveThanos are more evil than he was. That doesn't really add up either. I mean, his motives are evil but his path to them is weak at best. I have to say that the Guardians of the Galaxy are as whacky and funny as ever but when it comes down to it, they get serious and tough. Chris Pratt as Star-Lord was absolutely the best character in the film. Definitely was worth seeing but these movie creators need some "fan input" when creating these stories/movies. Maybe next time huh?

Author: canocanene
Review:
If you're not a fan of the MCU or Marvel you'll be losing of the best of experience you could ever have at the cinema. The Russo Brothers made a masterpiece. The best movie in the entire Marvel Cinematic Universe. 
Right off the bat, the movie starts with a lot of power and engages you immediately, there's time to breathe during the first half with a joke here and there but after that hour has passed, the tension just keeps on building and it doesn't break even after the movie has ended. 
Josh Brolin was an amazing Thanos, as he nails the role so perfectly. Always the most overpowering, intimidating and fear-provoking character in the room. This is the first time you can feel that the Avengers are going to have a struggle finishing their task and lose some of their integrants knowing they have to give it their all due to what there's at stake.
Every single actor in this movie (Downey Jr., Cumberbatch, Holland, Ruffalo, Olsen, Johansson, Pratt, Bautista, etc.) does their respective character so well and the outstanding dialogue just makes it that much better of a performance. Got to give props for the Russo Brothers at how they manage to handle every single Avenger sufficient screen-time without leaving us needing more or less of one superhero with already an enormous cast.
One of the things I loved and hated about this movie was ending. The finale was such an amazing part of the story. You literally cannot know what's going to happen after the events presented in this film which makes it that much better.
All and all, this has become one my favorites. Definitely going to watch it again at the theater and must say to you for you to do so as well. Probably a movie we won't ever get again in years to come.

Author: lolliamstretton
Review: What can i say about infinity wars that hasn't been said before. It's the first part of the epic conclusion to the previous 10 years of story telling. It features attention to detail like no other film, with plot points that have been worked on over the course of those 10 years. The only thing i can say honestly is that it completely changes the face of superhero films, it draws you in, leaves you saddened, excited, scared and on the verge of tears, but yet we still want more, it leaves you hanging on the edge throughout the film, until the stunning and heart wrenching conclusion leaves you hungry for more. bravo Russo brothers, you've created a masterpiece.
